original: sems la yang de ltar smon la /
analyzed: sems la yang de ltar smon la /
translated: They also wish the same for their minds.

original: sems can 'di dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal pa mnyam par skyes pas sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis sprul te /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal pa mnyam par skyes pas sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis sprul te /
translated: “These sentient beings have been born here with the same fortune as me. I have emanated these sentient beings.

original: bdag ni sems can 'di dag gi dbang phyug dang / byed pa po dang / sprul pa po dang / 'byin pa po dang / 'byin byed dang / dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur pa yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can 'di dag gi dbang phyug dang / byed pa po dang / sprul pa po dang / 'byin pa po dang / 'byin byed dang / dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur pa yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: I am the lord, the maker, the emanator, the creator, the cause, and the source of these things.”

original: sems can de dag kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di gcig pu zla med cing g-yog med par tshe ring po dus ring por gnas pa mthong ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang 'di snyam du bdag cag gis sems can 'di gcig pu zla med cing g-yog med par tshe ring po dus ring por gnas pa mthong ste /
translated: “Those sentient beings also think, ‘We have seen this sentient being alone, without a companion or retinue, living a long time, for a long time.

original: sems can de dus ring mo zhig 'das pa dang / mi dga' bar gyur nas sems can @94b gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes kyang ci ma rung snyam du sred pa skyes so //
analyzed: sems can de dus ring mo zhig 'das pa dang / mi dga' bar gyur nas sems can @94b gzhan dag kyang 'dir bdag dang skal ba mnyam par skyes kyang ci ma rung snyam du sred pa skyes so //
translated: When a long time has passed, that sentient being becomes unhappy and thinks, “Wouldn’t it be good if other sentient beings were born here with the same fortune as me?” And they give rise to craving.

original: sems can 'di'i sems la yang de ltar smon la /
analyzed: sems can 'di'i sems la yang de ltar smon la /
translated: They also wish the same for their minds.

original: bdag cag kyang 'dir sems can 'di dang skal ba mnyam par skyes pas bdag cag ni sems can 'dis sprul pa ste /
analyzed: bdag cag kyang 'dir sems can 'di dang skal ba mnyam par skyes pas bdag cag ni sems can 'dis sprul pa ste /
translated: We were born here with the same fortune as this sentient being.

original: sems can 'di ni bdag cag gi dbang phyug nas dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur pa'i bar yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can 'di ni bdag cag gi dbang phyug nas dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur pa'i bar yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: This sentient being is our lord, up to the cause of things.’

original: de nas de dag gi nang nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig tshe zad cing bsod nams zad la las zad pas gnas de nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: de nas de dag gi nang nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig tshe zad cing bsod nams zad la las zad pas gnas de nas shi 'phos te /
translated: “Then, from among them, some sentient being, due to the exhaustion of life, merit, and karma, dies and transmigrates from that place.

original: de lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam phar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam phar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are born among humans with the same fortune.

original: de rim gyis nar son te /
analyzed: de rim gyis nar son te /
translated: They gradually grow up,

original: dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas skra dang kha spu dag bregs te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams yongs su smin nas skra dang kha spu dag bregs te /
translated: their faculties mature, and they shave their hair and beards,

original: gos kha dog bsgyur ba gyon nas dad pas yang dag par khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung zhing /
analyzed: gos kha dog bsgyur ba gyon nas dad pas yang dag par khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung zhing /
translated: put on the colorful robes of a renunciant, and with faith go forth from home to homelessness.

original: de dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung shing drung na 'dug kyang rung zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sems mnyam par gzhag pa ji lta bus sngon gyi lus rjes su dran par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhi ba la reg par 'gyur zhes
analyzed: de dgon pa na 'dug kyang rung shing drung na 'dug kyang rung zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sems mnyam par gzhag pa ji lta bus sngon gyi lus rjes su dran par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems kyi ting nge 'dzin zhi ba la reg par 'gyur zhes
translated: Whether they are in a monastery or at the foot of a tree,🔽they attain the mental meditative stabilization that is the cause of recalling their former bodies,

original: bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: and they touch the peace of mental concentration.🔽They think, “The Brahmā who emanated us is permanent, stable,

original: de 'di snyam du gang gis bdag cag sprul pa'i tshangs pa gang yin pa 'di ni rtag pa brtan pa ther zug pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gang gis bdag cag sprul pa'i tshangs pa gang yin pa 'di ni rtag pa brtan pa ther zug pa mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no //
translated: and enduring, and has the quality of not changing.🔽But those of us who were emanated by that Brahmā are impermanent, unstable, not enduring, and have the quality of changing.”

original: bdag cag gang dag tshangs pa des sprul pa de dag ni mi rtag mi brtan pa ther zug ma yin par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i dus kyang yod do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag cag gang dag tshangs pa des sprul pa de dag ni mi rtag mi brtan pa ther zug ma yin par 'gyur ba'i chos can yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de lta bu'i dus kyang yod do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that there are times when they think in this way.

original: de ltar na mthar 'dzin par lta ba des 'dod pa'i khams la yang dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na mthar 'dzin par lta ba des 'dod pa'i khams la yang dmigs pa yin te /
translated: In this way, extreme view also focuses on the desire realm.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba dag kun du 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba dag kun du 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that views focusing on the desire realm arise.

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo de nyid las /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa'i dra ba'i mdo de nyid las /
translated: Similarly, the Brahmajala Sutra states:

original: rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung bar smra ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung bar smra ba ste /
translated: Those who advocate causeless origination

original: sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams las zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa rnams las zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: from among those who speculate about the prior limit.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba kun du 'byung bar gsungs te /
translated: It also says that views focusing on the desire realm arise for those free of attachment.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba'i lha dag yod de /🔽sems can de dag 'du shes bskyed pas gnas @95a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba'i lha dag yod de / sems can de dag 'du shes bskyed pas gnas @95a * //
translated: In the form realm there are gods called “those of no thought.”

original: de nas shi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas shi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Sentient beings there generate thought and then die.

original: de nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig gnas de nas shi 'phos nas 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par 'ong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas sngon gyi lus rjes su dran par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no //🔽'di snyam du bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas sems can gang yang rung ba zhig gnas de nas shi 'phos nas 'di lta bur mi rnams dang skal pa mnyam par 'ong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba nas sngon gyi lus rjes su dran par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar snga ma bzhin no // 'di snyam du bdag dang 'jig rten 'di ni rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Then, when some sentient being dies from that realm and comes to this world, having the same fortune as humans, he remembers his former body, as before.🔽He thinks: “I and the world have arisen without a cause.”

original: de bas na bdag dang 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di snyam du bdag sngon ma byung ba las da bdag byung ba las na bdag dang 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no🔽snyam du sems pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag dang 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di snyam du bdag sngon ma byung ba las da bdag byung ba las na bdag dang 'jig rten ni rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no🔽snyam du sems pa yin no //
translated: Thus, “I and the world have arisen without a cause” means that he thinks: “Since I did not exist before and now I exist, I and the world have arisen without a cause.”

original: de ltar na bdag dang 'jig rten la dmigs pa na log par lta ba des 'dod pa'i khams la yang dmigs pa yin pas de rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba dag kun du 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag dang 'jig rten la dmigs pa na log par lta ba des 'dod pa'i khams la yang dmigs pa yin pas de rnams la 'dod pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i lta ba dag kun du 'byung bar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when observing the self and the world, that wrong view also observes the desire realm, so it is said that those views that observe the desire realm arise.

original: yang ji ltar na de rnams bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa de log par lta ba yin zhe na /🔽bdag dang 'jig rten gyi rgyu sngon byas pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na de rnams bdag dang 'jig rten rgyu med pa las kun du 'byung ba yin no snyam du sems pa de log par lta ba yin zhe na / bdag dang 'jig rten gyi rgyu sngon byas pa dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: How is it that they think the self and the world arise causelessly?

original: mi dge ba ma yin no snyam du de ltar yid kyis skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin no snyam du de ltar yid kyis skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is wrong view because they mentally deny that the cause of the self and the world is virtuous contaminated karma or nonvirtuous karma.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams la gzugs na spyod pa'i lta ba de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi skabs las bsams nas gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa ni ma
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba de rnams la gzugs na spyod pa'i lta ba de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig gi skabs las bsams nas gzugs na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa ni ma
translated: The phrase “because they are free from attachment to the desire realm” is stated in consideration of the context, which is that the afflicted view of the form realm arises for those who are free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: yin te / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: yin te / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase “the afflicted view of the form realm does not focus on the desire realm” is stated because they are free from attachment.

original: kha cig ni de dag 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lta ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig ni de dag 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lta ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Some respond to this by saying that these are not afflicted views that focus on the desire realm.

original: de dag ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de dag ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: They are distorted consciousnesses.

original: de dag ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi ltar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag gi ltar ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is illogical because they are by nature afflicted views.

original: bye brag tu smra ba na re yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba na re yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: Because they retrogress from them,

original: lha sbyin bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lha sbyin bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: like Devadatta.

original: dper na lha sbyin gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par gsol nas sdig pa'i bsam pa skyed pas rdzu 'phrul las yongs su nyams pa lta bu ste mdo las @95b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin gyis dge slong gi dge 'dun 'khor du bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das thugs las chung ngur bzhugs par gsol nas sdig pa'i bsam pa skyed pas rdzu 'phrul las yongs su nyams pa lta bu ste mdo las @95b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, Devadatta requested the Bhagavan to remain in a state of little activity and generated an evil thought to make the saṅgha of monks his retinue, and he fell from his superknowledges.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las ni 'di skad du de nas lha sbyin rnyed pa dang bkur stis zil gyis non te /
analyzed: mdo las ni 'di skad du de nas lha sbyin rnyed pa dang bkur stis zil gyis non te /
translated: Then Devadatta, overcome by gain and honor,

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la byin kyang ci ma rung /
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun bdag la byin kyang ci ma rung /
translated: thought, “Oh, it would be good if the Bhagavan gave the saṅgha of monks to me.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bdag gi 'khor du byas la /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bdag gi 'khor du byas la /
translated: I would make the saṅgha of monks my retinue🔽and request the Bhagavan to remain in a state of little activity and endowed with the bliss of meditative stabilization in this life.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan zhing thugs las chung ngur gnas par gsol lo snyam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa de skyes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dang ldan zhing thugs las chung ngur gnas par gsol lo snyam pa de lta bu'i sdig pa'i bsam pa'i rnam pa de skyes so //
translated: Such an evil thought arose in him.

original: lha sbyin gyis sems de skyes ma thag rdzu 'phrul de las yongs su nyams so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: lha sbyin gyis sems de skyes ma thag rdzu 'phrul de las yongs su nyams so zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: When Devadatta generated that thought, he immediately fell from that superknowledge.

original: de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba bskyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de dag kyang lta ba bskyed pa dang dus mnyam du yongs su nyams pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: In the same way, they fall from that view at the very time they generate it.

original: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no //🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa log par zhugs pa'i lta ba thams cad log par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag la bdag tu 'dzin pa ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / ril por 'du shes pa sngon du 'gro ba can no // 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa log par zhugs pa'i lta ba thams cad log par lta ba yin te /
translated: The view of the self is the antecedent of those views, because the view of the self is the antecedent of the notions of permanence and of a whole.

original: log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All wrong views are wrong views, because they are mistaken views that are included in the view of the perishable collection.🔽The other views are overesteemers.

original: gzhan dag ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar chad par lta ba sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar chad par lta ba sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the view of annihilation an overesteemers?

original: bstan pa 'di ni ming brtsan par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di ni ming brtsan par byas pa yin no //
translated: This teaching is based on the name.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are abandoned by the āryas.🔽The term “etc.” is not explicitly stated.

original: sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la mchog dang / gtso bor 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la mchog dang / gtso bor 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The view that the aggregates appropriated by views, etc. are supreme is called the overesteeming of views.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re mchog tu zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas kyang khyad par gyi don 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re mchog tu zhes bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas kyang khyad par gyi don 'dir 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Master Saṃghabhadra says that the term “supreme” is also applied to this meaning of distinction.

original: rgyu ma yin la rgyur lta ba'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin la rgyur lta ba'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it views what is not a cause to be a cause, it is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Because it views what is not a path to be a path, it is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.🔽Mere discipline and ritual

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ltar na yang thar pa thob par byed pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi ltar na yang thar pa thob par byed pa yin mod kyi /
translated: are not the cause of liberation.

original: de de tsam du ni ma zad pas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gi lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de de tsam du ni ma zad pas de'i phyir de las gzhan pa dag gi lta ba yin no //
translated: But that is not all, so it is the view of others than that.🔽Here the term “etc.” is not explicitly stated, it is said.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes grag go zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ni @96a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas so zhes grag go zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa ni @96a * //
translated: Holding morality and ritual as paramount is

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: holding morality and ritual as paramount.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs ni gzugs kyi phung pos bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Morality and ritual are included in the form aggregate.

original: de'i phyir phung po gzhan bsdu ba'i don du sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po gzhan bsdu ba'i don du sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra smos dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the term “etc.” would have to be stated for the purpose of including other aggregates.🔽Why is it not to be abandoned by seeing the origin?

original: ci'i phyir kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Because it is wrongly engaged with respect to the cause.

original: de byas pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag pa byed pa po //
analyzed: de byas pa'i rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang zhes bya ba ni bdag rtag pa byed pa po //
translated: Also, it is the manifest clinging to the self as the cause of that.

original: gcig pus byas pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig pus byas pa yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “alone” that is, it is the meaning of “done by one alone.”

original: de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong ba kho nas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is abandoned by seeing that alone means it is abandoned by seeing suffering alone.

original: 'o na gang me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pas mtho ris su skye ba'am /🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag par lta ba ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni rgyur mngon par zhen pa 'di ni des byas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gang me dang chur 'jug pa la sogs pas mtho ris su skye ba'am / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag par lta ba ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni rgyur mngon par zhen pa 'di ni des byas pa ma yin na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that one is born in the higher rebirths through entering fire and water and so on?🔽Or how is it that one views purity through ethics and ritual?

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar 'gyur /
translated: This is the conception of a cause, but if it is not done by that, how is it abandoned by seeing suffering?

original: de lta bas na 'di ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that it is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin alone.

original: bye brag tu smra bas /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say:

original: de yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: It is also to be abandoned by seeing suffering.

original: sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Because they wrongly engage suffering.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin zhe na des mtho ris su 'gro ba 'am 'dag par lta ba'i phyir ro //🔽slob dpon gyis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad sdug bsngal yin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin zhe na des mtho ris su 'gro ba 'am 'dag par lta ba'i phyir ro // slob dpon gyis ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te / zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad sdug bsngal yin pas /
translated: How do they wrongly engage suffering? Because they view it as going to or purifying a higher realm.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: Vasubandhu says: It follows that they would be objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly engage all contaminated things that are suffering.🔽They would be objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they are either by nature views that are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering or objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang /
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang /
translated: or they are not by nature views but

original: thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they wrongly engage all contaminated things that are suffering.

original: de lta yin na ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni kun 'byung ba la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then nothing would be objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin and so on.

original: gzhan 'di yang brjod dgos te /🔽yang na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhig yod pas de brjod dgos te /🔽gang @96b zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims la sogs pas 'dag pa nas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das pa yang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du lta ba de'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di yang rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur yid ches pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya
analyzed: gzhan 'di yang brjod dgos te / yang na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gzhan ji lta bu zhig yod pas de brjod dgos te / gang @96b zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims la sogs pas 'dag pa nas bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par 'das pa yang rjes su 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du lta ba de'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di yang rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur yid ches pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya
translated: This must also be stated.

original: ba'o zhes 'don pas so /🔽// / bam po sum cu rtsa dgu pa /
analyzed: ba'o zhes 'don pas so / // / bam po sum cu rtsa dgu pa /
translated: Or else, since it is said that there are other objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are views clinging to rules and ritual as supreme, one must state what they are.

original: bye brag tu smra bas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say that it is that which focuses on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa brgyad la dmigs par byed pa 'di ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa brgyad la dmigs par byed pa 'di ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is an object field of the eight wrong views and so on that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing and it is to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: slob dpon gyis de yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de yang sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Vasubandhu says, That is also wrongly engaged in the truth of suffering.

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa phra rgyas brgyad ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa yin zhing /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa phra rgyas brgyad ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa yin zhing /
translated: The eight negative tendencies that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, such as wrong view, are the focal object of clinging to rules and ritual as supreme.

original: de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are contaminated,

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pas bsdus pa yin la /
translated: they are subsumed by the truth of suffering.

original: de yang de la log par rtog pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de la log par rtog pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho nar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since that is also a misconception of that, it is to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering alone.

original: yang gang la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zag gang zhig la lam med do snyam du lam la dmigs pa la log par lta ba 'am /
analyzed: yang gang la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zag gang zhig la lam med do snyam du lam la dmigs pa la log par lta ba 'am /
translated: Again, if one thinks, “The path does not exist for any person,” then one observes the path and has wrong view or doubt.

original: the tshom yod pa'i gang zag de thar pa'i lam med do zhes lta ba 'am /
analyzed: the tshom yod pa'i gang zag de thar pa'i lam med do zhes lta ba 'am /
translated: If one thinks, “There is no path to liberation,” or

original: the tshom za ba na ste /
analyzed: the tshom za ba na ste /
translated: if one doubts,

original: ci lam 'di yod dam med snyam du the tshom za ba na ji ltar log par lta ba des log par lta ba 'dis sam /🔽the tshom 'dis 'dag go snyam du yid ches par 'gyur zhing rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci lam 'di yod dam med snyam du the tshom za ba na ji ltar log par lta ba des log par lta ba 'dis sam / the tshom 'dis 'dag go snyam du yid ches par 'gyur zhing rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: “Does this path exist or not?” then how could one believe or think that wrong view or doubt purifies?

original: log par lta ba dang / the tshom kho nas de la 'dag par yid ches pa med do //
analyzed: log par lta ba dang / the tshom kho nas de la 'dag par yid ches pa med do //
translated: One does not believe that wrong view or doubt purifies.

original: 'on te thar pa'i lam gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'on te thar pa'i lam gzhan zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: If one holds and accepts another path to liberation,

original: 'on te grangs can la sogs pas brtags pa'i thar pa'i lam gzhan mchog tu bzung zhing blangs nas /
analyzed: 'on te grangs can la sogs pas brtags pa'i thar pa'i lam gzhan mchog tu bzung zhing blangs nas /
translated: then one holds and accepts another path to liberation imputed by Sāṃkhyas and so on as supreme.

original: 'di ni thar pa'i lam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni thar pa'i lam yin gyi /
translated: One thinks, “This is the path to liberation.”

original: sangs rgyas pa'i ni med do zhes smra'o zhe na /🔽de yang grangs can pas brtags pa de kho nas dag @97a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i ni med do zhes smra'o zhe na / de yang grangs can pas brtags pa de kho nas dag @97a * //
translated: We say that the purity of the Buddhist path is not like that.

original: par yid ches kyi /
analyzed: par yid ches kyi /
translated: The Sāṃkhya also believes that purity is due to just that which is imputed by the Sāṃkhya.

original: log par lta ba des na ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log par lta ba des na ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not due to that wrong view.

original: de'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de yang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs par mi 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore it is not established that the view grasping rules and ritual as supreme focuses on objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does it focus on?

original: grangs can pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i lam kho na la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs can pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i lam kho na la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: It focuses on the path imputed by the Sāṃkhyas and so on.

original: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas /🔽yang gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan 'di yang yod pas / yang gang zhig ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: This other fault also exists.🔽What is the view of annihilation that believes in purity?

original: log par lta ba gang zhig kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba de yang /
analyzed: log par lta ba gang zhig kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i log par lta bas dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba de yang /
translated: The view of annihilation that focuses on objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation.

original: ci'i phyir de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: Why are they not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa de ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is the overesteeming of morality and ritual as supreme not to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation?

original: de lta bas na don 'di ni brtag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na don 'di ni brtag par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, this point should be investigated.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa /
translated: Because it is impossible that the overesteeming of morality and ritual

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par yang mi srid la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par yang mi srid la /
translated: is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering,

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin du yang ha cang thal bal sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin du yang ha cang thal bal sogs pa'i nyes pa yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: and because the error of overextension would ensue if it were to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ;
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ;
translated: the overesteeming of morality and ritual

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di ni brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and the truth of the path.

original: slob dpon gyis the tshom bskur ba 'di byas kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis the tshom bskur ba 'di byas kyis /
translated: The master has raised this doubt,

original: rang gi gzhung lugs ni ma bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs ni ma bstan to //
translated: But the Vaibhāṣika system is not taught here.

original: gzhan dag na re rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung lugs la ltos nas de ltar byas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung lugs la ltos nas de ltar byas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: This is done in consideration of the Yogācāra system.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad du brjod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa brgya nyi shu rtsa brgyad du brjod de /
translated: Yogācāras state that there are 128 afflictions.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'di dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang ; lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas 'di dag 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang ; lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang /
translated: Just as there are ten negative tendencies to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering—the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, wrong view, clinging to those views as supreme,🔽clinging to rules and ritual as well as desire, anger, pride, and ignorance—

original: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba bcu yin pa de bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / 'gog pa mthong bas @97b spang bar bya ba bcu dang /
analyzed: the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba bcu yin pa de bzhin du kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu dang / 'gog pa mthong bas @97b spang bar bya ba bcu dang /
translated: so too there are ten to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, ten to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation,🔽and

original: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
analyzed: lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste /
translated: There are ten to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi bcu yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi bcu yin no //
translated: Thus there are forty views to be abandoned by the path of seeing that pertain to the desire realm.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba brtags pa ma yin pa dang / chad par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba drug ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba brtags pa ma yin pa dang / chad par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa zhes bya ba drug ste /
translated: There are six to be abandoned by the path of meditation: the view of the perishing aggregates that is not investigated, the innate view of annihilation, attachment, anger, pride and ignorance.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bzhi bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas bzhi bcu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus there are forty-six negative tendencies that pertain to the desire realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: There are forty-one that pertain to the form realm,

original: khong khro ba ma gtogs pa de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: khong khro ba ma gtogs pa de dag nyid yin no //
translated: which are the same as those just explained, except for anger.

original: gzugs na spyod pa dag ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa dag ji lta bar gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those that pertain to the formless realm are similar to those that pertain to the form realm.

original: de la kha cig lan 'debs par byed pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la kha cig lan 'debs par byed pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa thams cad sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Some respond to this by saying that all those that focus on contaminated states are wrongly engaged with suffering.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa 'di la smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa 'di la smra bar bya ste /
translated: We respond: This is not an overextension,

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa'i phyir /🔽ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa'i phyir / ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because they wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truths of suffering and so on.🔽They wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truths of suffering and so on.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa rnams sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Those that focus on contaminated states wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of suffering.

original: 'on kyang kha cig ni sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas log par zhugs pa yin la /🔽kha cig ni kun 'byung ba'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang kha cig ni sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas log par zhugs pa yin la / kha cig ni kun 'byung ba'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: However, some wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of suffering,🔽some wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of origin,

original: kha cig ni 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pas log par zhugs pa yin la /
translated: some wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of cessation,

original: kha cig ni lam gyi sgo nas log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni lam gyi sgo nas log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: and some wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of path.

original: de la gang dag sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa de dag ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gang dag sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa de dag ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Those that wrongly engage their objects in terms of the truth of suffering are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pas sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pas sdug bsngal gyi sgo nas sdug bsngal la log par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Also, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is a distorted engagement with suffering through the view of the transitory collection that apprehends the aggregates to be permanent and a self.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore it is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: lam la log par zhugs pa gang zhig gis 'di lta ste /🔽grangs can pa dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pas rang gi kun brtags pa'i lam bzung nas /
analyzed: lam la log par zhugs pa gang zhig gis 'di lta ste / grangs can pa dang / gcer bu pa la sogs pas rang gi kun brtags pa'i lam bzung nas /
translated: What is distorted engagement with the path?🔽It is the wrong view that generates the view that the path of the Saṃkhyas, Nirgranthas, and so on, which they themselves imagine,

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams la thar pa'i lam med do zhes log par lta ba skyed par byed pa'i log par lta @98a * //🔽ba de la yang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams la thar pa'i lam med do zhes log par lta ba skyed par byed pa'i log par lta @98a * // ba de la yang /
translated: is the path to liberation and that Buddhists do not have a path to liberation.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas mchog tu lta bar byed de /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas mchog tu lta bar byed de /
translated: Also, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism views that wrong view to be supreme.

original: de dag gi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de dag gi tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa 'di ni /
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism of those who hold such views

original: lam la log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig kun 'byung ba'i sgo nas log par 'jug par 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: lam la log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no // tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig kun 'byung ba'i sgo nas log par 'jug par 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: It is not an object abandoned by the path of seeing because it is wrongly engaged through wrongly engaging the path.

original: gang zhig 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yang med de /
analyzed: gang zhig 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par zhugs pa la log par zhugs pa yang med de /
translated: Also, it is not wrongly engaged through wrongly engaging the origin since there is no one who is wrongly engaged through wrongly engaging cessation.

original: de lta bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and the truth of path alone.

original: yang ji ltar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par mi 'jug ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i sgo nas log par mi 'jug ce na /
translated: How is it that it is not wrongly engaged through wrongly engaging the truths of origin and cessation?

original: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re /🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Master Saṅghabhadra says:

original: de'i lus su mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lus su mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is not abandoned by seeing the truths of origin and cessation because it is untenable that it is their body.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par zhen pa dang / lam ma yin pa la las du mngon par zhen pa yin na ;🔽kun 'byung ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par mngon par zhen pas ni 'di rgyu med pa las skye bar lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur mngon par zhen pa dang / lam ma yin pa la las du mngon par zhen pa yin na ; kun 'byung ba la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par mngon par zhen pas ni 'di rgyu med pa las skye bar lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: The body of the view that holds morality and asceticism to be paramount is the manifest clinging to a cause in the absence of a cause and the manifest clinging to a path in the absence of a path.🔽The body of the view that denies the truth of the origin of suffering is the manifest clinging to purification in the view that denies the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: gang la rgyu'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la rgyu'i blo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one views the origin of suffering as arising without a cause, since one does not have the idea of a cause.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dag ni rjes su tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dag ni rjes su tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the truths of suffering and origin are not different,

original: des dbang phyug la sogs pa'i phung po yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des dbang phyug la sogs pa'i phung po yang spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the aggregates of a god such as Īśvara are also abandoned.🔽The body of the view that denies the truth of cessation is the manifest clinging to purification in the view that denies the truth of cessation.

original: 'gog pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par yid ches pas na 'gog pa'i thabs la rtog pa mi srid pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par yid ches pas na 'gog pa'i thabs la rtog pa mi srid pa kho na yin no //
translated: It is impossible to conceive of a method for cessation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'gog pa med do snyam du lta ba'i rjes la /
analyzed: 'gog pa med do snyam du lta ba'i rjes la /
translated: After the view that thinks, Cessation does not exist,

original: de'i thabs la rtog pa ni dan  med par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i thabs la rtog pa ni dan  med par 'gyur ro ;
translated: The method for that is not tenable.

original: / de ltar na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus su mi 'thad do //
analyzed: / de ltar na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lus su mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that the view grasping rules and ritual as supreme is a body.

original: de lta na lam med do snyam du lta ba'i rjes la lam du yongs su rtog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na lam med do snyam du lta ba'i rjes la lam du yongs su rtog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, it is not tenable that after the view that there is no path, one would conceive a path because it is not tenable that there is a path.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang mi 'gyur ro //🔽gang la @98b lam pa dmigs pa log par lta ba 'am /🔽the tshom thar pa'i lam med do snyam pa'i lta ba 'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang mi 'gyur ro // gang la @98b lam pa dmigs pa log par lta ba 'am / the tshom thar pa'i lam med do snyam pa'i lta ba 'am /
translated: Also, the view grasping rules and ritual as supreme would not be an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: the tshom za ba yod pa de ji ltar des 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yod pa de ji ltar des 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one has the view that the path is nonexistent, or the view or doubt that there is no path to liberation, how could one have confidence in purification through that?

original: 'phags pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par mngon par zhen pa ni 'thad pa kho na ste ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la 'dag par mngon par zhen pa ni 'thad pa kho na ste ;
translated: It is certainly tenable that one would adhere to the view that the path is pure through the wrong view that repudiates the ārya path,

original: de la rigs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rigs par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would adhere to that as a rational method.

original: des ni gang gis na de yang dag pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la rigs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba thar pa'i lam gzhan zhig snying la gzhag pa yin te /🔽thar pa'i lam gzhan med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / thar pa'i lam gzhan yod dam /
analyzed: des ni gang gis na de yang dag pa'i lam la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la rigs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ba thar pa'i lam gzhan zhig snying la gzhag pa yin te / thar pa'i lam gzhan med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / thar pa'i lam gzhan yod dam /
translated: This is because he places in his mind another path to liberation, by which he generates the rational mind that deprecates the correct path and generates wrong view.🔽It is rational to think that there is no other path to liberation,

original: 'on te med snyam du the tshom za ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pas so //
analyzed: 'on te med snyam du the tshom za ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa yin no snyam du sems pas so //
translated: and it is rational to think that there is doubt as to whether there is or is not another path to liberation.

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas ni 'dag pa'i thabs len par 'thad do //🔽des thar pa'i lam gzhan la dmigs pa snying la gzhag pa gang yin pa 'di nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba de'i yul yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas ni 'dag pa'i thabs len par 'thad do // des thar pa'i lam gzhan la dmigs pa snying la gzhag pa gang yin pa 'di nyid tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba de'i yul yin te /
translated: It is tenable that one who has a rational mind engages in the means of purification.

original: rang gi ris tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ris tsam la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which he places in his mind, another path to liberation, is the object of clinging to rules and ritual as supreme that is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path because it is the mere object of his own class.

original: 'on te de dang mtshungs par rtag tu rung ba'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya bar yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te de dang mtshungs par rtag tu rung ba'i phyir 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya bar yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is similar to that, then it follows that cessation is also to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path, because it is always suitable to be similar to that.

original: de ni gang gis na de yang dag pa'i thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la rigs par 'dzin par 'gyur ba thar pa'i gnas gzhan zhig snying la gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gang gis na de yang dag pa'i thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba la rigs par 'dzin par 'gyur ba thar pa'i gnas gzhan zhig snying la gzhag pa yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because it is not tenable that one who holds liberation to be a different object in the mind would be one who apprehends that as correct liberation and who holds nihilistic views.

original: de'i phyir de ni 'dra'o zhe na /🔽de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni 'dra'o zhe na / de ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore it is similar.

original: rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs na de la skur pa 'debs pa la 'dag par mngon par zhen pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs na de la skur pa 'debs pa la 'dag par mngon par zhen pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because if one apprehends both permanence and peace, it is untenable that one would adhere to the view that deprecates that as pure.

original: rdzas dang rdzas ma yin par rtog pa tha dad pa yod na 'ga' zhig thar pa'i thabs tshol bar byed la /
analyzed: rdzas dang rdzas ma yin par rtog pa tha dad pa yod na 'ga' zhig thar pa'i thabs tshol bar byed la /
translated: If one conceives of it as both a substance and a nonsubstance, then one would seek a method of liberation.

original: de la ni gdon mi za bar thar pa yod do snyam pa'i nges pa yod do /
analyzed: de la ni gdon mi za bar thar pa yod do snyam pa'i nges pa yod do /
translated: And one would definitely think, Liberation exists.

original: gang gdon mi za bar thar pa yod do snyam pa'i nges pa yod pa de ni de la rtag pa dang zhi bar yang 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang gdon mi za bar thar pa yod do snyam pa'i nges pa yod pa de ni de la rtag pa dang zhi bar yang 'dzin to //
translated: Whoever has the certainty that there is no doubt that there is liberation, he also grasps it as permanent and peaceful.

original: de lta ma yin na de don du gnyer ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de don du gnyer ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be tenable that he would strive for it.

original: de la dper na chos 'di pa rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas dang rdzas ma yin par rtog pa tha dad kyang rtag pa dang / zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir de la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni skyon @99a * //🔽kho na yin pa ltar /
analyzed: de la dper na chos 'di pa rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas dang rdzas ma yin par rtog pa tha dad kyang rtag pa dang / zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir de la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni skyon @99a * // kho na yin pa ltar /
translated: In that regard, for example, for those who are adherents of this Dharma, although there are different conceptions of nirvana as a substance or not a substance, because they are the same in grasping it as permanent and peaceful, the view that denies it is only a fault.

original: gang gis thar pa'i gnas cung zad cig sems la bzhag pa da yang rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa la rigs par 'dzin pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gis thar pa'i gnas cung zad cig sems la bzhag pa da yang rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin par mtshungs pa'i phyir thar pa la skur pa 'debs pa la rigs par 'dzin pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that one who holds that the denial of liberation is reasonable would be the same in grasping it as permanent and peaceful, even though he has placed a little of the state of liberation in his mind.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam las ngo bo nyid dang / rnam pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam las ngo bo nyid dang / rnam pa'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Morality, ritual and so on are different from the aryan path in terms of nature and aspect.

original: rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin pa la ni tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par rtag tu rung ba med do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang zhi bar 'dzin pa la ni tha dad pa med pas mtshungs par rtag tu rung ba med do //
translated: But since there is no difference in the way one holds to the view of permanence and peace, it is never correct to hold that they are the same.

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin pa srid kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin pa srid kyi /
translated: Therefore it is possible that clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: but it is not to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of cessation.

original: 'dir chos mngon pa pa rnams tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhig ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya bar rnam par 'jog / ji lta bu zhig🔽lam mthong bas spang bar bya bar rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: 'dir chos mngon pa pa rnams tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa gnyis su 'dod na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhig ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya bar rnam par 'jog / ji lta bu zhig lam mthong bas spang bar bya bar rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Here, if Abhidharmikas assert that clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is twofold, then how is clinging to rules and ritual as supreme determined to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of suffering and how is it determined to be abandoned by the path of seeing the truth of path?

original: gang zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims la sogs pas 'dag par yid ches pa de dag kyang lam ma yin pa la lam du ni lta'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig ba lang gi tshul khrims la sogs pas 'dag par yid ches pa de dag kyang lam ma yin pa la lam du ni lta'o zhe na /
translated: Those who believe that purity is achieved through the practice of cow behavior and so on view that which is not the path as the path.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gang zhig tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa sdug bsngal dmigs pa de ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Those that focus on the suffering of ethics and ritual are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: gang zhig lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa de ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa de ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Those that focus on the wrong engagement of the path are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni lam la log par zhugs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni lam la log par zhugs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Those that focus on ethics and ritual and so on are not wrong engagement of the path.

original: lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa ji lta ba de ltar gnod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa ji lta ba de ltar gnod par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And those that focus on wrong engagement of the path are not like that, since they are not objects that harm.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni rags pa dang ; ring du song ba ma yin pa dang / bsam pa brtan po ma yin pa dang / 'bad pa chung dus gzhom par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni rags pa dang ; ring du song ba ma yin pa dang / bsam pa brtan po ma yin pa dang / 'bad pa chung dus gzhom par bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus those that focus on ethics and ritual and so on are coarse, they are not distant, they are not firm intention and they are objects to be conquered with little effort.

original: lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa ni de las bzlog pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: lam la log par zhugs pa la dmigs pa ni de las bzlog pa ma yin pas so //
translated: The object of the four errors is not the opposite of that, because it is the path that is wrongly engaged.

original: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log bzhi tshan zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log @99b dag ni lta ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: lta ba gsum las phyin ci log bzhi tshan zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log @99b dag ni lta ba gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The four errors are the three views.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log go zhes bya ba ni bdag gir lta ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba las ni bdag tu lta ba phyin ci log go zhes bya ba ni bdag gir lta ba ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The view of the self is the error of the self, not the error of mine, because it is the view of the self.

original: gzhan dag na re thams cad yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba bdag tu lta ba dang ; bdag gir lta ba thams cad bdag tu phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thams cad yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba bdag tu lta ba dang ; bdag gir lta ba thams cad bdag tu phyin ci log pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Others say that all are errors.

original: bye brag tu smra bas ji ltar na bdag gir lta ba phyin ci log yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas ji ltar na bdag gir lta ba phyin ci log yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas ask, How can the view of mine be an error?

original: bdag gir lta ba la phyin ci log ces mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gir lta ba la phyin ci log ces mi bya'o //
translated: The view of mine is not called an error.

original: pha rol pos ji ltar na phyin ci log ma yin zhes bya ba smras pa dang / bye brag tu smra bas phyin ci log gi mdo las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pha rol pos ji ltar na phyin ci log ma yin zhes bya ba smras pa dang / bye brag tu smra bas phyin ci log gi mdo las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The opponent says, “How is it not mistaken?”🔽The Vaibhāṣika says, “Because it is not mentioned in the sūtra on mistaken views.”

original: mdo las bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log pa zhes 'byung gi / bdag gi snyam du zhes bya bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log pa zhes 'byung gi / bdag gi snyam du zhes bya bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sūtra says, “The view of the self is mistaken with respect to the selflessness of persons,” but it does not say, “The view of the self is mistaken with respect to the selflessness of phenomena.”

original: mdo las de skad du bstan pa ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: mdo las de skad du bstan pa ni yod mod kyi /
translated: The sūtra does teach that,

original: de yang bdag tu lta ba las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu lta ba las don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but it does not mean that the view of the self is different from the view of mine.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de las ni bdag kho na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dbang byed par lta ba ni bdag gir lta bar 'gyur bar bshad de /
analyzed: de las ni bdag kho na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dbang byed par lta ba ni bdag gir lta bar 'gyur bar bshad de /
translated: That sūtra explains that the view that the self alone controls the five appropriated aggregates is the view of mine.

original: bdag la lta ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: bdag la lta ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: It is not only the view of the self,

original: bdag gir yang lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: bdag gir yang lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: it is also the view of mine.

original: / bdag tu lta ba 'di nyid sgo gnyis can yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi sgo can te /
analyzed: / bdag tu lta ba 'di nyid sgo gnyis can yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi sgo can te /
translated: This view of self has two doors, i.e., the doors of self and mine.

original: rdzas su ni gcig yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su ni gcig yin no //
translated: It is one in substance.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sgo gnyis dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i sgo gnyis dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has two doors, i.e., the doors of the grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: 'on te bdag ces bya ba dang por bstan pa 'di las bdag gi zhes bya ba drug par bstan pa lta ba gzhan zhig yin na ni bdag gi zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te bdag ces bya ba dang por bstan pa 'di las bdag gi zhes bya ba drug par bstan pa lta ba gzhan zhig yin na ni bdag gi zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if the view of “mine” is different from the view of “self” taught first, then “mine” and “for the sake of mine” would also be different.

original: lta ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: lta ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: The view is different, i.e., the view of “mine” is different from the view of “self.”

original: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni gsum par bstan pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes bya ba ni gsum par bstan pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because “mine” is taught in the third line,

original: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni bzhi par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi phyir zhes bya ba ni bzhi par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and “for the sake of mine” is taught in the fourth line.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not accepted.

original: de lta bas na thams cad yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all are the view of self.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci log ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag @100a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa gzhan dag phyin ci log ma yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dag @100a * //
translated: The other afflictions are the afflicted view of the self, the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, and esteeming unworthy views.

original: las gzhan chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las gzhan chad par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are also the afflicted view of holding to a rite and ritual as paramount, and attachment and so on.

original: rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa dang / nges par rtog pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa dag gis phyin ci log rnams rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log pa dang / nges par rtog pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa dag gis phyin ci log rnams rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: They are established as errors by three causes: error, ascertainment, and superimposition.

original: gang la rgyu 'di dag ril gyis yod pa de dag ni phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang la rgyu 'di dag ril gyis yod pa de dag ni phyin ci log tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Those that have all three causes are established as errors.

original: gang la ril gyis med pa de dag ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la ril gyis med pa de dag ni phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Those that do not have all three causes are not errors.

original: de tsam zhig gis 'dag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis 'dag go snyam du dmigs pa la nges par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: de tsam zhig gis 'dag par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis 'dag go snyam du dmigs pa la nges par rtog par byed do //
translated: Because of that, they imagine that mere morality and ritual are pure.

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gcig tu phyin ci log pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni gcig tu phyin ci log pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the overesteeming of morality and ritual is not entirely erroneous,

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dag pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs 'dag pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: because morality and ritual are not the cause of purity.

original: 'ba' zhig gis mi 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gis mi 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: But they are not the sole cause.

original: 'di'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam pa nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the form of exaggeration in this?

original: de tsam gyis 'dag pa'i rgyu'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'dag pa'i rgyu'i dngos por sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they exaggerate that mere morality and ritual are the cause of purity.

original: gal te nges par rtog par mi byed pa phyin ci log ma yin na 'o na mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: gal te nges par rtog par mi byed pa phyin ci log ma yin na 'o na mdo las gsungs pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu ste /
translated: If that which does not imagine is not erroneous, then how is it that the Sūtra says:

original: 'du shes kyang nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang nges par rtog par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: “Sensation is not imagination, and imagination is not non-erroneous.”

original: sems kyang nges par rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyang nges par rtog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and the mind is not necessarily a determination.

original: phyin ci log bcu gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log bzhi po re re la 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log dag yod pas so //
analyzed: phyin ci log bcu gnyis yin no zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log bzhi po re re la 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log dag yod pas so //
translated: There are twelve inversions, because for each of the four inversions there are inversions of ideation, thought, and view.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du zhes bya ba nas rgyas par de bzhin du bdag med la bdag go snyam pa'i bar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du zhes bya ba nas rgyas par de bzhin du bdag med la bdag go snyam pa'i bar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, “In regard to the impermanent, the notion ‘permanent,’ and so on, and in the same way, in regard to the insubstantial, the notion ‘substantial.’

original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log gsum dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du de nyid gsum nas bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du de nyid gsum gyi bar yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log gsum dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du de nyid gsum nas bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du de nyid gsum gyi bar yin no //
translated: ” There are three inversions of ideation, thought, and view, the notion “happy” in regard to suffering, and so on, and the same three in regard to the impure, and so on, up to the notion “substantial” in regard to the insubstantial.

original: de la brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log gsum dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa yang gsum dang /
analyzed: de la brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la rtag go snyam du 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log gsum dang / bdag med pa la bdag go snyam pa yang gsum dang /
translated: The three mistaken recognitions, minds and views that permanence is impermanence, the three that think a self exists where there is no self,

original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du lta ba @100b phyin ci log dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du lta ba phyin ci log go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du lta ba @100b phyin ci log dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du lta ba phyin ci log go //
translated: the mistaken view that thinks suffering is happiness and the mistaken view that thinks the impure is pure.

original: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: bzhi ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: Four are to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: Which four?

original: gang dag sdug bsngal dang mi gtsang ba la 'du shes dang phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal dang mi gtsang ba la 'du shes dang phyin ci log pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Those that think suffering and the impure are.

original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log gnyis dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log kyang gnyis te bzhi'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log gnyis dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log kyang gnyis te bzhi'o //
translated: The two mistaken recognitions and minds that think suffering is happiness and the two mistaken recognitions and minds that think the impure is pure.

original: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba la zhes bya ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba la'o //
translated: The phrase the noble ones who are not free from passion refers to those who are stream-enterers and once-returners.

original: de dag ni phyin ci log dag tu yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba ni sems can gyi 'du shes kun du 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems can no snyam pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag gi 'du shes su yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci log dag tu yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba ni sems can gyi 'du shes kun du 'byung ba'i phyir dang / sems can no snyam pa'i sems kun du 'byung ba'i phyir de dag gi 'du shes su yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: Why don't you accept that they are mistaken? means, Why don't you accept that they are mistaken in their ideation and in their thought?

original: sems can la dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log dag kyang yod par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa'i 'du shes dang / sems phyin ci log dag kyang yod par ci'i phyir mi 'dod de /
translated: Why don't you accept that they have ideation and thought that are focused on sentient beings?🔽Why don't you accept that they have ideation and thought that are mistaken?

original: bdag tu phyin ci log pa dag kyang ci ste yod par 'dod par mi byed snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu phyin ci log pa dag kyang ci ste yod par 'dod par mi byed snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Why don't you accept that they have mistaken views?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bud med dang bdag la sems can du 'du shes pa med par ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bud med dang bdag la sems can du 'du shes pa med par ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skye bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is not reasonable for passion to arise in relation to a woman or a man if one does not have the ideation of a sentient being in regard to them.

original: de lta bas na bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log 'di dag kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log 'di dag kyang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, the misconceptions of the view and thought that conceive a self in the absence of a self are objects abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: rgyas par zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas par zhes 'byung ba'i phyir 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The term and so on indicates that the following should be applied:
