original: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam pa nas bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log de spong bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bde'o snyam pa dang / mi gtsang ba la gtsang ngo snyam pa nas bdag med pa la bdag go snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log dang / sems phyin ci log dang / lta ba phyin ci log de spong bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One abandons the misconception of the view, thought and view that conceive suffering as blissful, the impure as pure and the selfless as a self.

original: de lta bas na lta bas kun nas bslang ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na lta bas kun nas bslang ba kho na ste /
translated: Therefore they are motivated by view alone.

original: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang sems kho na phyin ci log yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang sems kho na phyin ci log yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Only the thought and view concomitant with view are misconceptions, not others.

original: lta ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lta ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are not concomitant with view.

original: 'di skad du 'du shes dang sems 'khrul pa 'di yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'du shes dang sems 'khrul pa 'di yang yod mod kyi /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows: “Yes, there is a confusion of perception and mind.

original: 'di ltar de ni lta bas kun nas bslang ba ma yin pas phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni lta bas kun nas bslang ba ma yin pas phyin ci log ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: But it is not a misconception, because it is not motivated by the view of the transitory aggregates.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i dus su 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @101a * //
analyzed: de'i dus su 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba @101a * //
translated: He says, “Because it is a mere confusion at that time.”

original: smos te / bud med mthong ba'i tshe 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smos te / bud med mthong ba'i tshe 'khrul pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is, because it is a mere confusion when one sees a woman.

original: de lta bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de'i dus su de ltar mthong ba'i 'khrul pa kho nas log pa'i shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni de'i dus su de ltar mthong ba'i 'khrul pa kho nas log pa'i shes pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the noble ones have a mistaken consciousness at that time only because of the confusion of seeing in that way.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / ri mo'i gnod sbyin la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo dang / ri mo'i gnod sbyin la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the confusion of a circle of fire or a picture of a yakṣa.

original: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo myur du bskor na de'i dus tsam du 'khor lo'i snyam du 'khrul pa skye'i phyis ni ma yin pa dang / ri mor bris pa'i gnod sbyin mthong nas de'i dus su gnod sbyin no snyam du 'khrul pa skye'i phyis ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na mgal me'i 'khor lo myur du bskor na de'i dus tsam du 'khor lo'i snyam du 'khrul pa skye'i phyis ni ma yin pa dang / ri mor bris pa'i gnod sbyin mthong nas de'i dus su gnod sbyin no snyam du 'khrul pa skye'i phyis ni ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, when a firebrand is whirled rapidly, the thought of a wheel arises at that time, not later; and when one sees a yakṣa drawn in a picture, the thought of a yakṣa arises at that time, not later.

original: 'phags pa ni 'di la nges par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba 'am gtsang bar 'khrul pa 'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni 'di la nges par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir bde ba 'am gtsang bar 'khrul pa 'am /
translated: The noble ones are certain in their investigation of this, so they are confused about pleasure or purity,

original: sems can du 'khrul pa'ang rung /
analyzed: sems can du 'khrul pa'ang rung /
translated: or they are confused about sentient beings,

original: yud tsam par zad kyi /
analyzed: yud tsam par zad kyi /
translated: but only for a moment.

original: 'di phyin ci log ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di phyin ci log ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not a misconception,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa la dran pa nyams pa cung zad 'byung mod kyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa la dran pa nyams pa cung zad 'byung mod kyi /
translated: because the Bhagavān said, “Monks, for an ārya śrāvaka who has heard much, a little forgetfulness of mindfulness may occur,

original: 'on kyang myur ba kho nas mi snang ba dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang myur ba kho nas mi snang ba dang / yongs su zad pa dang / yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: but it quickly disappears, is completely exhausted, and is completely eliminated.”

original: gal te 'du shes dang sems 'khrul pa de phyin ci log ma yin na phyogs gsum pa 'dzin pa gzhan kha cig gis /
analyzed: gal te 'du shes dang sems 'khrul pa de phyin ci log ma yin na phyogs gsum pa 'dzin pa gzhan kha cig gis /
translated: If that mistaken perception and mind were not erroneous, then it would be impossible for anyone to have a mind that is not mistaken.

original: 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bos zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'o na gnas brtan kun dga' bos zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: “Well then, the elder Ananda,” etc.

original: 'phags pa ngag gi dbang phyug gis gnas brtan kun dga' bo la /
analyzed: 'phags pa ngag gi dbang phyug gis gnas brtan kun dga' bo la /
translated: The noble lord of speech,

original: 'dod pa'i chags pas zil non phyir //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chags pas zil non phyir //
translated: because of being overcome by attachment to desire,

original: bdag gi sems ni gdung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni gdung bar 'gyur //
translated: my mind is tormented.

original: goo tam khyod kyi thugs brtse'i phyir //
analyzed: goo tam khyod kyi thugs brtse'i phyir //
translated: Gautama, out of compassion for me,

original: zhi ba mchog ni bshad du gsol //
analyzed: zhi ba mchog ni bshad du gsol //
translated: please explain the supreme peace.

original: zhes smras pa dang / 'phags pa kun dga' bo yi phyir //
analyzed: zhes smras pa dang / 'phags pa kun dga' bo yi phyir //
translated: The noble Ananda,

original: 'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
analyzed: 'du shes phyin ci log pa yis //
translated: because of having a mistaken perception,

original: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdungs //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems ni yongs su gdungs //
translated: your mind is tormented.

original: de phyir 'dod chags ldan pa yi //🔽rgyu mtshan sdug pa spang bar gyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'dod chags ldan pa yi // rgyu mtshan sdug pa spang bar gyis //
translated: Therefore, you who have attachment,

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: abandon the cause of what is attractive.

original: de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni de la yang phyin ci log yod pa nyid du yongs su bstan pas so //
analyzed: de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni de la yang phyin ci log yod pa nyid du yongs su bstan pas so //
translated: That is a stream-enterer, and this verse teaches that even he has error.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir sde pa gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lung dang 'gal bar byas la /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir sde pa gzhan gyi gzhung lugs kyang bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lung dang 'gal bar byas la /
translated: Since the treatises of other schools contradict the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas,

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs kyang sde pa gzhan @101b dag gi lung dang 'gal bar byas pa /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung lugs kyang sde pa gzhan @101b dag gi lung dang 'gal bar byas pa /
translated: and the treatises of the Vaibhasikas contradict the scriptures of other schools,

original: de'i phyir slob pas 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log brgyad po thams cad ma spangs pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir slob pas 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log brgyad po thams cad ma spangs pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: those in training do not abandon all eight types of wrong view and thought.

original: mdo dang 'gal ba yang spong bar byed do //
analyzed: mdo dang 'gal ba yang spong bar byed do //
translated: They also reject the contradiction with sutra.

original: mdo gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: mdo gang zhig ce na /
translated: What sutra?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis khungs su khyer te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis khungs su khyer te /
translated: The Vaibhasikas cite this as a source:🔽The sutra that states:🔽The noble shravakas who possess hearing

original: 'ong ba 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par de spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'ong ba 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par de spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: abandon this,🔽and so on, up to:

original: de dag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The noble truths.

original: 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log brgyad po de dag kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pas spong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems phyin ci log brgyad po de dag kyang sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pas spong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: The eight misconceptions of perception and thought are abandoned by knowing the four noble truths of suffering, etc., just as they are.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa de med par ni ma yin no zhes thabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes pa de med par ni ma yin no zhes thabs yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is not due to their absence, but rather to the correct teaching of the means.

original: thabs legs par brjod pa'i phyir mdo sde dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thabs legs par brjod pa'i phyir mdo sde dang 'gal ba med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Since the means are properly stated, there is no contradiction with the sutras.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the cessation of suffering.🔽This is the noble truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang mthong ba'i lam kho na'i dbang du mdzad pa ni ma yin no//
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de yang mthong ba'i lam kho na'i dbang du mdzad pa ni ma yin no//
translated: This is not stated with reference to the path of seeing alone.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If not, then what?

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad pa yang yin te /
translated: It is also stated with reference to the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i kho nas so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa la dmigs pa'i kho nas so //
translated: The path of cultivation is the path of the noble ones, which is exclusively focused on the truths that are free from impurity.

original: 'jug pa'i bye brag las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i bye brag las ni zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From the point of view of the distinction of engagement, means from the point of view of the distinction of mode.

original: khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba ma thob par zhes bya ba la /
translated: Obtaining a distinction that has not been obtained.

original: khyad par ni ting nge 'dzin de la brten pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag go //
analyzed: khyad par ni ting nge 'dzin de la brten pa'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag go //
translated: A distinction is a quality that is either contaminated or uncontaminated and that is supported by that meditative concentration.

original: de thob par bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de thob par bya ba ni mngon sum du bya ba'o //
translated: The obtaining of that is the realization of that.

original: khyad par thob par bya ba de ma thob cing mngon du ma byas par bdag gis khyad par thob par bya ba de thob po snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: khyad par thob par bya ba de ma thob cing mngon du ma byas par bdag gis khyad par thob par bya ba de thob po snyam pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: When one has not obtained and realized that distinction that is to be obtained, the thought “I have obtained that distinction that is to be obtained” is overesteeming of one’s view.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang mi ldan pa la bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam pa'i nga rgyal log pa'i yul can ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //🔽log pa'i nga rgyal dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal @102a * //

translated: The pride that thinks I have good qualities when one does not have good qualities is the pride of the domain of error.

original: dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between pride and excessive pride?

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni khyad par thob par bya ba dang 'dra ba'i yon tan thob pa'i bsam pa yin pas gzhi dang bcas pa yin no //🔽log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan med pa las bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa yin pas gzhi med pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal ni khyad par thob par bya ba dang 'dra ba'i yon tan thob pa'i bsam pa yin pas gzhi dang bcas pa yin no // log pa'i nga rgyal ni yon tan med pa las bdag ni yon tan dang ldan pa yin no snyam pa yin pas gzhi med pa yin no //
translated: Excessive pride is having the thought that one has obtained a good quality that is similar to one that is obtained. It has a basis.🔽The pride of the domain of error is thinking that one has good qualities when one does not have good qualities. It has no basis.

original: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The pride that thinks I am superior when one is not superior is the pride of superiority.🔽The pride that thinks I am equal when one is not equal is the pride of equality.

original: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa dang / bdag dman no snyam pa zhes bya ba la yang nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa dang / bdag dman no snyam pa zhes bya ba la yang nga rgyal gyi rnam pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The thought I am equal and the thought I am inferior are also types of pride.

original: lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal gsum ste zhes bya ba ni /

original: so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas lta ba la brten pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i dbang du byas nas lta ba la brten pa zhes brjod de /
translated: From the perspective of ordinary beings, they are called based on views.

original: sngar ni nga'o snyam du bdag tu lta ba 'byung la /🔽phyis ni mjug thogs su nga rgyal //
analyzed: sngar ni nga'o snyam du bdag tu lta ba 'byung la / phyis ni mjug thogs su nga rgyal //

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'di dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal 'di dag 'byung ngo //
translated: These are excessive pride, pride, and slight pride.

original: 'di dag kyang go rims bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag kyang go rims bzhin yin te /
translated: They also occur in this order.

original: ji lta zhe na /🔽bdag mchog yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i lhag pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / bdag mchog yin no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i lhag pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
translated: How is that?🔽The form of pride that thinks I am superior is excessive pride based on views.

original: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra'o snyam pa nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal yin no //

original: bdag dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pa'i cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin no ;
analyzed: bdag dman no snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi rnam pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la brten pa'i cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal yin no ;
translated: The form of pride that thinks “I am inferior” is the slight pride that is based on the afflicted view of the self.

original: / gnyis pa'i ni 'di las bzlog ste /
analyzed: / gnyis pa'i ni 'di las bzlog ste /
translated: The second is the opposite of that.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: It is to be connected in order,

original: bdag pas mchog yod do //
analyzed: bdag pas mchog yod do //

original: bdag dang mnyam pa yod do //🔽bdag pas dman pa yod do zhas bya ba ni lta ba la brten pa'i cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
analyzed: bdag dang mnyam pa yod do // bdag pas dman pa yod do zhas bya ba ni lta ba la brten pa'i cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal rnams so //
translated: “There is someone equal to me,”🔽and “There is someone inferior to me.”

original: gsum pa ni bdag pas mchog med do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bdag pas mchog med do //

original: bdag dang mnyam pa med do //
analyzed: bdag dang mnyam pa med do //

original: bdag pas dman pa med do zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du lta ba la brten pa'i nga rgyal dang / lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal rnams yin no //

original: rab tu byed pa las bstan pa yongs su bzung ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las bstan pa yongs su bzung ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu byed pa'i rkang pa las bstan pa yin no //
translated: The treatise declares: “One who is conceited about being superior to one’s inferiors or equal to one’s equals is called ‘conceited.’ ”

original: de yang gang zhig ce na /🔽sngar bshad pa ste chung ngu bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa 'am /
analyzed: de yang gang zhig ce na / sngar bshad pa ste chung ngu bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa 'am /

analyzed: nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid ni chung ngu bas bdag khyad par du 'phags pa 'am mnyam pa dang zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la goms pas las dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par byed pa'i phyir ro // 'gyod pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The entanglements of killing and so on are increased by wrong view because one becomes habituated to that and deprecates karma and its results.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽kun du 'gro pa dag ces bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i chos la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro // kun du 'gro pa dag ces bya ba ni thams cad du 'gro bas kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Regret is abandoned by the path of meditation because it focuses on phenomena that are abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The phrase “they are pervasive” means they are pervasive because they pervade all five types of objects.

original: rigs @103b lnga char la yang dmigs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs @103b lnga char la yang dmigs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “they focus on all five types of objects” means they focus on all five types of objects.

original: gzhan dag na re 'di dag gi mthus ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang skye'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas ris lnga char gyi rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'di dag gi mthus ris gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag kyang skye'o zhes 'chad par 'gyur bas ris lnga char gyi rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They are the cause of the five types of objects because they explain that other afflicted states arise through the power of these.

original: phra rgyas bcu gcig po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: phra rgyas bcu gcig po zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: The eleven negative tendencies

original: lta ba bdun ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lnga dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta ba gnyis po log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bdun no //
analyzed: lta ba bdun ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa lnga dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta ba gnyis po log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang bdun no //
translated: The seven views are the five views such as the view of the perishing aggregates that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and the two views that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin: wrong view and the view grasping an extreme.🔽

original: the tshom gnyis ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: the tshom gnyis ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: The seven views are the five views such as the view of the perishing collection that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the two views that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, namely, false view and the esteeming of views, and the two doubts that are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: ma rig pa gnyis ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kho na ste /🔽phyogs gcig gi sgo nas yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa gnyis ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag kho na ste / phyogs gcig gi sgo nas yin gyi /
translated: The two ignorances are only those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: mtha' dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtha' dag gi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not universal because they are not associated with the five views.🔽They are not universal because they are not associated with the five views.

original: ma rig pa gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ma 'dres pa de dag kho na kun du 'gro ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang dag kun du 'gro ba de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ma 'dres pa de dag kho na kun du 'gro ba yin gyi /
translated: The two ignorances that are universal are only those that are concomitant with the universal mental factors and those that are unmixed.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not concomitant with attachment and so on.

original: de ltar na phra rgyas bcu gcig ni kun du 'gro ba yin te /🔽phra rgyas dgu ni mtha' dag gi sgo nas yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na phra rgyas bcu gcig ni kun du 'gro ba yin te / phra rgyas dgu ni mtha' dag gi sgo nas yin la /
translated: Thus eleven negative tendencies are pervasive.

original: gnyis ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas yin pas so //
analyzed: gnyis ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas yin pas so //
translated: Nine are pervasive in terms of all objects and two are pervasive in terms of part of objects.

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of unmixed?

original: 'di skad du 'chad de /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'chad de /
translated: It is explained as follows.

original: 'grogs pa ni 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pa ni 'dres pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Accompanying is called mixed.

original: 'dres pa med pas nam 'dres te /
analyzed: 'dres pa med pas nam 'dres te /
translated: Since they are not mixed, they are unmixed.

original: logs shig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'di skad du bcom ldan 'das ma 'dres la /
analyzed: logs shig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das ma 'dres la /
translated: This means they are separate.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun ma 'dres zhes gsungs te /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyang logs shig la /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun ma 'dres zhes gsungs te / bcom ldan 'das kyang logs shig la /
translated: The Bhagavan said, “The Bhagavan is unmixed and the saṅgha of bhikṣus is unmixed.🔽”🔽The Bhagavan is separate and the saṅgha of bhikṣus is separate.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun yang logs shig go snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun yang logs shig go snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: 'dres pa med par spyod pas na ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa med par spyod pas na ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: They are unmixed because they are not practiced in a mixed way.

original: phra rgyas gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phra rgyas gzhan dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means they do not occur together with other negative tendencies.

original: rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di dag rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs par byed pa de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //🔽su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'di dag rang gi khams mtha' dag la dmigs par byed pa de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba zhes bya'o // su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni su zhig 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gis 'dag par yid ches par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Because they focus on all of one’s own realms, they are called pervasive.🔽Who would believe that the entire desire realm is pure?

original: 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa la @104a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag rgyu ma yin pa la @104a * //
translated: Who would believe that the entire desire realm is not the cause of purity?

original: rgyur yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rgyur yid ches par 'gyur zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: This is the context.

original: de lta bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin no snyam bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin no snyam bsam pa yin no //
translated: Therefore we assert that clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is not pervasive.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lan ni rang gi khams bye brag du mas tha dad pas ma lus pa mtha' dag cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi lan ni rang gi khams bye brag du mas tha dad pas ma lus pa mtha' dag cig car du dmigs so zhes ni mi zer ro //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas respond: We do not say that all of one’s own realms are simultaneously focused on because they are differentiated by many different types of realms.

original: 'on kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang cig car du dmigs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang cig car du dmigs te /
translated: However, all five types of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and so on up to objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are simultaneously observed.🔽

original: kun du 'gro ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba nyid yin la /
translated: However, all five types of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, from those abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering up to those abandoned by seeing the truth of the path, are simultaneously observed as objects of the view of the self.🔽They are called pervasive because they are objects of the view of the self.

original: kun zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa yin par lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa yin par lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The term all is considered to refer to types.

original: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag la'o //
analyzed: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dag la'o //
translated: The phrase in which there is the view of the self refers to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: de la bdag la sred pa yod de /
analyzed: de la bdag la sred pa yod de /
translated: Craving for the self exists there.

original: de dag ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the basis of the conception of the self.

original: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang la mchog dang dag par lta ba yod pa ste /
translated: In which there is the view of supremacy and the view of purity.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang la'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gang la'o //
translated: In which there is the view of supremacy and the view of purity refers to entities that are characterized by the five appropriated aggregates.

original: mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu lta ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of supremacy is the overesteeming of views.

original: dag par lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dag par lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The view of purity is the overesteeming of morality and asceticism.

original: de la don du gnyer ba ni sred pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba ni sred pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of craving is the desire for something.

original: kha cig de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod ces bya ba 'don te ;
analyzed: kha cig de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod ces bya ba 'don te ;
translated: Some read this as “there is the desire for that in that,”

original: dngos po de la gang zag de'i don du gnyer ba yod pa ni de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po de la gang zag de'i don du gnyer ba yod pa ni de la de'i don du gnyer ba yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and the meaning of that is that there is the desire for that thing by that person.

original: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas khengs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / nga rgyal dag kun du 'gro ba nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: des kyang nga rgyal du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas khengs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni sred pa dang / nga rgyal dag kun du 'gro ba nyid yin na'o //
translated: “ It also becomes pride” means that it becomes inflated through that.🔽If that is so,

original: sred pa dang nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid 'di gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: sred pa dang nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid 'di gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa'i phyir ci zhig gis spang bar bya ba yin /
translated: then since both the characteristic of craving and the characteristic of pride are objects abandoned by the path of seeing, such as the afflicted view of the self and objects abandoned by the path of meditation, by what are they abandoned?

original: gang gis spang bar bya ba ni ci zhig gis spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis spang bar bya ba ni ci zhig gis spang bar bya ste /
translated: What is abandoned by what?

original: ci mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin nam /
translated: Are they objects abandoned by the path of seeing?🔽

original: 'on te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Are they objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing or by the path of meditation?🔽This is the question.

original: gang dag gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la zhes bya ba nges pa 'di yin la bzhag nas 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gang zhig mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la zhes bya ba nges pa 'di yin la bzhag nas 'dri bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This question is asked on the basis of the following principle: Those that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de lta ma yin na @104b 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa kho na bzhin du 'di gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'dir dri ci dgos te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na @104b 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa kho na bzhin du 'di gnyi ga mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'dir dri ci dgos te /
translated: Otherwise, like the afflicted view of the self and so on, these two would be objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone, so there would be no need to ask this question.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dmigs pa can ma yin pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The afflicted view of the self and so on are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing or by the path of meditation.

original: de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: They are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone.

original: 'di la slob dpon gyis lan du /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon gyis lan du /
translated: In response to this question, the master Vasubandhu says:

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they focus on mixed objects.🔽If craving and pride focused on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing alone, they would be objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gal te sred pa dang nga rgyal dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa can kho na zhig yin par gyur na ni de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur na de lta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sred pa dang nga rgyal dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa can kho na zhig yin par gyur na ni de dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin par 'gyur na de lta ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de bas na 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dren ma la dmigs pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: Therefore they are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they focus on mixed objects.

original: lhag ma bsgom pas spang bya yin //
analyzed: lhag ma bsgom pas spang bya yin //
translated: The remaining are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: zhes bya bar mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar mtshan nyid nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their characteristics are ascertained.

original: yang zhes bya ba ni yang slob dpon 'di nyid kyis bzlog ste bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba ni yang slob dpon 'di nyid kyis bzlog ste bshad pa yin no //
translated: Again means that this master himself refutes this explanation.🔽They are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de gnyi ga zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is both of them.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they are generated by the power of view.

original: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni mthu'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i stobs bskyed pa ni mthu'o //
translated: The power of the view is its strength.

original: de la lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa'i ngang tshul can yod pas na de gnyis ni lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can no //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa'i ngang tshul can yod pas na de gnyis ni lta ba'i stobs bskyed pas bcug pa can no //
translated: Since these two are engaged by the power of the view, they are called “engaged through the power of the view.🔽”

original: de'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: They are the nature of that view.

original: de'i phyir de gnyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are objects abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: da ni bye brag tu smra ba nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: da ni bye brag tu smra ba nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis rang gi mtshan nyid pa yin gyi ;
translated: Now Vaibhasikas posit their own position: These two afflictions are specific,

original: spyi pa yin pa ni ma yin te zhes rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: spyi pa yin pa ni ma yin te zhes rang gi phyogs 'jog par byed do //
translated: but they are not general.

original: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la sred pa dang nga rgyal dag yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gang la bdag tu lta ba yod pa de la sred pa dang nga rgyal dag yod mod kyi /
translated: In those who have the view of self, craving and pride exist.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad la cig car yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad la cig car yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not specific afflictions that exist simultaneously in all beings.

original: de dag ni phyogs gcig pa la dmigs pa can yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni phyogs gcig pa la dmigs pa can yin no //
translated: They focus on a single aspect.

original: de lta bas na kun du 'gro ba dag ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun du 'gro ba dag ma yin no //
translated: Therefore they are not pervasive.

original: des na gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: des na gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba la dmigs pa de dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, those that focus on objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: lhag ma dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //🔽res 'ga' ni skal ba mi @105a * //
analyzed: lhag ma dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po // res 'ga' ni skal ba mi @105a * //
translated: The remaining are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i khams gcig la dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes they focus on one realm that is not of the same realm.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga la dmigs zhes bya'i /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga la dmigs zhes bya'i /
translated: Sometimes they focus on both.

original: res 'ga' ni khams gsum la dmigs so zhes de skad du ni ma bshad de /🔽'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa res 'ga' ni skal ba mi mnyam pa gzugs kyi khams sam /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni khams gsum la dmigs so zhes de skad du ni ma bshad de / 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa res 'ga' ni skal ba mi mnyam pa gzugs kyi khams sam /
translated: But it is not explained that sometimes they focus on the three realms.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams gcig na dmigs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams gcig na dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes beings abiding in the desire realm focus on one realm that is not of the same realm, either the form realm or the formless realm.

original: res 'ga' ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis la dmigs so //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams gnyis la dmigs so //
translated: Sometimes they focus on two realms, the form realm and the formless realm.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshangs pa de la bdag nyid dam bdag gi nyid du mi 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshangs pa de la bdag nyid dam bdag gi nyid du mi 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not apprehend them as I and mine.

original: tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The view that Brahma is a sentient being is not the afflicted view of the self.

original: gang gi phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang des kun nas bslang ba de'i phyir tshangs pa de la rtag par lta ba yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang des kun nas bslang ba de'i phyir tshangs pa de la rtag par lta ba yang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ma yin no //
translated: Since the extreme view is also motivated by that, the view that Brahma is permanent is not an extreme view.🔽What view is it?

original: 'o na 'di'i lta ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'di'i lta ba gang zhig yin zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa la sems can du lta ba dang / bdag tu lta ba'o //
translated: It is the view that Brahma is a sentient being and the view that he is a self.🔽This is not a view, it is a wrong consciousness.

original: 'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni log par dmigs pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni lta ba ma yin gyi 'di ni log pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ni log par dmigs pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa yin no //
translated: It is a wrong consciousness because it is a wrong apprehension.

original: log par dmigs pa'i shes rab thams cad lta ba yin par ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: log par dmigs pa'i shes rab thams cad lta ba yin par ni mi 'dod de /
translated: We do not assert that all wrong apprehensions are views.

original: rang gi lus kho na la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log gi shes rab ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
analyzed: rang gi lus kho na la bdag go snyam du phyin ci log gi shes rab ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin la /
translated: The wrong consciousness that thinks my body is a self is the afflicted view of the self.

original: des kun nas bslang ba'i rtag par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba yin par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: des kun nas bslang ba'i rtag par lta ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba yin par 'dod kyi /
translated: The view of permanence that is motivated by that is considered to be the extreme view.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: But other views are not.

original: gang zhig nga'o snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du gyur pa'i de kho na 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig nga'o snyam du ngar 'dzin pa'i rten du gyur pa'i de kho na 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin na /
translated: If the view of the transitory collection were the very thing that is the basis of the conception of i and mine,

original: tshangs pa chen po la sems can du lta ba ni nga'o snyam du ngar 'dzin ba'i rten du yang mi 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir / bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po la sems can du lta ba ni nga'o snyam du ngar 'dzin ba'i rten du yang mi 'gyur te / de'i phyir / bdag dang bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes bshad do //
translated: then the view of sentient beings as great Brahma would not be the basis of the conception of i.

original: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
analyzed: de dag dang ni lhan cig gang //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the view of the transitory collection is the basis of the conception of i and mine.

original: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'byung de'ang kun 'gro thob ma gtogs //
translated: The five views are concomitant with the five universal mental factors.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five universal mental factors are feeling, etc.🔽Obtainment is not like that, because its effect is not the same.

original: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams dang / thob pa de dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams dang / thob pa de dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gcig pa ma yin no zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Obtainment and the possession of that obtainment do not have the same effect, either in terms of karmic maturation or natural outflow.

original: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i chos kyi thob pa dag ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin par rnam par gzhag go//
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i chos kyi thob pa dag ni kun du 'gro ba ma yin par rnam par gzhag go//
translated: Therefore, the obtainment of omnipresent phenomena is not posited as omnipresent.🔽Because of that

original: @105b de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag kyang kun du 'gro ba yin par rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir mu bzhir bya'o //
analyzed: @105b de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dag kyang kun du 'gro ba yin par rnam par gzhag pa de'i phyir mu bzhir bya'o //
translated: means because coemergent states are also posited as omnipresent, therefore four possibilities should be formulated.

original: mu dang po ni ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu dang po ni ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni 'di dag ni kun du 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first possibility is future pervasive negative tendencies because they are the nature of omnipresent states.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus kun du 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus kun du 'gro ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not omnipresent due to the cause of omnipresence.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the future they are not posited as the cause of omnipresence.

original: gnyis pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i lhan cig 'byung ba rnams so zhes bya ba ni kun du 'gro ba dang lhan cig 'byung ba dag 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yin pa'i phyir kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They are pervasive causes because pervasive states that arise simultaneously with them are past and present.

original: kun du 'gro ba'i phra rgyas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i phra rgyas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not pervasive negative tendencies.

original: phra rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not by nature negative tendencies.

original: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag ni sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dag ni sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The third and fourth should be applied.

original: gsum pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i phra rgyas kun du 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The third is past and present pervasive negative tendencies.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The fourth is those not included in those,

original: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma 'ongs pa rnams dang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: that is, those that arise simultaneously with them in the future and obtainment and so on.

original: drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
analyzed: drug ni zag med spyod yul can //
translated: Six are the domain of uncontaminated states.

original: zhes bya ba ni drug kho na zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni drug kho na zhes nges par gzung ba yin te /
translated: This passage ascertains that only six are the domain of uncontaminated states.

original: 'di ltar / 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'dod chags min te spang bya'i phyir //
translated: Because they are objects to be abandoned, they are not attachment.

original: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
analyzed: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
translated: because they do not harm.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa mi rung bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa mi rung bas so //
translated: Thus, since attachment and so on are not compatible with the object of uncontaminated vows, they do not focus on uncontaminated vows.

original: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / the tshom dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyus te gcig go //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba dang / the tshom dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa gang yin pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa de ni ma rig pa'i phra rgyus te gcig go //
translated: The ignorance concomitant with those views and doubt and the unmixed ignorance are the three ignorances.🔽Three are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation and three are objects abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa med pa la dmigs pa gsum dang / de bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gsum po de dag nyid de drug pa dang sa na yod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa med pa la dmigs pa gsum dang / de bzhin du lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gsum po de dag nyid de drug pa dang sa na yod do //
translated: They exist on the six levels.

original: de'i spyod yul can gyi yul yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams la spyod yul 'gog pa dang lam de dag yod pas de'i spyod yul can dag ste /
analyzed: de'i spyod yul can gyi yul yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams la spyod yul 'gog pa dang lam de dag yod pas de'i spyod yul can dag ste /
translated: They are called objects abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path because they have the truths of cessation and path as their objects.

original: de rnams la go rims bzhin du gsum gyi spyod yul te /🔽dmigs pa ni rang gis pa'i 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams la go rims bzhin du gsum gyi spyod yul te / dmigs pa ni rang gis pa'i 'gog pa ste /
translated: They are, respectively, the objects of three.🔽The focal object of the three is cessation.

original: bdag nyid kyi sa'i 'gog pa yin no //🔽lam la chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa drug pa dang / rjes su shes @106a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sa'i 'gog pa yin no // lam la chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa drug pa dang / rjes su shes @106a * //
translated: The focal object of the three is the cessation of its level.

original: pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa dgu pa ni lam spyod yul can gyi phra rgyas gzhan gsum gyi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa sa dgu pa ni lam spyod yul can gyi phra rgyas gzhan gsum gyi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The six levels of the path of seeing that are compatible with Dharma knowledge and the nine levels of the path of seeing that are compatible with subsequent knowledge are the focal objects of the three other negative tendencies that have the path as their object.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How are they the focal objects of the three?

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa dgu pa yin la /🔽de rnams la 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa dgu pa yin la / de rnams la 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The negative tendencies that focus on cessation exist on nine levels from the desire realm to the summit of existence.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na yin zhing /
translated: The focal object of those that exist in the desire realm is the cessation of desire realm phenomena alone.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na'i bar du🔽yin no // lam ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i par du sa drug pa de thams cad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas gsum po de dag gi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo pa rnams kyi dmigs pa yang srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i chos kyi 'gog pa kho na'i bar du yin no // lam ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa dang / bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i par du sa drug pa de thams cad ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i phra rgyas gsum po de dag gi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Similarly, the focal object of those of the summit of existence is the truth of cessation of the summit of existence alone.🔽The path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge is the focal object of those three negative tendencies of the desire realm alone.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / nam mkha' dang / rnam shes dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa ste /
translated: The path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge is the focal object of those three negative tendencies of the four absorptions, the special absorption, unrestricted access concentration and the base of infinite space, the base of infinite consciousness and the base of nothingness.

original: sa dgu po de thams cad ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa kho na yin pa nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: sa dgu po de thams cad ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i phra rgyas rnams kyi dmigs pa kho na yin pa nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi dmigs pa'i bar yin no //
translated: All nine stages are the focal object of the negative tendencies of the first absorption stage, and so on up to the peak of existence.

original: yang ci'i phyir de dag gi spyod yul can rnams kyi dmigs pa 'gog pa ni rang gi sa pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir de dag gi spyod yul can rnams kyi dmigs pa 'gog pa ni rang gi sa pa kho na yin la /
translated: Why is the object of the sphere of the negative tendencies of the higher realms only the same stage?

original: lam ni sa drug pa 'am sa dgu pa yang de rnams kyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam ni sa drug pa 'am sa dgu pa yang de rnams kyi dmigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the path of the six stages or the nine stages the object of the negative tendencies?

original: 'di la gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'di la gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason for this, it says:

original: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lam ni phan tshun rgyu yin pas // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The path is the mutual cause.

original: ji ltar phan tshun gyi rgyu yin zhe na /🔽chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sa drug pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dang / 'og ma pa 'am /🔽gong ma pa 'am /
analyzed: ji ltar phan tshun gyi rgyu yin zhe na / chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam sa drug pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dang / 'og ma pa 'am / gong ma pa 'am /
translated: Why are they the mutual cause?

original: mnyam pa 'am /
analyzed: mnyam pa 'am /
translated: The path that is compatible with Dharma knowledge of the six stages is the cause of the other path compatible with Dharma knowledge, or the lower or higher or equal path.

original: khyad par can gyi lam rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyi yang rgyur 'gyur la rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sa dgu pa de yang de'i rgyu kho na yin par sbyar par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi lam rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyi yang rgyur 'gyur la rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sa dgu pa de yang de'i rgyu kho na yin par sbyar par bya ste /
translated: It is also the cause of the path of superior seeing that is the aspect of subsequent knowledge and the ninth level that is compatible with the aspect of subsequent knowledge is also its cause alone.🔽This is extensively explained in the Abhidharmakosa, where it states:

original: 'di rgyas par ni @106b sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du /🔽mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
analyzed: 'di rgyas par ni @106b sa dgu'i lam ni phan tshun du / mnyam dang khyad par can gyi yin //
translated: The nine levels are the mutual🔽antidotes of the nine levels.

original: zhes bya ba der bshad zin to //🔽de ltar na lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba der bshad zin to // de ltar na lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'i bar yin la /
translated: The focal object of the path is explained there.🔽Thus the focal object of those that focus on the path and are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the level of unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption and so on up to the level of the fourth absorption that is compatible with Dharma knowledge.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i bar yang lam la dmigs pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de rnams kyi dmigs pa nyid yin pa nas de bzhin du srid
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i bar yang lam la dmigs pa bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa de rnams kyi dmigs pa nyid yin pa nas de bzhin du srid
translated: The path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge and the level of unrestricted access concentration to the first absorption and so on up to the level of the base of nothingness is the focal object of those that focus on the path and are the level of the first absorption and so on up to the level of the base of nothingness.

original: pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi bar gyi dmigs pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
analyzed: pa'i rtse mo'i sa pa rnams kyi bar gyi dmigs pa yin no / // / bam po bzhi bcu pa /
translated: They are the focal object of the path of meditation of the desire realm.

original: gal te chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pas lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa log pa'i lta ba la sogs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad kyang phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pas lam la dmigs pa 'dod pa na spyod pa log pa'i lta ba la sogs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: If all states that are compatible with Dharma knowledge are mutually concomitant causes, then when desire realm wrong view and so on that focus on the truth of the path also focus on the truth of cessation and the truth of the path that are antidotes to the afflictions of the form and formless realms,

original: chos shes pa la yang dmigs par byed na go ci'i phyir log par lta ba la sogs pa de dag nyid rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la yang dmigs par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos shes pa la yang dmigs par byed na go ci'i phyir log par lta ba la sogs pa de dag nyid rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i lam la yang dmigs par mi byed de /
translated: why don't those wrong views and so on also focus on the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge?

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽gal te chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag ni phan tshun gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /🔽gal te chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dag kyang zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Because Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are mutually concomitant causes.🔽If Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are mutually concomitant causes, then why don't those wrong views and so on also focus on the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge?

original: rjes su shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pas de rnams de la dmigs par mi byed do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pas de rnams de la dmigs par mi byed do //
translated: Subsequent knowledge does not focus on them because it is not the antidote of the desire realm.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin yang dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin yang dmigs par byed do //
translated: Since Dharma knowledge is the antidote of the desire realm, it focuses on the desire realm even though it is not the antidote of the form and formless realms.

original: 'o na ni chos shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: 'o na ni chos shes pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: The treatise Attainment of Knowledge declares:

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin te //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin te //
translated: Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path

original: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is the antidote of the three realms.

original: chos shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: Therefore Dharma knowledge is the antidote of the form and formless realms.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The nature of that Dharma knowledge

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i log par lta bal sogs pa sa dgu pa'i dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i log par lta bal sogs pa sa dgu pa'i dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the focal object of the nine beginning with the afflicted view of the self of the form and formless realms.

original: de mtha' dag kyang gnyen po ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos shes pa de mtha' dag ni @107a * //
analyzed: de mtha' dag kyang gnyen po ma yin la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni chos shes pa de mtha' dag ni @107a * //
translated: That is not the antidote to all of that.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi gnyen po ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi gnyen po ma yin no //
translated: That Dharma knowledge is not the antidote to the form and formless realms.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: cung zad cig yin no //
analyzed: cung zad cig yin no //
translated: It is a small part.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag de dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la sogs pa chos shes pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag de dag gi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because the path of meditation subsumed by Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin are not antidotes to those realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi gnyen po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag gi gnyen po ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the antidote to the form and formless realms.

original: de'i phyir chos shes pa de ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos shes pa de ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore that Dharma knowledge is not the focal object of wrong view and so on that occurs in the form and formless realms.

original: gzhan yang mtha' dag gi yang ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mtha' dag gi yang ma yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the antidote to all of that.

original: chos shes pa de ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa de ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams mtha' dag gi gnyen po ma yin no //
translated: That Dharma knowledge is not the antidote of all the form and formless realms.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin de //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin de //
translated: Because it is said, “That Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path🔽is the antidote of the desire realm alone.”

original: zhes 'byung bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Therefore it is not the antidote of objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: ;'dir dang po med pa'i phyir dang / dang po rnams kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ;'dir dang po med pa'i phyir dang / dang po rnams kyi ma yin pa'i phyir dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here the phrase “because the first is absent and because it is not the first” is a summary.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams ni dang po sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa ji skad bshad pa'i gnyen po de nyid du med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams ni dang po sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa dag gzugs dang gzugs med pa ji skad bshad pa'i gnyen po de nyid du med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path is not the focal object of Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin because the first is absent, since that antidote of the form and formless realms explained previously is absent.

original: chos shes pa de mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag gi gnyen po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa ni de'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa de mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi dang po mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag gi gnyen po nyid ma yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa ni de'i sa pa ste /
translated: Dharma knowledge is not the antidote of the first objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that are concomitant with the view of the self and extreme view, because it is not the antidote of those that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and meditation that are concomitant with the view of the self and extreme view that focus on the phenomena element.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no //🔽de ltar na zag pa med pa la dmigs pa khams gsum pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sa pa'i log par lta ba la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ma yin no // de ltar na zag pa med pa la dmigs pa khams gsum pa /
translated: Dharma knowledge is not the focal object of those that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and meditation that are concomitant with the view of the self and extreme view that focus on the form and formless realms.🔽Thus it is established that the remaining eighty negative tendencies focus on contaminated states, since they are the eighteen that focus on uncontaminated states,

original: bco brgyad ma gtogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma brgyad cu ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: bco brgyad ma gtogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma brgyad cu ni zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: except for the three views that focus on the truth of path and the three views that focus on the truth of cessation.

original: spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob pa bcad pas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni thob pa bcad pas spang bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They would not be objects to be abandoned means they would not be objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that severs obtainment.

original: dper na dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa mngon par dad pa'i ngo bo ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yin pas /
analyzed: dper na dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa mngon par dad pa'i ngo bo ni yang dag pa'i lta ba yin pas /
translated: For example, since aspiration to virtuous dharmas is the essence of faith,

original: thob pa bcad pas spang bar bya ba @107b ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thob pa bcad pas spang bar bya ba @107b ma yin pa ltar 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir zag pa med pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not to be abandoned by the process of cutting off the acquisition of that which is to be abandoned.

original: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
analyzed: gnod mi byed phyir zhe sdang min //
translated: It is not hatred because it does not harm.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam dag ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po dgu'i mtshan nyid las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truths of cessation and path are beyond the nine aspects of malice.

original: de la zhe sdang med do//
analyzed: de la zhe sdang med do//
translated: Therefore, there is no hatred toward them.🔽It is not pride because it is pure in the highest sense.

original: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don du dag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir yang dag pa'i don du dag pa yin la /
translated: The truth of cessation is pure in the highest sense because it is the abandonment of the defilement of the passions.

original: lam yang 'dis don dam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dag pa yin pas /
analyzed: lam yang 'dis don dam par dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir don dam par dag pa yin pas /
translated: The truth of the path is pure in the highest sense because it is the means of attaining that purity.

original: gang zhig de nyid la dag pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims ngang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig de nyid la dag pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims ngang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to posit that one who considers these to be pure has the view that regards morality and asceticism as paramount.🔽It is not doubt because it is certain.

original: de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don du dag pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang / lam de dag ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni mchog kyang yin te zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don du dag pa'i phyir 'gog pa dang / lam de dag ni mchog yin no //
translated: Those two are also supreme.

original: dngos po dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin par rung na 'gog pa dang / lam de dag ni de lta bu yang ma yin pas de gnyis la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dman pa la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa yin par rung na 'gog pa dang / lam de dag ni de lta bu yang ma yin pas de gnyis la mchog tu 'dzin pa ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: It is proper that the view of holding as paramount is the apprehension of what is inferior as supreme, but since cessation and the path are not like that, the apprehension of those two as supreme is not the view of holding as paramount.

original: du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur /
analyzed: du ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur /
translated: How many are increased through their focal object?

original: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: du ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How many are increased only through concomitance?

original: du ni dmigs pa kho na'i sgo nas zhes nges par bzung nas dri bar mi byed pa ni 'di ltar gang dag dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni gdon mi za bar mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du ni dmigs pa kho na'i sgo nas zhes nges par bzung nas dri bar mi byed pa ni 'di ltar gang dag dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni gdon mi za bar mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should not ask how many are increased through their focal object alone, because those that are increased through their focal object are definitely increased through concomitance.

original: gang dag mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mtshungs par ldan pa kho na'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ba de dag ni dmigs pa'i sgo nas ma yin te /
translated: Those that increase only through concomitance do not increase through the focal object.

original: zag pa med pa dang skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas dag yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang skal pa mi mnyam pa'i sa la dmigs pa'i phra rgyas dag yin no //
translated: They are negative tendencies that focus on the uncontaminated and on levels that are not the same as one’s own level.

original: phra rgyas kyi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin nas de dag pa'i rkyen rnam ni de dag bskyed par bya ba la mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi don ni rjes su mthun pa'i don yin nas de dag pa'i rkyen rnam ni de dag bskyed par bya ba la mthun par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of negative tendency is concordant. The conditions for those negative tendencies are not concordant with generating those negative tendencies.🔽They are not concordant with those negative tendencies.

original: de dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la sogs pa de dag ni log par lta ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa la sogs pa de dag ni log par lta ba la sogs pa de rnams kyi rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not concordant with those negative tendencies such as wrong view.

original: rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub po rgyas par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub bag rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas na lus dang mthun @108a * //
analyzed: rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub po rgyas par mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dper na rlung nad can la kha zas rtsub bag rgyas par mi 'gyur ro zhes byas na lus dang mthun @108a * //
translated: For example, coarse food does not increase for those with a wind disorder.

original: par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar go ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur zhes bya bar go ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like the statement, “It is not seen.”

original: phyogs snga ma ltar na ni phra rgyas kyi don gnas thod pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma ltar na ni phra rgyas kyi don gnas thod pa'i don yin te /
translated: If it is as the opponent says, the meaning of “proclivity” is “to abide,”

original: de dag tu gnas mi thod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag tu gnas mi thod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
