translated: because it says, “They do not abide there.”

original: chos gang dang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang ngo //
analyzed: chos gang dang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa dang ngo //
translated: “Any phenomenon” refers to feeling and so on.

original: de yang de gnyis na med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal de yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de gnyis na med do //
analyzed: de yang de gnyis na med ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal de yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de gnyis na med do //
translated: “And that also does not exist there” means that that suffering also does not exist in the two realms of form and the formless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no cause for harming others.

original: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rgyu ni gnod sems la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rgyu ni gnod sems la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The cause for harming others is malice and so on,

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but that does not exist there.

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na 'di mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i nang na 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na 'di mchog yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i rnam pa'i nang na 'di khyad par du 'phags pa yin te /
translated: “Among the afflicted views, this is the worst” means that this is the most distinguished among the types of afflicted view.

original: ha cang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ha cang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not extremely reprehensible, is what is meant.

original: thar pa'i rgyu ni lam yin la chad pa ni rgyu med pa can du 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i phyir chad par lta ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas khyad par yod do //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyu ni lam yin la chad pa ni rgyu med pa can du 'dod pas 'khrul pa'i phyir chad par lta ba kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin pas khyad par yod do //
translated: Since they are mistaken, the view of annihilation is reprehensible.

original: rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag ngang bdag gi nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa yin
analyzed: rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams la bdag ngang bdag gi nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa yin
translated: Because it is confusion about one’s own substance means that the afflicted view of the self is confusion about one’s own substance because it grasps the appropriated aggregates that are included in one’s own continuum as the self and as mine.

original: la / mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de dag nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: la / mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang de dag nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir de kho na dang 'dra'o //
translated: The extreme view is also similar to that because it grasps those aggregates as eternal or annihilated.

original: lta ba de dag ji lta bar de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lta ba de dag ji lta bar de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ma rig pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as those views are, so too is ignorance that is concomitant with them.

original: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not engaged in the form of harming others.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te de dag ni pha rol po la gnod pa cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag lung du ma bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba skabs dang sbyar te de dag ni pha rol po la gnod pa cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: The phrase “the afflicted view of the self and the extreme views” is to be supplied here. They do not harm others in the least.

original: mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dag kyang de ltar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtho ris la sred pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal yang sbyin pa la sogs pa dang mi 'gal ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The craving for the heavens and the pride of thinking “I am” would also be indeterminate, because they are not incompatible with generosity, etc.,

original: rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi rdzas la kun du rmongs pa'i phyir dang / pha rol po la gnod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ma yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are confused about one’s own possessions, and because they are not engaged in harming others.

original: de ltar yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ltar yang mi 'dod de /
translated: But this is not accepted.

original: de lta bas na rgyu de dag gis 'di gnyis lung du ma @108b bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rgyu de dag gis 'di gnyis lung du ma @108b bstan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are not indeterminate for these reasons.

original: bsam pa 'dis sngon gyi slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god par byed do //
analyzed: bsam pa 'dis sngon gyi slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nye bar 'god par byed do //
translated: This thought is the basis for the former masters’ scriptural tradition that posits the innate identity view, etc.

original: rnam par brtags pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ser skya dang 'ug pa ba la sogs pa bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa ni mi dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ser skya dang 'ug pa ba la sogs pa bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de ni lung du ma bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The analysis is unwholesome: the analysis by the Sāṃkhyas, Aulūkyas, and so on that posits a self is not neutral.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: lung du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lung du bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is unwholesome.

original: de dag gi rnam par brtags pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba gang yin pa de yang mi dge ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par brtags pa'i mthar 'dzin par lta ba gang yin pa de yang mi dge ba yin te /
translated: The extreme view that is analyzed by them is also unwholesome.

original: ma bshad kyang de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de dang tshul mtshungs par rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma bshad kyang de sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir de dang tshul mtshungs par rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Even though it is not explained, it is understood to be the same as the identity view because it is preceded by that.

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir mi dge ba // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The rest are unwholesome here.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lhag ma nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lhag ma nye bar bzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Here means that the remaining afflictions of the desire realm are taken as the basis.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lhag ma nyon mongs pa can rnams ni mi dge ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i lhag ma nyon mongs pa can rnams ni mi dge ba kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: In the desire realm, the remaining afflicted entities such as the afflicted view of the self are nonvirtuous alone.

original: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin /
analyzed: du ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag yin /
translated: How many are roots of nonvirtue?🔽How many are not?

original: du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po 'di dag las zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: du ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa brgyad po 'di dag las zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that this is said with regard to the ninety-eight negative tendencies.

original: des na 'di skad du /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du /
translated: Therefore this is the reply:

original: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin //🔽zhes lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'dod na 'dod chags khong khro dang // rmongs rnams mi dge'i rtsa ba yin // zhes lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: In the desire realm, attachment, anger, and delusion are roots of nonvirtue.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / gti mug gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba kho na yin gyi phra rgyas gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang / gti mug gang dag yin pa de dag ni rnam pa lnga po thams cad kyang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba kho na yin gyi phra rgyas gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: In the desire realm, attachment, anger, and delusion are all five types and are roots of nonvirtue alone. The other negative tendencies are not.

original: rmongs zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: rmongs zhes bya ba ni gti mug gi rnam grangs te /
translated: Delusion is a synonym for delusion.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gti mug ma gtogs pa'i rmongs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa gti mug ma gtogs pa'i rmongs pa thams cad do //
translated: All delusion except for delusion associated with the afflicted view of the self and the afflicted view of holding to the extremes.

original: 'di mdo las ma smos par ji ltar de skad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di mdo las ma smos par ji ltar de skad ces bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that this is not mentioned in the sutra?

original: mi dge ba zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gcig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba zhes bya ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gcig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the context is nonvirtuous, and because it is taught as one part.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa de kho na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang zhig mi dge ba yang yin la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang yin pa de kho na mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yin par 'dod do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: For this very reason, it is said, “Only that which is nonvirtuous and a root of nonvirtue is asserted to be a root of nonvirtue.”

original: de kho na zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir log par lta ba la sogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
analyzed: de kho na zhes nges par bzung ba'i phyir log par lta ba la sogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma rnams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dag ma yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
translated: Because it is specified as “only that,” it is established that the remaining negative tendencies such as wrong view are not roots of nonvirtue.

original: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
analyzed: lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
translated: Three are roots of neutral states.

original: zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa @109a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phra rgyas dgu bcu rtsa @109a * //
translated: The ninety-eight negative tendencies are the roots of neutral states.

original: brgyad po 'di dag las lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni gsum yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brgyad po 'di dag las lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba ni gsum yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: These eight are the three roots of the indeterminate.

original: gsum zhes bya ba smos pa ni nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba smos pa ni nyi 'og pa'i gzhung lugs las khyad par du bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The word “three” is mentioned in order to distinguish the system of the Westerners from that of the Easterners.

original: gsum kho na yin gyi bzhi ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gsum kho na yin gyi bzhi ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that there are only three, not four.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: de ni sred dang ma rig blo //🔽zhes bya ba smos so //🔽de zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin par ston to zhes bya ba ni /🔽lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
analyzed: de ni sred dang ma rig blo // zhes bya ba smos so // de zhes bya ba ni lung du ma bstan pa yin par ston to zhes bya ba ni / lung ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba gsum //
translated: They are craving, ignorance, and mind.🔽The word “they” indicates that the three roots of the indeterminate are craving, ignorance, and mind.

original: zhes bya ba'i lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di kho nas sred pa dang ma rig pa dang blo dag khyad par du byas so zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di kho nas sred pa dang ma rig pa dang blo dag khyad par du byas so zhes ston par byed do //
translated: The word “indeterminate” in the statement “the three roots of the indeterminate” is the same as the word “indeterminate” in the statement “craving, ignorance, and mind.”

original: 'dir ni blo ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni blo ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin yang bye brag tu smra ba rnams lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Here, mind is not by nature an affliction, but Vaibhasikas assert that it is a root of the indeterminate.

original: sred pa gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag skyes pa'i tshe gzhal med khang la sogs pa la ste 'os 'os su sbyar ro //
analyzed: sred pa gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa dag skyes pa'i tshe gzhal med khang la sogs pa la ste 'os 'os su sbyar ro //
translated: Any craving that is neutral is craving concomitant with enjoyment when the absorptions and formless states arise, it is craving for the celestial mansion and so on.

original: ma rig pa gang cung zad gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa de dang / de bzhin du shes rab gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa gang cung zad gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa de dang / de bzhin du shes rab gang cung zad lung du ma bstan pa tha na rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang rung ste /
translated: Any ignorance that exists in the form and formless realms and any ignorance that exists in the desire realm concomitant with the afflicted view of the self and extreme view and so on and any wisdom that is neutral, even that which arises from karmic maturation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam pa dang / bzo'i gnas pa dang / sprul pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: In the desire realm, it is concomitant with the mind arising from karmic maturation, the mind governing demeanor, the mind governing creativity, the mind of emanation, the afflicted view of the self and extreme views.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa'o //
translated: It exists in the form and formless realms.

original: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab thams cad dang / rnam par smin pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab thams cad dang / rnam par smin pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab dag ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: All wisdom concomitant with affliction and wisdom concomitant with karmic maturation and so on are neutral.

original: rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it engages two aspects.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo ni rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyi ngo bo ni rnam pa gnyis nyid do //
translated: The nature of two aspects is two aspects.

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pas na rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pas na rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Because it engages two aspects, it engages two aspects.

original: de'i phyir the tshom ni rtsa ba yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir the tshom ni rtsa ba yin par 'os pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore doubt is not suitable to be a root.

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su 'jug pa'i sgo nas g-yo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it functions by way of the two modes of engaging objects.

original: khengs pa'i mtshan @109b nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid des mthon por 'jug ste /
analyzed: khengs pa'i mtshan @109b nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni khengs pa'i mtshan nyid des mthon por 'jug ste /
translated: The characteristic of haughtiness is the characteristic of pride. It engages objects in a lofty manner.

original: de'i phyir nga rgyal ni rtsa ba yin par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir nga rgyal ni rtsa ba yin par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, pride is not suitable to be a root.

original: rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang 'og nas gnas pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtsa ba rnams ni brtan pa dang 'og nas gnas pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba dang chos mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: The roots are firm and stable.

original: the tshom ni mi brtan pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin la ;
analyzed: the tshom ni mi brtan pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin la ;
translated: Doubt is not a root because it is not firm.

original: nga rgyal ni mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni mthon por 'jug pa'i phyir rtsa ba ma yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Pride is not a root because it engages objects in a lofty manner.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sred pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa'o //
translated: Craving for what is neutral means that which exists in the form and formless realms.

original: lta ba yang de dag na yod pa dang 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dag go //
analyzed: lta ba yang de dag na yod pa dang 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa'i 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i ngo bo nyid dag go //
translated: View means that which exists in those realms and that which exists in the desire realm that has the nature of the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: ma rig pa yang 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa thams cad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang 'dod pa'i khams na yod pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa kho na dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na yod pa thams cad do //
translated: Ignorance exists in the desire realm and is associated with the five afflictions there. It exists in the form and formless realms and is associated with all afflictions there.🔽Those who cultivate meditative concentration are dominated by craving, view, and pride.

original: sred pa dang lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa de ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
analyzed: sred pa dang lta ba dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dag yin zhes bya ba ni gang zhig ro myong ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan sgom pa de ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
translated: Those who cultivate meditative concentration associated with the experience of enjoyment are dominated by craving.🔽Those who, on the basis of meditative concentration, generate the view of permanence, etc., are dominated by view.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan la brten nas rtag pa la sogs par lta ba skyed par byed pa de ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan la brten nas rtag pa la sogs par lta ba skyed par byed pa de ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
translated: Those who, on the basis of meditative concentration, generate the view of permanence, etc., are dominated by view.

original: nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni gang zhig des bdag ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam du rlom pa ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ni gang zhig des bdag ni bsam gtan bzhi thob pa yin gyi gzhan dag ni de lta ma yin no snyam du rlom pa ste /
translated: Those who are dominated by pride are those who, on the basis of meditative concentration, think, “I have attained the four meditative concentrations, but others have not.”

original: de ni nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin no //
translated: They are dominated by pride.

original: de la 'di la sred pa shas che zhing sred pa lhag pa sgom pa'i ngang tshul yad pas na sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di la sred pa shas che zhing sred pa lhag pa sgom pa'i ngang tshul yad pas na sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: Those who are characterized by a predominance of craving and an excess of craving are contemplatives with a predominance of craving.

original: yang na sred pa shas che ba yang yid la bsam gtan pa yang yin pas sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
analyzed: yang na sred pa shas che ba yang yid la bsam gtan pa yang yin pas sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
translated: Or, they are contemplatives with a predominance of craving because they are contemplatives who have a predominance of craving.

original: sred pa lhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sred pa lhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “excess of craving” has the same meaning as “predominance of craving.”

original: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum po de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis te /
analyzed: lta ba shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de dang 'dra'o // de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan gsum po de dag kyang ma rig pa'i dbang gis te /
translated: Contemplatives with a predominance of views and contemplatives with a predominance of pride are similar to this.🔽They are due to the power of ignorance. These three types of contemplatives are due to the power of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa dang ldan pas de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang ldan pas de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are due to the power of ignorance and the possession of ignorance.🔽Therefore, ignorance is the root of the indeterminate.

original: de'i phyir ma rig pa yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'di dag kun du @110a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'di dag kun du @110a * //
translated: These are the types of affliction that exist for those who are absorbed in meditative development.

original: 'byung ba'i skabs ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba ste rgyu yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i skabs ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyi rtsa ba ste rgyu yin no //
translated: The occasion of the origination is the root or cause of neutral phenomena.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i skabs kyis glengs pa dang / mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i skabs kyis glengs pa dang / mdo las lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: The occasion of the neutral is mentioned, and the sutra mentions fourteen neutral things.

original: 'jig rten rtag pa zhig gam 'jig rten mi rtag pa zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten rtag pa zhig gam 'jig rten mi rtag pa zhig ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Are they permanent or impermanent?

original: ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci de dag dge ba yang ma yin la mi dge ba yang ma yin pas lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po dag tu ston tam zhes🔽bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: ci de dag lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci de dag dge ba yang ma yin la mi dge ba yang ma yin pas lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po dag tu ston tam zhes🔽bya ba yin no ;
translated: Are they taught as neutral things because they are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous?

original: / gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gzhag par bya ba nyid kyis lung bstan cing ma bshad pa'i 'dri ba de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: / gzhag par bya ba'i 'dri ba la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bshad do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gzhag par bya ba nyid kyis lung bstan cing ma bshad pa'i 'dri ba de ni lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: The question that is to be set aside is indeterminate because it is not explained by being declared.

original: de'i dngos po ni gzhi yin pas lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni gzhi yin pas lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: The basis of that is the thing, so it is the thing that is indeterminate.

original: de'i zhar la 'dri ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par nye bar 'god de /
analyzed: de'i zhar la 'dri ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par nye bar 'god de /
translated: The four types of questions that are raised in connection with that are set forth in detail.

original: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
analyzed: 'chi dang skye dang khyad par 'phags //
translated: Death, birth, superiority,

original: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
analyzed: bdag gzhan la sogs lta bu yin //
translated: like self, other, and so on.🔽Like death, like birth, like superiority, like self, other, and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba lta bu dang / skye ba lta bu dang / khyad par du 'phags pa nyid lta bu dang / bdag gzhan nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes grangs bzhin du mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba lta bu dang / skye ba lta bu dang / khyad par du 'phags pa nyid lta bu dang / bdag gzhan nyid la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes grangs bzhin du mgo gcig tu lung bstan pa la sogs pa'i dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: These are examples of the declaration of a single portion, and so on.

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba la 'chi ba dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya ba la 'chi ba dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: Death is an example of a question that should be answered categorically.

original: nyon mongs pa can dang bcas pa rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang bcas pa rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Those who are afflicted will be born,🔽but those who are unafflicted will not.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba la skye ba dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par phye ste lung bstan par bya ba la skye ba dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: Birth is an example of a question that should be answered by distinguishing.🔽In dependence upon what?

original: gang la ltos te 'dri zhes bya ba ni dris nas lung bstan par bya ba la khyad par du 'phags pa nyid dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la ltos te 'dri zhes bya ba ni dris nas lung bstan par bya ba la khyad par du 'phags pa nyid dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: Superiority is an example of a question that should be answered by asking for clarification.🔽Is a sentient being other than the aggregates?

original: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni gzhag par lung bstan par bya ba la bdag gzhan nyid dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam zhes bya ba ni gzhag par lung bstan par bya ba la bdag gzhan nyid dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: Self and other are an example of a question that should be set aside.

original: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mi rnams ni tshe thung ba tshe phyi mar 'gro dgos pa yin
analyzed: ci sems can thams cad 'chi bar 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes mgo gcig tu lung bstan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag mi rnams ni tshe thung ba tshe phyi mar 'gro dgos pa yin
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Monks, humans have short lives and must go on to the next life.

original: pas dge ba spyad par bya @110b ste ;
analyzed: pas dge ba spyad par bya @110b ste ;
translated: Therefore, you should practice virtue.

original: skyes pa la ni mi 'chi ba med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la ni mi 'chi ba med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: There is no escape from death for one who is born.”🔽If one asks, “Are sentient beings other than the aggregates or not?”

original: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na gzhag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci phung po rnams las sems can gzhan nam gzhan ma yin zhes 'dri na gzhag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: one should set that aside.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: the Bhagavān said,

original: kye goo ta ma ci lags /🔽des byas shing des myong ngam bram ze 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kye goo ta ma ci lags / des byas shing des myong ngam bram ze 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: “O Gautama, is it that which does and that which experiences?🔽Brahmin, that is indeterminate.

original: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngam bram ze 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngam bram ze 'di ni lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: Is it that which is done by another and that which is experienced by another? Brahmin, that is indeterminate.”

original: des byas shing des myong ngam zhes zhus na yang 'di ni lung du mi bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: des byas shing des myong ngam zhes zhus na yang 'di ni lung du mi bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs la /
translated: If he were asked, “Is it created by that and experienced by that?” he would say, “This is indeterminate.”

original: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngam zhes zhus na yang 'di ni lung du mi bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngam zhes zhus na yang 'di ni lung du mi bstan pa yin no zhes gsungs na /
translated: If he were asked, “Is it created by one and experienced by another?” he would say, “This is indeterminate.”

original: goo ta ma khyod kyis bshad pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhig lags /
analyzed: goo ta ma khyod kyis bshad pa 'di'i don ji lta bu zhig lags /
translated: Gautama, what is the meaning of what you have said?

original: bram ze des byas shing des myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bram ze des byas shing des myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Brahmin, to say “It is created by that and experienced by that” is eternalism.

original: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngo zhes bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas shing gzhan gyis myong ngo zhes bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni btsun par  ma'o //

original: nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa rnams ni skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa med pa rnams ni ma yin no zhes bya ba rnam par phye ste /

original: lung bstan dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lung bstan dgos par 'gyur ro //

translated: Therefore, anger is also a root afflictive emotion.

original: nyon mongs pa spyi pa ni lta ba dang the tshom la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spyi pa ni lta ba dang the tshom la sogs pa ste /
translated: The general afflictive emotions are the views, doubt, etc.

original: spyi pa'i'am spyir nyon mongs pa yin pas ni nyon mongs pa spyi pa dag go //
analyzed: spyi pa'i'am spyir nyon mongs pa yin pas ni nyon mongs pa spyi pa dag go //
translated: They are general afflictive emotions because they are afflictive emotions in general.

original: de dag ni khyad par med par bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni khyad par med par bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i dngos po la skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: They arise in regard to things that are the objects of experiencing pleasure, etc., without distinction.

original: de'i phyir de dag la dmigs te skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa spyi pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la dmigs te skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa spyi pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the afflictive emotions that arise in regard to them are called general afflictive emotions.

original: 'das dang nyer gnas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'o //🔽dngos po gang la 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams skyes la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: 'das dang nyer gnas zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'o // dngos po gang la 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal rnams skyes la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni khyad par med par brjod pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug pa yang rung ste /
translated: Past and present means past and present.🔽The phrase “with regard to any object of desire, anger, or pride” is elaborated in the Abhidharmakosa with the words “that have arisen,” because these afflictions are described without distinction.

original: ci rigs par sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar dus gsum pa'i dngos po gang la skyes pa ma spangs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi dngos po de dang ldan te /
analyzed: ci rigs par sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i bar dus gsum pa'i dngos po gang la skyes pa ma spangs pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag gi dngos po de dang ldan te /
translated: Any object of desire, anger, or pride that has arisen in the sixfold collection of consciousness, whether it is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering or by the path of cultivation, is related to that object of desire, anger, or pride that has not yet been abandoned.

original: thag pas glang bu phur pa la btags pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thag pas glang bu phur pa la btags pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is like a calf tied to a peg by a rope.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang zag thams cad la thams cad 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig kha cig la 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar gang zag thams cad la thams cad 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig kha cig la 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they occur in some of some.

original: @112b de'i phyir /
analyzed: @112b de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore,🔽those that have arisen and have not been abandoned in a person

original: gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i zhes de dag kyang khyad par du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la de skyes ma spangs pa'i zhes de dag kyang khyad par du byas pa yin te /
translated: are also specified.

original: ma spangs pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par smos pa 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag gis sngon dngos po de dang ldan par gyur pa de dag gal te spangs par gyur nas de dag gis de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma spangs pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par smos pa 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag gis sngon dngos po de dang ldan par gyur pa de dag gal te spangs par gyur nas de dag gis de dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Those that have not been abandoned are specified in this way: If attachment and so on that previously existed in a person have been abandoned, then they do not exist in that person.

original: spangs pas yul la rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pas yul la rgyas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have been abandoned, they do not increase in their object.

original: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas kun dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyi de dag ma 'ongs pas kun dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The future ones of the mental faculty are with all.

original: yid kyi zhes bya ba smos pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa rnams ni /
analyzed: yid kyi zhes bya ba smos pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa rnams ni /
translated: The mental faculty is mentioned because the five collections of consciousness are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: gzhan gyi rang du sa pa zhes gzhan du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang du sa pa zhes gzhan du rnam par gzhag par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be posited as other.

original: 'di ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba khyad par du bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dod chags dang khong khro ba khyad par du bya ba yin te /
translated: This is said with regard to attachment and hostility.

original: nga rgyal ni gdon mi za bar yid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni gdon mi za bar yid kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pride is definitely mental.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i de dag gis ni ris lnga pa dus gsum pa thams cad dang yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i de dag gis ni ris lnga pa dus gsum pa thams cad dang yang bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin ldan pa yin no //
translated: Those of the future are related to all five types in the three times, according to their type.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pas kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang gis zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal dang bcas pa ma yin pa de ni med de /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid pa'i nyon mongs pas kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / zhe sdang gis zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin pa dang / nga rgyal gyis nga rgyal dang bcas pa ma yin pa de ni med de /
translated: There is no contaminated thing that is not associated with attachment through the affliction of its own type, nor is there any that is not associated with hostility through hostility, or that is not associated with pride through pride.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dag ni dpag tu med pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa ma 'ongs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i dngos po thams cad la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dag ni dpag tu med pa zhig yod do //
translated: Attachment and so on that focus on all contaminated things of the future in accordance with their own nature are immeasurable.🔽Others, future attachment and anger, possess future things alone.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni dmigs pa la nges pa yin pas chos skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag🔽gis ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba ma 'ongs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni dmigs pa la nges pa yin pas chos skye bar 'gyur ba'i chos de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po kho na dang ldan te /
translated: Since all minds and mental factors are ascertained in their focal object, they possess future things alone that are objects to arise.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams kyi yul ni da ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga rnams kyi yul ni da ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the objects of the five collections of consciousness are present.

original: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba gzhan dag gis zhes smos kyi nga rgyal ma smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang khong khro ba gzhan dag gis zhes smos kyi nga rgyal ma smos pa ni /
translated: Others, future attachment and anger are mentioned, but pride is not mentioned because:

original: mthong spang bya nyid nga rgyal bcas //
analyzed: mthong spang bya nyid nga rgyal bcas //
translated: Pride is abandoned by seeing.

original: yid rnam shes kyi sa pa yin //
analyzed: yid rnam shes kyi sa pa yin //
translated: It is the level of mental consciousness.

original: zhes 'byung bas nga rgyal rnams yid kyi sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas nga rgyal rnams yid kyi sa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pride is on the level of the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga pa dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The five collections of consciousness also possess the three times.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yid kyi sa pa dag 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi zhes ston par byed do //🔽mi skye ba'i chos can de dag gis ni dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan te mi skye ba'i chos can de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i @113a * //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni yid kyi sa pa dag 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi zhes ston par byed do // mi skye ba'i chos can de dag gis ni dus gsum pa'i dngos po thams cad dang ldan te mi skye ba'i chos can de dag ni ma 'ongs pa'i @113a * //
translated: The word “also” indicates that not only those on the level of the mental faculty possess the three times.🔽Those who are not subject to further learning possess all things of the three times.

original: dus kho na na rnam par gnas la /
analyzed: dus kho na na rnam par gnas la /
translated: Those who are not subject to further learning are established in the future time.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa dag ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa dag ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But their objects are transferred.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni lcam pa bzhin du yul la mngon par phyogs pa kho nar gnas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa mi skye ba'i chos can rnams ni lcam pa bzhin du yul la mngon par phyogs pa kho nar gnas te /
translated: Those who are subject to affliction are not subject to further learning, and they remain fixed on the object, as if they were glued to it.

original: 'di ltar mi skye ba'i chos rnams ni dmigs pa la dmigs nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi skye ba'i chos rnams ni dmigs pa la dmigs nas skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: In this way, those who are not subject to further learning do not arise by taking the object as their object.

original: de'i phyir kha cig gi dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin no //🔽kha cig ni da ltar yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha cig gi dmigs pa ni 'das pa yin no // kha cig ni da ltar yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of some is past,🔽the object of some is present,

original: kha cig ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: and the object of some is future.

original: de dag ni dmigs pa mi skye ba kho nas mi skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dmigs pa mi skye ba kho nas mi skye ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not non-arisen because their object is non-arisen.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because conditions are incomplete.

original: grub pa'i mtha' ni tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' ni tshogs pa ni gnas skabs kyi 'bras bu can yin gyi rdzas kyi 'bras bu can ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The conclusion is that a collection has a temporary result, but not a substantial result.

original: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
analyzed: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //
translated: All the remaining ones possess all.

original: zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa'i ris du ma dus gsum pa dag gis kyang dus gsum pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga char dang ldan te yang dag par ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa'i ris du ma dus gsum pa dag gis kyang dus gsum pa'i dngos po rnam pa lnga char dang ldan te yang dag par ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The five types of things of the three times are possessed by the many types of views and so on of the three times. The meaning of the term is that they are truly possessed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa'i spyi pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i spyi pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, because they are general afflictions.

original: 'di dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga char la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad kun la 'byung ngo //🔽ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de dang ngam /
analyzed: 'di dag ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga char la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad kun la 'byung ngo // ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de dang ngam /
translated: These are all present in all, because they focus on the five appropriated aggregates.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas des ldan pa'am bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i phra rgyas des ldan pa'am bral ba yin te /
translated: How can past and future things be associated with or dissociated from those past and future negative tendencies?🔽How can they be posited as not abandoned and abandoned?

original: ji ltar na ma spangs pa dang spangs pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par gzhag /'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa 'du byed rnams dus su 'pho bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug
analyzed: ji ltar na ma spangs pa dang spangs pa'i gnas skabs su rnam par gzhag /'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid skye ba la sogs pa 'du byed rnams dus su 'pho bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug
translated: Because they possess the characteristics of conditioned states means that the characteristics of conditioned states such as arising and so on engage in order to cause conditioned states to pass through time.

original: ste / de'i phyir de dag rtag pa nyid ma yin par dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: ste / de'i phyir de dag rtag pa nyid ma yin par dam 'cha'o //
translated: Therefore we maintain that conditioned states are not permanent.

original: dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di'i mgo ni 'di skad ces 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te 'das pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di'i mgo ni 'di skad ces 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Monks, if this sutra were to begin with the words, “Past form,”

original: gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang mi rtag na da ltar byung ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: gzugs 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang mi rtag na da ltar byung ba lta ci smos /
translated: If past and future form are impermanent, what need is there to mention present form?

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de ltar lta ba ni 'das pa'i gzugs la lta bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa de ltar lta ba ni 'das pa'i gzugs la lta bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Noble listeners who possess learning do not view past form.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: They do not delight in future form.

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid byung bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang 'gog par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid byung bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang 'gog par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: They are engaged in becoming disenchanted with, becoming dispassionate toward, and being liberated from present form.

original: gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
translated: If past form did not exist,

original: @113b 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin no
analyzed: @113b 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na gang gi phyir 'das pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta ba yin no
translated: noble listeners who possess learning would not view past form. But because past form exists, noble listeners who possess learning do not view past form.

original: // gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: // gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
translated: If future form did not exist,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: The noble disciples who possess learning would not be without non-delight in future form.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med pa yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs yod pa de'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ma 'ongs pa'i gzugs la mngon par dga' ba med pa yin no ;
translated: But because future form exists, the noble disciples who possess learning are without non-delight in future form.

original: / dge slong dag gal te da ltar byung ba'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: / dge slong dag gal te da ltar byung ba'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na zhes bya ba rgyas par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If present form did not exist, monks, the noble disciples who possess learning would not be without delight in present form.🔽The noble disciples who possess learning would not be without non-regard for past form.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos la 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i tshe 'das pa'i yul la mi lta ba'i blo 'byung
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa 'das pa'i gzugs la mi lta bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni yul med pa'i phyir 'phags pa nyan thos la 'dod chags dang bral ba de'i tshe 'das pa'i yul la mi lta ba'i blo 'byung
translated: Because the object does not exist, the mind of the noble disciples who are free from attachment does not arise when they regard past objects.

original: bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is what it means.

original: gang gi tshe 'das pa'i gzugs la lta ba de'i tshe de la chags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'das pa'i gzugs la lta ba de'i tshe de la chags pa yin no //
translated: When one sees past form, one is attached to it.

original: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Delighting” means desiring.

original: dge slong dag gal te da ltar byung ba'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gal te da ltar byung ba'i gzugs shig yod par ma gyur na /
translated: “Monks, if present form did not exist,

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid byung bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir zhugs par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba 'di ni ma smos te /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa da ltar byung ba'i gzugs la yid byung bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir zhugs par yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba 'di ni ma smos te /
translated: the noble disciples who have heard the teachings would not enter into the present form in order to be disgusted with it, to be detached from it, and to be liberated from it.”

original: gnyi ga la rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la rab tu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not stated because both are well established.

original: gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma ni zhal nas gsungs pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma ni zhal nas gsungs pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Because of two” means that the former is taught as being spoken by the Buddha.

original: da ni rnam grangs kyi sgo nas yin gyi zhal nas ni ma yin pas khyad par yod do //
analyzed: da ni rnam grangs kyi sgo nas yin gyi zhal nas ni ma yin pas khyad par yod do //
translated: Now, it is stated from the point of view of synonyms, not from the point of view of what is spoken by the Buddha, so there is a difference.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la dmigs pa gang yin pa gnyis la brten par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The two, the past and future objects of the mental consciousness, do not serve as a basis.

original: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par bya ba yod na rnam par shes pa yin pas so //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes par bya ba yod na rnam par shes pa yin pas so //
translated: Therefore, because of the nonexistence of the object, consciousness itself does not exist, because if the object of consciousness exists, consciousness exists.

original: 'di la sgrub pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di la sgrub pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yod pa la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The proof here is this: The mental consciousness has only an existent object,

original: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i @114a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i @114a * //
translated: because it has the nature of an object,

original: phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like visual consciousness.

original: 'bras phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because of the effect.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin te /
translated: Past virtuous and nonvirtuous karma exists in its own nature,

original: smin pa'i tshe 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi bzhin no //
analyzed: smin pa'i tshe 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi bzhin no //
translated: because when it ripens, its effect arises, like present karma.

original: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The entity changes” means that the entity of the past, future, and present changes.

original: rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /🔽ma 'ongs pa da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'gyur ba na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor zhing da ltar byung ba'i dngos po ni 'thob bo //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don te / ma 'ongs pa da ltar byung ba'i dus su 'gyur ba na ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po 'dor zhing da ltar byung ba'i dngos po ni 'thob bo //
translated: “It does not change as substance” means that the specific characteristics of form, etc., do not change.🔽When the future becomes the present, it abandons its future entity and acquires its present entity.

original: da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa'i dus su 'gyur ba na da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor zhing 'das pa'i dngos po 'thob po //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang 'das pa'i dus su 'gyur ba na da ltar byung ba'i dngos po 'dor zhing 'das pa'i dngos po 'thob po //
translated: When the present becomes the past, it abandons its present entity and acquires its past entity.

original: gser zhes bya ba dang / 'o ma zhes bya ba'i dpe gnyis ni go rims bzhin du dbyibs dang yon tan gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar shis par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba dang / 'o ma zhes bya ba'i dpe gnyis ni go rims bzhin du dbyibs dang yon tan gzhan nyid du 'gyur bar shis par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The two examples of gold and milk are given to illustrate that shape and quality change, respectively.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed do //
translated: The transformation of the characteristics is described in terms of the acquisition of the entry of the characteristics.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos dus rnams su 'jug pa na 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
translated: Therefore, when a dharma enters the time periods, it is not that it does not possess the characteristic of the past

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ni mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid dang ni mi ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: and does not possess the characteristics of the future and present.

original: mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan par rnam par gzhag pa de las gzhan dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ni bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'jug pa thob pa ni mtshan nyid dang ldan par rnam par gzhag pa de las gzhan dang mi ldan pa ma yin pa ni bral ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The acquisition of the entry of the characteristics is not the non-possession of the characteristic that is established as possessed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: dper na skyes bu bud med cig la chags pa lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dper rjod par byed do //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bud med cig la chags pa lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dper rjod par byed do //
translated: he gives the example, “Just as a man who is attached to one woman is not unattached to other women.”

original: de bud med cig la lhag par zhen par gyur na /
analyzed: de bud med cig la lhag par zhen par gyur na /
translated: When a man is attached to one woman,

original: bud med lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags kyi thob pa kho na yod kyi kun du 'byung ba ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bud med lhag ma rnams la 'dod chags kyi thob pa kho na yod kyi kun du 'byung ba ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: The remaining women have the obtainment of attachment but not the manifest attachment.

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni gnas skabs la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed de ;
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni gnas skabs la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed de ;
translated: The transformation of state is described conventionally in dependence on states.

original: chos de gnas skabs gang na bya ba mi byed pa'i gnas skabs de na ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: chos de gnas skabs gang na bya ba mi byed pa'i gnas skabs de na ni ma 'ongs pa zhes bya la /
translated: When a phenomenon does not perform its function in a certain state, it is called future.

original: gang na byed pa de na ni da ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang na byed pa de na ni da ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: When it performs its function, it is called present.

original: gang na byas nas 'gags pa de na ni 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang na byas nas 'gags pa de na ni 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it has performed its function and ceased, it is called past.

original: de'i phyir gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas ma 'ongs @114b pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba nas 'das pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas skabs dang gnas skabs su phyin nas gnas skabs gzhan gyi sgo nas ma 'ongs @114b pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba nas 'das pa'i gnas skabs su phyin nas /
translated: Therefore, having gone to another state, it is called future, having gone to another state, it is called present, and having gone to another state, it is called past.

original: 'das pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar gzhan dang gzhan zhes ston gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ma yin te /
translated: It is taught that it is different from another state, but it is not different in substance.

original: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su phyin pa la mtshan nyid tha dad pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su phyin pa la mtshan nyid tha dad pa ni med kyi /
translated: But there is no difference in characteristic when it goes to the future, etc.🔽The words future, etc., are merely designations.

original: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar ston pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgrar ston pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dper na ri lu gcig ces bya ba rgyas par dper rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dper na ri lu gcig ces bya ba rgyas par dper rjod par byed do //
translated: To illustrate this, he gives an example:

original: dper na ri lu gcig gi sho mig tu bzhag cing gnas gcig tu bzhag na gcig ces bya la /🔽de bzhin du brgya'i sho mig tu bzhag na brgya /
analyzed: dper na ri lu gcig gi sho mig tu bzhag cing gnas gcig tu bzhag na gcig ces bya la / de bzhin du brgya'i sho mig tu bzhag na brgya /
translated: For example, when a single die is placed in the first square and one says one,🔽when it is placed in the hundredth square, one says one hundred,

original: stong gi sho mig tu bzhag na stong zhes bya ba bzhin te /
analyzed: stong gi sho mig tu bzhag na stong zhes bya ba bzhin te /
translated: and when it is placed in the thousandth square, one says one thousand.

original: gnas skabs tha dad la ltos nas yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad la ltos nas yin gyi /
translated: This is in dependence on different states,

original: de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but its own nature does not change.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bye brag las grangs rjod par byed pa'i ming gzhan 'byung bar zad do //
analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad pa'i bye brag las grangs rjod par byed pa'i ming gzhan 'byung bar zad do //
translated: In dependence on different states, other names are used to express number.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod ces bya ba ni /🔽snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan zhes brjod ces bya ba ni / snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The past and future are called other in relation to the present.🔽The present and future are called other in relation to the past.

original: snga ma 'das pa dang da ltar kho na la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o //🔽snga ma 'das pa dang / phyi ma ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas da ltar zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma 'das pa dang da ltar kho na la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa zhes bya'o // snga ma 'das pa dang / phyi ma ma 'ongs pa la ltos nas da ltar zhes bya'o //
translated: The future is called other in relation to the past and present.🔽The present is called other in relation to the past and future.

original: phyi ma da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa kho na la ltos nas 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyi ma da ltar dang ma 'ongs pa kho na la ltos nas 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The past is called other in relation to the future and present.

original: de bas na gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed do //🔽de nyid kyi phyir dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes bya la /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan dang gzhan du 'gyur ba pa ni snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos nas tha snyad rjod par byed do // de nyid kyi phyir dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes bya la /
translated: Thus, the theory of transformation of other into other is a conventional expression in relation to the past and future.🔽For this very reason, they cite the example:

original: bu mo zhes kyang bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dper rjod par byed de /
analyzed: bu mo zhes kyang bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba dper rjod par byed de /
translated: Just as a woman is called a mother in relation to her son and a daughter in relation to her mother.

original: dper na bud med gcig cig la bu mo la ltos nas ni ma zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: dper na bud med gcig cig la bu mo la ltos nas ni ma zhes kyang bya la /
translated: For example, a single woman is called mother in relation to her daughter and daughter in relation to her mother.

original: ma la ltos nas ni bu mo zhes kyang bya ba ltar snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma la ltos nas ni bu mo zhes kyang bya ba ltar snga ma dang phyi ma la ltos pa yin gyi rdzas gzhan gyi sgo nas ni ma yin no //
translated: She is called mother and daughter in relation to the former and latter, but not in terms of a different substance.

original: grangs can gyi phyogs la brlan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi phyogs dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i phyogs dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: grangs can gyi phyogs la brlan par bya'o zhes bya ba ni grangs can gyi phyogs dgag pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i phyogs dgag pa yin te /
translated: The position of the Samkhyas is refuted is the same as the refutation of the position of the Samkhyas.

original: grangs can gyi phyogs ni sngar bkag zin to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs can gyi phyogs ni sngar bkag zin to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The position of the Samkhyas has already been refuted.

original: gnyis pa btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi'ang dus 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis pa btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi'ang dus 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: The second, that of Bhadanta Ghoṣaka, also has a disordered time period.

original: 'das pa'i dus su 'dod pa gang yin pa de da ltar dang ma 'ongs par yang 'gyur ro //🔽ji lta zhe na 'das pa ni 'das @115a * //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus su 'dod pa gang yin pa de da ltar dang ma 'ongs par yang 'gyur ro // ji lta zhe na 'das pa ni 'das @115a * //
translated: Whatever is asserted to be past is also present and future.

original: pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: How so? The past possesses the characteristic of the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: The characteristics of the future and present do not not exist in it.

original: ldan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ldan pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is only endowed with the characteristic of the present.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
translated: The future is endowed with the characteristic of the future,

original: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that it is not endowed with the characteristics of the past and present.

original: da ltar yang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
analyzed: da ltar yang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang ldan la /
translated: The present is endowed with the characteristic of the present,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dag ni mi ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that it is not endowed with the characteristics of the past and future.

original: de lta bas na re re zhing mtshan nyid gsum char dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na re re zhing mtshan nyid gsum char dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because each is endowed with all three characteristics,

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar du 'gyur te /
translated: the past, future, and present are established.

original: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o ;
translated: The same should be applied to the future and present.

original: /'dir ci zhig mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: /'dir ci zhig mtshungs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is similar here?

original: skyes bu gcig 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: skyes bu gcig 'ba' zhig dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a single person is endowed with a single characteristic,

original: chos la mtshan nyid gcig yod kyi mtshan nyid gzhan gnyis med dam ci na /
analyzed: chos la mtshan nyid gcig yod kyi mtshan nyid gzhan gnyis med dam ci na /
translated: is it not the case that a dharma has a single characteristic and does not have the other two characteristics?

original: gang gi phyir de skad du dper rjod par byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de skad du dper rjod par byed /
translated: Why is it that it is said to be like that?

original: de lta bas na mtshungs pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshungs pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no similarity.

original: bzhi pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i yang ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i yang zhes bya ba ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i yang ngo //
translated: The Venerable Buddhadeva also says:🔽In one moment, the three times would exist.

original: dus gcig la dus gsum char du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus gcig kho na la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig rnam par gzhag pa yod pas so //
analyzed: dus gcig la dus gsum char du 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus gcig kho na la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig rnam par gzhag pa yod pas so //
translated: In one moment of the past alone, the past and future are posited as prior and subsequent moments.

original: de la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig pa dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la snga ma dang phyi ma'i skad cig pa dag ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: The prior and subsequent moments are the past and future.

original: skad cig ma snga ma ni 'das pa yin la dbus gyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung ba yin /
analyzed: skad cig ma snga ma ni 'das pa yin la dbus gyi skad cig ma ni da ltar byung ba yin /
translated: The prior moment is the past, the middle moment is the present,

original: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs pa yin pas 'das pa'i dus la dus gsum char du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi ma ni ma 'ongs pa yin pas 'das pa'i dus la dus gsum char du 'gyur ro //
translated: and the subsequent moment is the future. Thus, the three times would exist in the past.

original: bye brag tu smra bas /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na gsum pa bzang ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag thams cad kyi nang na gsum pa bzang ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, the third is the best of all.

original: ji ltar bzang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bzang zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is it the best?🔽Because it is said:

original: 'di ltar de'i ni bya ba yi//
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i ni bya ba yi//
translated: The activity of the three times

original: dus rnams rnam gzhag / bya ba yang mig la sogs pa'i bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus rnams rnam gzhag / bya ba yang mig la sogs pa'i bya ba ni lta ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The activity of the eye and so on is seeing and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yang rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yang rang gi dbang po'i spyod yul nyid yin no //
translated: The activity of form and so on is being the object field of the eye and so forth.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bya bas rnam par gzhag na mig de dang 'dra ba'i bya ba gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bya bas rnam par gzhag na mig de dang 'dra ba'i bya ba gang zhig yin te /
translated: If you say that the present is that which performs activity, then what is the activity of the eye that is similar to it?

original: gang zhig bya ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi las mi byed pa de ni de dang 'dra ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig bya ba'i mtshan nyid rang gi las mi byed pa de ni de dang 'dra ba yin la /
translated: That which does not perform its own function, which is characterized by activity, is similar to it.

original: de la yang lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba med na de ji ltar da ltar byung ba yin snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang lta ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba med na de ji ltar da ltar byung ba yin snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that also does not have the activity that is characterized by seeing, how could it be present?🔽It is that which produces and holds its result.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mig de ni rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin @115b cing 'phen pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa dang 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mig de ni rang gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'dzin @115b cing 'phen pa yang yin la /
translated: The eye holds its result, which is its natural outflow, and it projects its result.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa yang yin te /
translated: It produces its result.

original: mjug thogs su rgyu mthun pa'am skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byin to //
analyzed: mjug thogs su rgyu mthun pa'am skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu 'byin to //
translated: and subsequently, it yields its result, either natural outflow or the result of conscious effort.

original: lta ba'i bya ba mi byed kyang 'bras bu gzhan byed de /
analyzed: lta ba'i bya ba mi byed kyang 'bras bu gzhan byed de /
translated: Even though it does not perform the action of seeing, it performs other actions.

original: de la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir de ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu 'byin pa dang / 'dzin pa yod pa'i phyir de ni da ltar byung ba zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Because it yields its result and it holds its result, it is posited as present.

original: / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa /
analyzed: / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa /
translated: Past homogeneous and partially homogeneous🔽states also yield results.

original: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yang bsdu ste /
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa 'das pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu la sogs pa yang bsdu ste /
translated: The term also in the root text includes the result of karmic maturation and so on.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are stated:🔽One present and one past

original: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag / gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur //🔽zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dang 'das pa dag / gcig ni 'das pas 'byin par 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas /
translated: yield results through their action.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sgo nas byed pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa'i sgo nas byed pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they yield results through their action,

original: byed pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it follows that they would have action.
