original: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa de dag kyang da ltar bzhin du bya ba yod pa'i phyir da lta nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu la sogs pa de dag kyang da ltar bzhin du bya ba yod pa'i phyir da lta nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Therefore, since they would have activity like present states, it follows they would be present.

original: mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'chol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus their characteristics would be confused.

original: gal te khyod gang dag la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa gnyi ga yod pa de dag ni da ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te khyod gang dag la 'bras bu 'dzin pa dang 'byin pa gnyi ga yod pa de dag ni da ltar yin gyi /
translated: If you maintain that those states that possess both the activity of maintaining and producing results are present,

original: gang dag la gcig yod pa de dag ni ma yin no zhes smra na /
analyzed: gang dag la gcig yod pa de dag ni ma yin no zhes smra na /
translated: but those that possess only one are not,

original: de'i phyir bya ba phyed du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba phyed du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it follows that they would have half activity.

original: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to the context of the statement it follows they would be present.

original: bya ba phyed yod par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba phyed yod par thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It follows that they would have half activity.

original: 'das pa de dag phyed da ltar yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa de dag phyed da ltar yin no zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that those past states would be half present.

original: 'das pa de dag 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba zhig pa'i phyir 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: 'das pa de dag 'bras bu 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba zhig pa'i phyir 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang yang ldan la /
translated: Those past states would possess the characteristic of the past because the activity of maintaining results has ceased.

original: da ltar gyi 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang yang ldan te de nyid mtshan nyid 'chol ba'i nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang yang ldan te de nyid mtshan nyid 'chol ba'i nyes pa yin no //
translated: This is the fault of a confused characteristic.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa ni /
translated: The past and so on are asserted to be characteristics of the present.

original: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin /
analyzed: bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin la bya ba ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa yin /
translated: The past is the termination of an action, the future is the non-acquisition of an action,

original: bya ba thob la ma zhig pa ni da ltar yin no zhes bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: bya ba thob la ma zhig pa ni da ltar yin no zhes bya ba yin pas so //
translated: and the present is the acquisition of an action that has not terminated.🔽Who obstructs it?

original: bgegs su byed ces bya ba ni bgegs byed pa su yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgegs su byed ces bya ba ni bgegs byed pa su yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Who obstructs it?

original: gzhan dag na re bgegs su byed ces bya ba ni /🔽'di la bgegs byed pa su yod ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bgegs su byed ces bya ba ni / 'di la bgegs byed pa su yod ces bya ba ste /
translated: Others say: Who obstructs it?

original: bya ba'i yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is the object of the verb.🔽If you say it is the non-assembly of conditions,

original: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du rgyu dang mtshungs pa de ma thag pa la sogs pa rkyen rnams ma tshogs pa yin te /
translated: if you think in this way, the conditions such as the cause and the immediately preceding condition do not assemble.

original: de'i phyir dus thams cad du ni bya ba mi byed do snyam @116a * //🔽du sems na mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus thams cad du ni bya ba mi byed do snyam @116a * // du sems na mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to think that it does not perform its function at all times.

original: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that it always exists.

original: rkyen rnams ma tshogs par rtag tu ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: rkyen rnams ma tshogs par rtag tu ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable that it always exists when conditions do not assemble,

original: 'di ltar khyed ni rkyen rnams yod pa nyid du khas len la yod pa rnams ni zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed ni rkyen rnams yod pa nyid du khas len la yod pa rnams ni zhig pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that conditions exist and that which exists does not disintegrate.🔽If you say that it is not tenable that it performs a function in the past,🔽the past is the disintegration of action.🔽If you say that it is not tenable that it performs a function in the future,

original: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung bas bya ba 'das pa zhes bya ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar
analyzed: bya ba 'das pa dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni grub pa'i mtha' las bya ba zhig pa ni 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung bas bya ba 'das pa zhes bya ba dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar
translated: the future is that which has not yet arisen.🔽If you say that it is not tenable that it performs a function in the present,

original: byung ba zhes bya ba la /🔽yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam ci na gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du brjod /
analyzed: byung ba zhes bya ba la / yang bya ba gzhan zhig yod dam ci na gang gi phyir 'das pa la sogs pa nyid du brjod /
translated: the present is that which has arisen and not yet ceased.🔽If you say that it is not tenable that it performs a function in the three times,

original: gal te yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yod na ni thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the three times are the past, future, and present.

original: ji ste med na ni ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ste med na ni ji ltar 'das pa la sogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But if it does not exist, how could it be called past?

original: 'on te 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zhig 'das pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang zhig 'das pa yang ma yin /
translated: Or if you say it is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin /
translated: then it would be permanent,🔽because it would be unconditioned.

original: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag tu yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te bya ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba yang ma yin pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir 'dus ma byas yin pas rtag tu yod do zhes bya bar 'gyur te bya ba zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: If you say that it is not past, then it would be permanent, because it would be unconditioned, since it is not past, not future, and not present.

original: des na ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: des na ni ci zhe na /
translated: What does that mean?

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe chos bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe chos bya ba mi byed pa de'i tshe ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should not say that when a phenomenon does not perform its function, it is future.

original: bya ba byed par mi nus pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byed par mi nus pa nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not able to perform its function.

original: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan yod ces bya ba'i thal ba'am /
analyzed: gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni skyon der yang 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ni gal te chos las bya ba gzhan zhig yin na ni bya ba la yang bya ba gzhan yod ces bya ba'i thal ba'am /
translated: If action were different from the entity, then the absurd consequence would be that action would have another action.

original: 'dus ma byas su thal ba'i nyes pa der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas su thal ba'i nyes pa der yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Or, the error would ensue that it would be non-compounded.

original: de ni gzhan yang ma yin pas 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gzhan yang ma yin pas 'di ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But since it is not different, there is no error.

original: de'i bdag nyid kho nar zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kho nar zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kho na bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the very nature of that means in the very nature of the present.

original: 'di sngon ci zhig ma byung bar gyur ces bya bar ni ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
analyzed: 'di sngon ci zhig ma byung bar gyur ces bya bar ni ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
translated: What did it not previously exist? In the future state.

original: gal te bya ba yin no zhe na ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bya ba yin no zhe na ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say it is action, then you would be saying that since it is not different, the entity does not exist.

original: phyis ci zhig med ces bya ba ni 'das pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
analyzed: phyis ci zhig med ces bya ba ni 'das pa'i gnas skabs na ste /
translated: What is it that does not exist later? In the past state.

original: gal te bya ba yin no zhe na ni chos dang bya ba dag ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te ma byung ba las byung bar mi 'dod na da ltar byung ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bya ba yin no zhe na ni chos dang bya ba dag ni gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir chos nyid med do zhes smras par 'gyur ro // gal te ma byung ba las byung bar mi 'dod na da ltar byung ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say that it is an action, then you would be saying that since the dharma and the action are not different, the intrinsic nature does not exist.🔽If you do not accept that it arises from what has not yet arisen, then you cannot establish the present.

original: @116b gal te byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod na 'das pa'i dus 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @116b gal te byung nas kyang yang mi 'byung bar mi 'dod na 'das pa'i dus 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not accept that having arisen it does not arise again, then you cannot establish the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni gang zhig ma byung ba las re zhig mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni gang zhig ma byung ba las re zhig mi 'byung ba yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And the future is understood by implication to be that which has not yet arisen from what has not yet arisen.

original: tshig gi don ni de ltar na dus gsum 'grub kyi de lta ma yin na ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni de ltar na dus gsum 'grub kyi de lta ma yin na ni 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words is that the three times are established in this way, but not if they are not established in this way.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rung ngo //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yod pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa dag mi rung ngo //
translated: Because arising and destruction are not tenable means that arising and destruction are not tenable because it exists at all times.

original: de lta bas na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it possesses the characteristics of conditioned states,🔽it is not the case that the consequence of permanence ensues.

original: rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig tsam du zad do //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig tsam du zad do //
translated: This is mere verbiage.🔽This is a verbal convention that has never existed before means that it is never the case that something exists and also possesses arising and destruction.

original: tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yang yod la skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs ni sngon ma thos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don tam  tshig
analyzed: tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du yang yod la skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs ni sngon ma thos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don tam  tshig
translated: The meaning is that this verbal convention has never been heard before.

original: gi lugs 'di ni snga phyi 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gi lugs 'di ni snga phyi 'gal ba yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Or it means that this verbal convention is contradictory.

original: rang bzhin yang ni rtag tu yod ;
analyzed: rang bzhin yang ni rtag tu yod ;
translated: And intrinsic nature always exists

original: / ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de dus thams cad na yod do zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: / ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid de dus thams cad na yod do zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: means that the intrinsic identity of form and so on exists at all times.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dus thams cad du yang yod na des na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dus thams cad du yang yod na des na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the intrinsic reality of form and so on exists at all times, then it follows that the things that are form and so on are permanent.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dngos po yang ni rtag mi 'dod //
analyzed: dngos po yang ni rtag mi 'dod //
translated: And also, an entity is not asserted to be permanent.

original: de lta yin na gdon mi za bar rang bzhin de las dngos po gzhan yin no zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan //
analyzed: de lta yin na gdon mi za bar rang bzhin de las dngos po gzhan yin no zhe na / de'i phyir / rang bzhin las kyang dngos mi gzhan //
translated: If that is so, then without doubt, the entity is different from that intrinsic reality.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: The entity is not different from the intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na 'di ni 'dod rgyal tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni 'dod rgyal tsam du zad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, since this is mere speculation,

original: dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal te rigs pa ni med do//
analyzed: dbang phyug tha snyad yin par gsal te rigs pa ni med do//
translated: it is clear that God is a convention, but there is no logic.🔽Whatever occurred in the past is the past.

original: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du med do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: sngon byung ba gang yin pa ni 'das pa yin la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid du med do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that it does not exist in its own intrinsic reality.🔽Whatever will occur if the conditions are present is the future.

original: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni med kyang rgyu yod pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog go zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rkyen yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin ba de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni med kyang rgyu yod pa'i sgo nas rnam par 'jog go zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This shows that it is posited as existing even though it does not exist through the presence of its cause.

original: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas yin gyi rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas yin gyi rdzas su yod pa ni ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, it is said that the past exists and the future exists, but they do not substantially exist.

original: rgyu la skur pa 'debs par lta ba dgag pa'i phyir 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs so //🔽'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par lta ba pa dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu la skur pa 'debs par lta ba dgag pa'i phyir 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs so // 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs par lta ba pa dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: The past exists because it was said in order to refute the view that denies cause.

original: ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs so //🔽'das @117a * //🔽pa byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs so // 'das @117a * // pa byung bar gyur te /
translated: The future exists because it was said in order to refute the view that denies effect.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zhes brjod par bya ba las yod do zhes gsungs so zhes smos pa ni yod ces bya ba'i sgra tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so zhes brjod par bya ba las yod do zhes gsungs so zhes smos pa ni yod ces bya ba'i sgra tshig gi phrad yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It should be said that the past existed and the future will exist, but it was said that they exist because the term “exists” is a verbal prefix.

original: tshig gi phrad ni dus gsum pa'i yul can yin pas byung bar gyur to ;
analyzed: tshig gi phrad ni dus gsum pa'i yul can yin pas byung bar gyur to ;
translated: Verbal prefixes have objects in the three times, so it is said that the past existed and the future will exist.

original: /'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don la yang yod do //
analyzed: /'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don la yang yod do //
translated: The meaning of “exists” also applies to the past and future.

original: dper na smra ba po mar me zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: dper na smra ba po mar me zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: For example, the statement “The speaker exists” is expanded to “The speaker exists, exists, and will exist.”

original: dper na smra ba po mar me snga na med pa yod do //🔽phyis med pa yod do zhes smra yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa lta bu dang / yang dper na smra ba po mar me de shi ba ni yod mod kyi ;
analyzed: dper na smra ba po mar me snga na med pa yod do // phyis med pa yod do zhes smra yang rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa lta bu dang / yang dper na smra ba po mar me de shi ba ni yod mod kyi ;
translated: For example, when someone says, “The lamp existed before it was lit,” or “The lamp existed after it was extinguished,” the lamp does not exist substantially.🔽Again, for example, when someone says, “The lamp was extinguished,”

original: kho bos ni ma bsad do zhes zer yang yod ces bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas shi ba de yod pa ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kho bos ni ma bsad do zhes zer yang yod ces bya ba'i sgra sbyar bas shi ba de yod pa ni ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: although one says “it,” the lamp that was extinguished does not exist.

original: bye brag tu smra ba ltar na 'gags pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba ltar na 'gags pa yang yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But, according to the Vaibhāṣikas, does not the past exist?

original: yod pa bden mod kyi de ni mar me'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa kho nar yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa bden mod kyi de ni mar me'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa kho nar yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is true that it exists, but it does not exist as the intrinsic nature of the lamp.

original: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas su yod pa nyid ma yin pa yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do zhes gsungs kyi /
translated: Similarly, although it is said that the past and future exist, they do not exist substantially.

original: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were not so, then the past and future would not be established at all.

original: gal te mtshan nyid de kho na bzhin du yod par gyur na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid de kho na bzhin du yod par gyur na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa nyid 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the characteristics existed just as they are described, then the past and future would not be established.

original: gal te 'das pa sngon byung ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa sngon byung ba zhig yin na /
translated: If the past existed previously,

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can rnams la zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te /🔽'phags pa'i gleng gzhi yul na lan dar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mdo yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu bsad do zhes gleng ba dang kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can rnams kyis 'di ltar bsad pa med do zhes smras
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can rnams la zhes bya ba rgya cher smos te / 'phags pa'i gleng gzhi yul na lan dar sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mdo yang dag par ldan pa'i lung las 'phags pa mood gal gyi bu bsad do zhes gleng ba dang kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can rnams kyis 'di ltar bsad pa med do zhes smras
translated: then the Bhagavān would not have said to the wandering mendicant Kakuda Kātyāyana:🔽“Wandering mendicant, you say that the past did not exist, the future will not exist, and the present is not made.🔽You are a nihilist.”🔽“Wandering mendicant, I do not say that the past did not exist, the future will not exist, and the present is not made.

original: pa yod do //
analyzed: pa yod do //
translated: Wandering mendicant, I say that the past existed, the future will exist, and the present is made.”

original: de'i phyir mdo las 'di skad du kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can mtshams med pa byed pa rnams las 'das pa de ni med do zhes de skad du smra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las 'di skad du kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can mtshams med pa byed pa rnams las 'das pa de ni med do zhes de skad du smra'o zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ngo //
translated: “It is said that there is no one who has gone beyond the karma of committing the heinous acts of a mendicant who carries a staff, wears his hair in a topknot, and so on.”

original: ci kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can de dag mtshams med pa'i las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
analyzed: ci kun du rgyu dbyug thogs thor gtsug can de dag mtshams med pa'i las de sngon byung ba nyid du mi 'dod par gyur tam /
translated: Do you not assert that the karma of committing the heinous acts of a mendicant who carries a staff, wears his hair in a topknot, and so on, is karma that has already occurred?

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du ni 'dod par gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de dag las 'das pa de ni med @117b do zhes las de la rdzas su med par log par rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las de sngon byung ba nyid du ni 'dod par gyur mod kyi 'on kyang de dag las 'das pa de ni med @117b do zhes las de la rdzas su med par log par rtog pa yin no //
translated: Although they assert that such karma has already occurred, they wrongly imagine that such karma does not substantially exist.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ngo bo nyid gang la de dag log par rtog pa'i las 'das pa de ni yod do zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ngo bo nyid gang la de dag log par rtog pa'i las 'das pa de ni yod do zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān extensively declares: “That karma of theirs that has already occurred exists.”

original: de lta bas na 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bo yod do zhes zhib tu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'das pa ni rang gi ngo bo yod do zhes zhib tu bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is explained in detail that the past has its own entity.

original: mdo de las ni 'das pa ni sngon byung ba'i las gang yin pa de kho nar zad do zhes bya bar dgongs nas las de yod do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdo de las ni 'das pa ni sngon byung ba'i las gang yin pa de kho nar zad do zhes bya bar dgongs nas las de yod do zhes gsungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The sutra does not state that the past exists in the sense that it is only the karma that occurred in the past.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does it state?

original: rgyud de la des kun du drangs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud de la des kun du drangs pa ste /
translated: It states that the karma that is the cause that projects the continuum is the karma that projects the continuum.

original: sngon byung ba'i las kyis kun du drangs shing bzhag pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon byung ba'i las kyis kun du drangs shing bzhag pa 'bras bu skyed pa'i mthu yod pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It states that the karma that projects the continuum and is posited by the karma that occurred in the past has the power to generate its effect.

original: dgongs pa 'dis gsungs so zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis gsungs so zhes bya bar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: How do we know that this is the intended meaning?

original: de lta ma yin te rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nar yod na 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te rang gi ngo bo nyid kho nar yod na 'das pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it were not so, it would not be established as past.

original: las de rang gi mtshan nyid du yod cing da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid du yod na /
analyzed: las de rang gi mtshan nyid du yod cing da ltar byung ba'i mtshan nyid du yod na /
translated: If that karma existed by its own intrinsic identity and existed by the intrinsic identity of the present,

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: it would not be established as past.

original: da ltar byung ba kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It would be established as the present alone.

original: rgyud de la des kun du drangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par de skad du bshad na ni las 'das pa de yod do zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud de la des kun du drangs pa zhes bya ba rgyas par de skad du bshad na ni las 'das pa de yod do zhes bya bar 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the continuum were explained in that way, as being drawn out by that, then it would be established that that past karma exists.🔽That must be understood in that way,🔽just as it is said that the past and future do not substantially exist.🔽If it is said that it is not tenable that the past and future exist substantially,🔽because the past and future are not substantially established,

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su med do zhes bya ba de lta bur ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa rdzas su med do zhes bya ba de lta bur ro //
translated: then it is not tenable that the present exists substantially,🔽because the present is not substantially established.🔽If it is said that it is not tenable that the present exists substantially,🔽because the present is not substantially established,

original: gal te da ltar gyi dus su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni da ltar gyi ngo bor ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi dus su zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni da ltar gyi ngo bor ma byung ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then it is not tenable that the past and future exist substantially,🔽because the past and future are not substantially established.🔽If it is said that it is not tenable that the past and future exist substantially,🔽because the past and future are not substantially established,🔽then it is not tenable that the present exists substantially,

original: mi rung ste dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rung ste dus ni dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: because the present is not substantially established.🔽If it is said that it is not tenable that the present exists substantially,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni mig ces bya ba'i dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus ni mig ces bya ba'i dngos po las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present is not substantially established,🔽then it is not tenable that the past and future exist substantially,🔽because the past and future are not substantially established.🔽If it is said that it is not tenable that the past and future exist substantially,🔽because the past and future are not substantially established,🔽then it is not tenable that the present exists substantially,

original: rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: because the present is not substantially established.

original: da ltar gyi dus gang yin pa de nyid dngos po yin na de ji ltar na da ltar na da nyid rang gi bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ltar /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus gang yin pa de nyid dngos po yin na de ji ltar na da ltar na da nyid rang gi bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ltar /
translated: If the present time itself is a thing, how could it arise from the present itself, which has not yet occurred?🔽As it is said,

original: de nyid dus dang gtam gzhi dang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de nyid dus dang gtam gzhi dang zhes bshad do //
translated: “Time, basis, and so on.”

original: 'on te mig gi bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mig gi bdag nyid du ma byung ba las 'byung ngo zhe na ni ma 'ongs pa'i mig med do zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no //
translated: But if it arises from that which has not yet become the eye, then it is established that the future eye does not exist.

original: dmigs pa tsam zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dmigs pa tsam zhig yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is merely the object field.

original: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyed par byed pa nyid bzlog pa'i phyir te /🔽chos @118a * //
analyzed: tsam zhes bya ba'i sgra ni skyed par byed pa nyid bzlog pa'i phyir te / chos @118a * //
translated: The word merely is used to refute that it is the producer.

original: rnams de'i rnam par skye ba'i dmigs pa ni yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: rnams de'i rnam par skye ba'i dmigs pa ni yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The object field is the cause of the arising of phenomena in its aspect.🔽This is the meaning.

original: ma 'ongs pa bskal pa stong na 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs ba nye ba yang skyed par byed pa yin par mi rung na dus shin tu ring mo zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa lta bu smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa bskal pa stong na 'byung bar zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs ba nye ba yang skyed par byed pa yin par mi rung na dus shin tu ring mo zhig na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa lta bu smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: The future is that which will arise in a thousand eons. If it is not suitable to generate that which is near in the future, then what need is there to mention that which will arise in a very long time?

original: 'bras bu ni dus snga la rgyu ni dus phyi ba yin no zhes bya bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni dus snga la rgyu ni dus phyi ba yin no zhes bya bar ni rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to say that the effect is earlier and the cause is later.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par shes pa 'gag par byed kyi 'khor ba'i 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni rnam par shes pa 'gag par byed kyi 'khor ba'i 'jug pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir skyed par byed pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Also nirvana is like that. Nirvana is that which causes consciousness to cease, but it is not a generator because it is incompatible with the entry to samsara.

original: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs su gzugs byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur pa de ltar dmigs pa ni yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs su gzugs byung bar gyur pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur pa de ltar dmigs pa ni yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which has occurred and that which will occur is the present. It is said that form that has occurred and that which will occur is observed in the present.

original: ji ltar na de la de ltar dmigs kyi yod do zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de la de ltar dmigs kyi yod do zhes bya bar ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that it is not the case that it is perceived as existing?

original: de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam tshor ba dran pa na yod do zhes bya bar ni su yang mi lta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'das pa'i gzugs sam tshor ba dran pa na yod do zhes bya bar ni su yang mi lta'o //
translated: Therefore, when one recalls past form or feeling, no one thinks that they exist.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzugs de tshor ba dang mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i stobs kyis ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin 'byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar dran no //
analyzed: gzugs de tshor ba dang mig gi rnam par shes pas myong ba'i stobs kyis ji ltar mthong ba dang / ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin 'byung bar gyur to zhes bya bar dran no //
translated: One recalls, “That form was experienced by feeling and eye consciousness,” and one recalls it as it was seen and as it was experienced.

original: slob dpon nyid kyis kyang ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par gtan tshigs su bsdu ba bshad de da ltar gyi gzugs kho na bzhin du byung bar gyur pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang 'dzin to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis kyang ji ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par gtan tshigs su bsdu ba bshad de da ltar gyi gzugs kho na bzhin du byung bar gyur pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang 'dzin to snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The Master himself also explains the syllogism in the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya, “Just as it is,” and so on. He thinks that one apprehends past and future form as it is in the present.🔽If it exists in the same way,

original: gal te yang de de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ji lta ba bzhin yin na ni de da ltar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang de de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni da ltar ji lta ba bzhin yin na ni de da ltar du 'gyur ro //
translated: then if it exists in the same way as it does in the present, it would be present.

original: 'on te de kho na bzhin du med do zhe na ni med par yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
analyzed: 'on te de kho na bzhin du med do zhe na ni med par yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar 'grub po //
translated: But if you say that it does not exist in that way, then it is established that it is perceived as nonexistent.

original: da ltar gyi gzugs su med pa'i phyir dang de yang dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar gyi gzugs su med pa'i phyir dang de yang dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form does not exist in the present, and because it is remembered.

original: ma yin te sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sil bu la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: No, because it is not apprehended as scattered.

original: gzugs 'di sngon ni sil bu ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs 'di sngon ni sil bu ma yin la /
translated: That is illogical because form was not previously scattered.

original: da ni sil bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu de la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gal te yang gzugs de kho na yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te yang da ltar gyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs gong bur gyur pa de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na rdul phra @118b rab tu gyes pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni sil bu yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu de la mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // gal te yang gzugs de kho na yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te yang da ltar gyi gnas skabs kyi gzugs gong bur gyur pa de 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs na rdul phra @118b rab tu gyes pa yin te /
translated: It is not apprehended in that way, that is, as scattered now.🔽But if you say that it is that very form, etc.

original: de'i phyir da ltar bzhin du mi 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar bzhin du mi 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: If you say that the form of the present state is the same as the form of the past and future states, then it is not apprehended as scattered in the past and future states, just as it is in the present.

original: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams de'i son 'dug pas rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rdul phra rab rnams de'i son 'dug pas rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: In this hypothesis, the atoms would be eternal, since they endure without changing.

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag kyang de dag nyid de dag yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang 'das pa dag kyang de dag nyid de dag yin no //
translated: The future, present, and past are the same.

original: de lta yin na ni rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi cung zad skye ba yang med la 'gag pa yang med pas ya mtshan can 'tsho byed rnams kyis rtsod pa bslangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa dang gyes pa tsam kho nar 'gyur gyi cung zad skye ba yang med la 'gag pa yang med pas ya mtshan can 'tsho byed rnams kyis rtsod pa bslangs pa yin no //
translated: If this is the case, then the atoms are only agglomerations and dispersions, and nothing else. There is no arising, no passing away. The Carvakas, materialists, would have the last word.🔽But if you accept this, you will have to admit that the Sūtra is badly expressed, for it says,

original: yang de ltar 'dod na dge slong dag mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'od la 'gags pa na yang gang du yang bsags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de ltar 'dod na dge slong dag mig ni skye ba na yang gang nas kyang mi 'od la 'gags pa na yang gang du yang bsags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monks, the eye, arising, does not come from any place, and, disappearing, does not go to any place.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na mig ni ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na mig ni ma byung ba las 'byung zhing byung nas med par 'gyur ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i mdo yang bor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, if the eye, an internal sense-sphere, did not arise, having arisen, would be destroyed.

original: yang ci ltar na mdo 'di bor zhing 'gal bar byas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar na mdo 'di bor zhing 'gal bar byas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is this Sūtra not badly expressed?

original: 'di ltar mig rang gi ngo bor skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la zhes gsungs pa'i bka' 'di la yang gnod pa byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig rang gi ngo bor skye ba na gang nas kyang mi 'ong la zhes gsungs pa'i bka' 'di la yang gnod pa byas pa yin la /
translated: When the eye arises in its own nature, it does not come from anywhere.🔽This statement of the Buddha is also contradicted:

original: 'gags pa na yang gang du yang bsags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bka' 'di la yang gnod pa byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa na yang gang du yang bsags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i bka' 'di la yang gnod pa byas pa yin te /
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere to accumulate.

original: 'das pa'i dus na de'i rdul phra rab rnams sil bu'i bsags pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na de'i rdul phra rab rnams sil bu'i bsags pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you accept that the atoms of the past are accumulated in a mass.

original: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa rnams kyang ji ltar na sil bu nyid yin /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags pa ma yin pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa rnams kyang ji ltar na sil bu nyid yin /
translated: Also, those that are not accumulated atoms refers to such things as feeling that are not atoms by nature. How could they be a mass?

original: bsags pa nyid dam sil bu nyid gcig tu 'gyur na /
analyzed: bsags pa nyid dam sil bu nyid gcig tu 'gyur na /
translated: If they were either accumulated or not accumulated,

original: lus can rnams la 'gyur gyi lus can ma yin pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus can rnams la 'gyur gyi lus can ma yin pa rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: they would be bodies and not non-bodies.

original: de dag kyang ji ltar byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran te zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi ngo bo dag kho na dran no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar byung zhing nyams su myong ba dran te zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi ngo bo dag kho na dran no //
translated: And they are remembered as they occurred and experienced means that only their present entities are remembered.

original: gal te yang de dag da ltar gyi dag ji lta ba de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang de dag da ltar gyi dag ji lta ba de bzhin du yod do zhe na ni rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they exist just as they were in the present, they would be permanent.

original: 'on te de'i ngo bor med do zhe na ni med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'on te de'i ngo bor med do zhe na ni med pa yang dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba grub pa yin no ;
translated: But if they do not exist in that way, then it is established that the nonexistent is also an object.

original: / skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gsum du skong ba ni skye mched bcu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: / skye mched bcu gsum pa yang dmigs pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye mched bcu gsum du skong ba ni skye mched bcu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth sense base would be an object means that the thirteenth sense base is the sum of the twelve sense bases.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur te /🔽med par dmigs pa nyid du 'dod na ni de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes par @119a * //
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur te / med par dmigs pa nyid du 'dod na ni de la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes par @119a * //
translated: And that would be an object of consciousness.

original: yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that the nonexistent is an object, then consciousness that has that as its object would also exist.

original: bye brag tu smra bas de skad du smras pa dang / slob dpon gyis 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas de skad du smras pa dang / slob dpon gyis 'o na skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: but the Master says, “Well then, it would be called the thirteenth base.”

original: bye brag tu smra bas ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas ming de nyid dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say, “That name itself is the object.”

original: skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba'i ming gang yin pa de dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched bcu gsum pa zhes bya ba'i ming gang yin pa de dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The name called the thirteenth base is the object.

original: de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi brjod par bya ba skye mched bcu gsum pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ming nyid med do zhes bya bar rtogs par 'gyur gyi brjod par bya ba skye mched bcu gsum pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then it would be understood that the name itself does not exist, but it is not the definition of the object of expression, the thirteenth base, that does not exist.🔽Moreover, what is the object of one who observes the nonexistence of sound prior to its production?

original: gzhan yang gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa de'i dmigs pa yang ci zhig yin zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma yin no //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is, “What is its object?”

original: de lta bu'i gnas su bye brag tu smra bas sgra kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas su bye brag tu smra bas sgra kho na yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that it is sound itself in that state.

original: dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that it is the object.

original: slob dpon gyis de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te gal te gang zhig gang sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa des sgra kho na la dmigs pa yin gyi snga na med pa la ni ma yin na gang zhig sgra med
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de lta na ni 'o na zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te gal te gang zhig gang sgra'i snga na med pa la dmigs pa des sgra kho na la dmigs pa yin gyi snga na med pa la ni ma yin na gang zhig sgra med
translated: Vasubandhu says, If that is so, then it would be as follows.🔽If that which observes the nonexistence of sound prior to sound observes only sound and not its nonexistence, then that which observes the nonexistence of sound after sound would observe sound.🔽

original: pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: pa don du gnyer ba de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dir yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The Master says, “If that is so, then…” and so on. If one observes the non-existence prior to sound and observes sound alone, not the non-existence, then it would follow that “one who seeks sound without non-existence must utter sound.”🔽If you say that it is the future state, then…

original: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ste des snga na med pa ni 'di gang gi yin pa ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs de la dmigs te /
analyzed: gal te ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs yin no zhe na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ste des snga na med pa ni 'di gang gi yin pa ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs de la dmigs te /
translated: If you think that the non-existence prior to sound is observed in the future state of sound,🔽then it would follow that “one who seeks sound without non-existence must utter sound.”

original: de lta bas na gang zhig sgra snga na med pa don du gnyer bar byed pa de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir yod na ji ltar med pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang zhig sgra snga na med pa don du gnyer bar byed pa de la sgra dbyung dgos pa kho nar mi 'gyur ro snyam du sems na de'i phyir yod na ji ltar med pa'i blor 'gyur zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it exists, how could it be the cognition of non-existence?

original: snga na med pa 'di gang gi yin pa'i sgra de yod na ji ltar gang zhig snga na med pa la dmigs pa de la med pa'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: snga na med pa 'di gang gi yin pa'i sgra de yod na ji ltar gang zhig snga na med pa la dmigs pa de la med pa'i blor 'gyur /
translated: If the sound that is the basis of the cognition of nonexistence existed, how could the cognition of nonexistence arise in relation to that which is nonexistent?🔽If you say that it does not exist in the present,

original: gal te da ltar med ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du da ltar med do snyam pa de lta bur de la dmigs pa med pa'i blo 'byung ngo snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gal te da ltar med ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni de la 'di snyam du da ltar med do snyam pa de lta bur de la dmigs pa med pa'i blo 'byung ngo snyam du sems na /
translated: if you think that the cognition of nonexistence arises in the form of the thought, it does not exist in the present,

original: de ni ma yin te gcig pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid da ltar yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin pas ji ltar na da ltar gyi de kho na la med pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te gcig pa'i phyir ro // ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa de nyid da ltar yin gyi de las gzhan pa ni ma yin pas ji ltar na da ltar gyi de kho na la med pa'i blo 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: that is not so, because they are the same.🔽That which is future is the present, it is not different from that. Therefore, how could the cognition of nonexistence arise in relation to the present?🔽Or, if you think that the cognition of nonexistence arises in the form of the thought, that particular state of the future does not exist without that particular state that occurs in the present,

original: yang na de'i bye brag gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni yang na ma 'ongs pa de'i khyad par phyis da ltar gyi gnas skabs dag na 'byung ba gang yin pa khyad par de med na med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: yang na de'i bye brag gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni yang na ma 'ongs pa de'i khyad par phyis da ltar gyi gnas skabs dag na 'byung ba gang yin pa khyad par de med na med do snyam pa'i blo 'byung ba yin na ni /
translated: then that is not so, because they are the same.

original: de ma byung ba las @119b 'byung bar 'grub ste /
analyzed: de ma byung ba las @119b 'byung bar 'grub ste /
translated: It is established that it arises from that which has not yet occurred.

original: khyad par de sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba des 'grub ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de sngon ma byung ba las phyis 'byung ba des 'grub ces bya ba yin no //
translated: It is established by that which occurs later, having not occurred previously.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs na ni yod pa yin la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag na ni med pa yin pas gnyi ga rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga yin no zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi gnas skabs na ni yod pa yin la 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs dag na ni med pa yin pas gnyi ga rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin no //
translated: That which is both existent and nonexistent is the object of consciousness, because it exists in the present but does not exist in the past and future.

original: gal te med pa rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te med pa rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If that which does not exist is the object of consciousness,

original: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'o na byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: then why did the Bodhisattva, as described in the sutra,🔽say, “It is impossible that the Bodhisattva in his final existence would say, ‘I know that which does not exist in the world’?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i srid pa tha ma pas 'di skad du 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba de ni mi srid do zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med do🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i srid pa tha ma pas 'di skad du 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de bdag gis shes so zhes bya ba de ni mi srid do zhes gsungs so zhes 'byung ba'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa med do🔽zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ” This passage shows that there is no consciousness that has a nonexistent object.

original: slob dpon gyis mdo 'di dgongs pa gzhan yin par bstan pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos te /🔽mdo 'di la dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma dag pa nga rgyal can gzhan dag sbyor pa'i gnas skabs na snang bas te lha'i mig gi snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni lha'i mig gi snga ltas snang ba yod pa kho na
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mdo 'di dgongs pa gzhan yin par bstan pa'i phyir mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gzhan dag ces bya ba rgyas par smos te / mdo 'di la dgongs pa ni ting nge 'dzin yongs su ma dag pa nga rgyal can gzhan dag sbyor pa'i gnas skabs na snang bas te lha'i mig gi snang ba med bzhin du yod par lta'i bdag ni lha'i mig gi snga ltas snang ba yod pa kho na
translated: The Master says that this sutra has another intention, and to demonstrate this, he says,

original: la yod do zhes bya bar lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: la yod do zhes bya bar lta'o zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Others who are conceited about their knowledge of the Abhidharma say that the intention of this sutra is that others who are not fully purified in concentration and are conceited about their knowledge of the Abhidharma see appearances of the divine eye when they are in the state of preparation, but we see only the appearances of the divine eye that exist.🔽How could this be a conception?

original: 'di'i rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo thams cad kyi yul yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag na 'di 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de zhes rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa de lta bur brtag pa ste dpyod pa dang
analyzed: 'di'i rtog par yang ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba ni blo thams cad kyi yul yod pa nyid du rnam par gzhag na 'di 'jig rten na med pa gang yin pa de zhes rgyas par gsungs pa gang yin pa de lta bur brtag pa ste dpyod pa dang
translated: If all minds are posited as existing objects, then this is a conception, or analysis, of what does not exist in the world, as extensively stated in the passage, Whatever does not exist in the world.

original: the tshom du yang ga la 'gyur blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yod pa dang / med pa nyid gcig yin na ni rtog pa 'di srid kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: the tshom du yang ga la 'gyur blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yod pa dang / med pa nyid gcig yin na ni rtog pa 'di srid kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If the objects of cognition were both existent and nonexistent, this conception would be possible, but not otherwise.🔽Or else, what is the difference?

original: yang na khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gal te de dag kyang yod pa kho na la yod par mthong gi med pa la ni ma yin la gzhan dag las kyang byang chub sems dpa' khyad par ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: yang na khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni gal te de dag kyang yod pa kho na la yod par mthong gi med pa la ni ma yin la gzhan dag las kyang byang chub sems dpa' khyad par ci zhig yod de /
translated: If they also see existence as existent and not as nonexistent, then what is the difference between them and the bodhisattvas?

original: blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yod pa dang med pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'di khyad par yod do //
analyzed: blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yod pa dang med pa nyid gcig yin na ni 'di khyad par yod do //
translated: If the objects of cognition were both existent and nonexistent, then there would be a difference.

original: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni blo dag med pa la dmigs pa yin pa zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar de lta bu yin par shes par bya ste zhes bya ba ni blo dag med pa la dmigs pa yin pa zhes bya bar ro //
translated: That must be understood without a doubt.

original: 'dir dper brjod pa ni yod pa la yang yod par shes la med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir dper brjod pa ni yod pa la yang yod par shes la med pa la yang med par shes so zhes bya ba 'di yin te /
translated: The example here is “One knows existence as existent and nonexistence as nonexistent.”

original: dngos po yod pa la yang yod @120a * //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa la yang yod @120a * //
translated: This is because things that exist are known as existent,🔽and things that do not exist are known as nonexistent.

original: pa nyid du shes so //
analyzed: pa nyid du shes so //
translated: and non-existence as non-existence.

original: khyad par du 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu shes par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu shes par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “One proceeds to a distinction” means one comes to know a distinction.

original: med pa la yang med pa nyid du shes pas blo dag med pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: med pa la yang med pa nyid du shes pas blo dag med pa la dmigs pa yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: Since one knows non-existence as non-existence, the mind is said to have non-existence for its object.

original: de lta bas na de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas smras pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas smras pa zhes smras pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this is also not a proper reason, that is, what the Bodhisattva said.

original: de sngon du 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni las sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi khyad par las so //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni las sngon du 'gro ba'i sems kyi khyad par las so //
translated: “It is preceded by that” means it is preceded by action, from a special mind.

original: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi mjug nas gnas ma'i bu'i gzhung lugs dgag pa nas so //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dgag pa nas zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos kyi mjug nas gnas ma'i bu'i gzhung lugs dgag pa nas so //
translated: “From the refutation of the doctrine of self” means from the refutation of the Vātsīputrīya doctrine at the end of the treatise.

original: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba sngon med pa las da 'byung bas sngon med pa las 'byung bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni skye ba ma byung ba las 'byung ba zhes bya bar 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba ni skye ba sngon med pa las da 'byung bas sngon med pa las 'byung bar grub pa yin no //
translated: “But then it is established that arising occurs from what has not yet occurred,” that is, since arising occurs now from what has not previously arisen, it is established that it occurs from what has not previously existed.

original: skye ba ni skye ba dang ldan pa dang lhan cig tshul 'dra ba'i phyir yang thams cad yod pa kho na yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba dang ldan pa dang lhan cig tshul 'dra ba'i phyir yang thams cad yod pa kho na yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Since arising is similar to that which possesses arising, all exist.

original: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa na yod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skye ba yang yod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa na yod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skye ba yang yod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If you think that not only does cause and effect exist in the future, but also arising exists,

original: de ni gang la gang zhig nus //
analyzed: de ni gang la gang zhig nus //
translated: then what is able to do what?

original: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang la rgyu gang zhig nus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gang la rgyu gang zhig nus te /
translated: What is the effect and what is the cause?

original: rgyu dang ji skad bshad pa'i skye ba dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yang yod pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang ji skad bshad pa'i skye ba dang 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa yang yod pas so //
translated: Since cause, arising as it has been explained, and effect exist in the future.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say that that which is able to perform the action of the present is present.

original: bye brag tu smra bas da ltar du byed pa nus pa yin no zhes smras pa dang slob dpon gyis da ltar du byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra bas da ltar du byed pa nus pa yin no zhes smras pa dang slob dpon gyis da ltar du byed pa zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba rgyas par smras te /
translated: The Master says, What is this called the action of the present?

original: skye ba ni da ltar du byed pa ma yin te de ni yod pa'i phyir de skad du 'dri ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni da ltar du byed pa ma yin te de ni yod pa'i phyir de skad du 'dri ba yin no //
translated: Arising does not perform the action of the present because it exists.

original: gal te yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te da ltar du byed ba rgyus 'bras bu yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no snyam du sems ni 'di la rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te da ltar du byed ba rgyus 'bras bu yul gzhan du 'dren pa yin no snyam du sems ni 'di la rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes smras te /
translated: If you think that it is the cause that transports the effect to another place, then this is permanent.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The word “effect” is a remainder from the verse.

original: yul nas yul gzhan du 'dren pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi skye ba ni cung zad kyang med pas rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul nas yul gzhan du 'dren pa 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi skye ba ni cung zad kyang med pas rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is only transported from one place to another, but it does not arise at all. Therefore, it follows that it is permanent.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yul gzhan du 'dren pa ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa tshor ba la sogs pa la yang yul gzhan du 'dren pa ji lta bu ste /
translated: How can feeling, etc., which are not material, be transported to another place?

original: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir de mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa nyid kyi yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir de mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since they are not material, they do not abide in a place. Therefore, it is not possible.🔽That which is transported arises from what is non-existent.

original: de 'dren pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung bar 'grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'dren pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang ma byung ba las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni ma byung ba las byung bar 'grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that it is established that it arises from what is non-existent.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad @120b par zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyus 'bras bu 'di'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du byed de des na 'bras bu'i khyad par yin no snyam du sems na 'dir ma byung ba las 'byung
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo'i khyad @120b par zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rgyus 'bras bu 'di'i rang gi ngo bo khyad par du byed de des na 'bras bu'i khyad par yin no snyam du sems na 'dir ma byung ba las 'byung
translated: If you think that it is a specific nature,🔽then it is established that what did not exist previously arises.

original: ba grub pa yin no zhes smras te khyad par ma byung ba las 'byung zhing skye'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ba grub pa yin no zhes smras te khyad par ma byung ba las 'byung zhing skye'o zhes bya bar grub pa yin no //
translated: If you think that the cause makes a specific nature of this effect, then it is established that what did not exist previously arises.

original: yul na dus gsum ste ci zhe na thams cad yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul na dus gsum ste ci zhe na thams cad yod ces bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that all three times exist.🔽It is explained that they exist in that way.

original: ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa de bzhin du bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni sngon byung ba gang yin pa de ni 'das pa yin no //
translated: Whatever occurred in the past is past.

original: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //🔽byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma 'ongs pa yin no //🔽byung nas ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni da ltar yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever will occur if its cause exists is future.🔽Whatever has occurred but not yet ceased is present.

original: de skad du thams cad yod par smra ba ni bstan pa la legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du thams cad yod par smra ba ni bstan pa la legs pa yin no //
translated: The Sarvastivadins are correct in their teaching.🔽How is one endowed with that or in that?

original: ji ltar na des sam der ldan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam /
analyzed: ji ltar na des sam der ldan pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des sam /
translated: How is one endowed with past or future affliction?

original: ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //🔽de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des ldan la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa de las skyes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po der ldan pa yin zhes bya ba yin no // de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa des ldan la zhes bya ba ni 'das pa de las skyes pa ni /
translated: How is one endowed with past or future things?🔽One is endowed with that affliction because the negative tendency that is its cause exists.

original: de las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa'o //
translated: That which arises from that is arisen from that.

original: ma 'ongs pa de'i rgyu ni de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa de'i rgyu ni de'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of that is the cause of that.

original: de ni de las skyes pa yang yin la de'i rgyu yang yin pas de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni de las skyes pa yang yin la de'i rgyu yang yin pas de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'o //
translated: That which is arisen from that and is the cause of that is the cause of that which is arisen from that.

original: phra rgyas ni sa bon no //
analyzed: phra rgyas ni sa bon no //
translated: Negative tendencies are seeds.

original: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des ldan no //
analyzed: de las skyes pa de'i rgyu'i phra rgyas yod pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa des ldan no //
translated: One is endowed with past or future affliction in that order because the negative tendencies that are the cause of that which arises from that exist.

original: 'di las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de la dmigs pa yod pas na de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po de la dmigs pa yod pas na de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions that focus on that are the afflictions that focus on past and future things.

original: de'i phra rgyas te /
analyzed: de'i phra rgyas te /
translated: Their latent afflictions

original: de yod pas go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod pas go rims bzhin du 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: exist, and one possesses past and future things, respectively.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The reality of things is the intrinsic reality of things.🔽In order to understand the distinctions in the conventional expressions that establish the past, etc.,

original: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams rnam par gzhag pa la de dag gi tha snyad bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs kyang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams rnam par gzhag pa la de dag gi tha snyad bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i phyir rnam grangs kyang yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the text says, “There is also a classification,” etc.

original: go rims kyi tshad yod do //
analyzed: go rims kyi tshad yod do //
translated: The measure of time is finite.

original: gang skyes ba de 'gags zhes smras nas dpe bstan pa'i phyir gzugs skye la gzugs 'gag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gang skyes ba de 'gags zhes smras nas dpe bstan pa'i phyir gzugs skye la gzugs 'gag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Having said that, “What is born ceases,” in order to illustrate that, it says, “Form is born and form ceases.”

original: rdzas gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas gzhan ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a different substance.

original: gzhan skye la gzhan 'gag ste skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir gzhan ma 'ongs pa skye la 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir @121a * //
analyzed: gzhan skye la gzhan 'gag ste skye ba la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir gzhan ma 'ongs pa skye la 'gag pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i phyir @121a * //
translated: In the context of arising from other, other ceases and other arises because that which is other, namely, the future, arises since it is about to arise and that which is other, namely, the past, ceases since it is about to cease.

original: gzhan da ltar gyi 'gag go //
analyzed: gzhan da ltar gyi 'gag go //
translated: Other things arise and cease in dependence on other things, because the future arises in dependence on the present, and the present ceases in dependence on the future.

original: dus kyang skye ste /
analyzed: dus kyang skye ste /
translated: Time also arises,

original: chos skye ba dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //🔽dus kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: chos skye ba dus kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro // dus kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: because the arising of a phenomenon is included in time.🔽It is time’s intrinsic nature.🔽This is the meaning.

original: de dag nyid dus gtan gzhi dang // zhes mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid dus gtan gzhi dang // zhes mtshan nyid 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of time are stated in the Abhidharma:🔽“Time is the basis of all conditioned phenomena.”

original: dus las kyang chos skye'o //
analyzed: dus las kyang chos skye'o //
translated: A phenomenon also arises in dependence on time.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;🔽ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ; ma 'ongs pa'i dus skad cig ma du ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because the future is a multiplicity of moments.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma'i tshogs kyi du ma zhig las skad cig ma 'ga' zhig skye ba de'i phyir dus las kyang skye'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa'i skad cig ma'i tshogs kyi du ma zhig las skad cig ma 'ga' zhig skye ba de'i phyir dus las kyang skye'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Because a multiplicity of future moments arises from a multiplicity of moments, therefore it is said that a phenomenon arises in dependence on time.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dpyad pa ni /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dpyad pa ni /
translated: The term “extraneous” refers to the analysis of the past and future.

original: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan //🔽zhes bya ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma kun gyis kun dang ldan // zhes bya ba'i zhar la 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: The remaining [afflictions] are associated with all.🔽This is an extraneous discussion on the verse, “The remaining [afflictions] are associated with all.”

original: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
analyzed: kun 'gro lhag ma rnams kyis ldan //
translated: The remaining pervasive [afflictions] are associated with all.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun du 'gro ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i kun du 'gro ba rnams kyis so //
translated: This refers to the pervasive [afflictions] to be abandoned by seeing the origin [of suffering].

original: de yi yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis //
analyzed: de yi yul can dri ma lhag rnams kyis //
translated: The remaining stains that have it as their object.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: spangs pa'i rnam pa'i yul can gyi phra rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /🔽dper na chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa spangs kyang chen po'i 'bring po la sogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma ma spangs pa rnams kyis ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa'i rnam pa'i yul can gyi phra rgyas rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / dper na chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa spangs kyang chen po'i 'bring po la sogs pa phra rgyas lhag ma ma spangs pa rnams kyis ldan pa yin no //
translated: the remaining proclivities that have the aspect of abandonment as their object.🔽For example, even though the aspect of the great of the great [afflictions] has been abandoned, one is associated with the remaining proclivities such as the medium of the great and so on that have not been abandoned.

original: 'di ltar 'di chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa spangs pas bral ba yin yang lhag ma de dag gis ldan pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa spangs pas bral ba yin yang lhag ma de dag gis ldan pa kho na yin no //
translated: In this way, although one is free from the aspect of the great of the great [afflictions] because it has been abandoned, one is still associated with the remaining [afflictions].

original: bsdus te rnam par 'chad par byed de zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas rnam par 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: bsdus te rnam par 'chad par byed de zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus nas rnam par 'chad par byed do //
translated: They are summarized and explained.

original: su dag gcig ce na bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: su dag gcig ce na bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: Who summarizes and explains them? The Vaibhāṣikas.

original: bcu drug po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bcu drug po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The sixteen aspects are the five aspects related to the realm of desire:🔽the four aspects of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and the fifth aspect related to meditation on the realm of desire that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / lnga pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bar du rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhi dang / lnga pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i bar du rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Similarly, the five aspects related to the formless realm are the four aspects of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, and the fifth aspect related to the formless realm that is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: bco lnga dang bcu drug pa zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bco lnga dang bcu drug pa zag pa med pa ste /
translated: The fifteenth and sixteenth aspects are the two uncontaminated aspects.

original: chos ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: chos ni bcu drug go //
translated: These are the sixteen aspects.🔽These sixteen aspects are the four aggregates by nature,

original: chos 'di dag kyang gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag ni phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di dag kyang gang dag mthong bas spang bar bya ba de dag ni phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: those to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: gang dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de dag ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang dag bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de dag ni phung po lnga'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: and the five aggregates by nature, those to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: ji lta zhe na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas de dag dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i phung po yin no //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas de dag dang mtshungs bar ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni tshor ba'i phung po yin no //
translated: How is that? The feeling that is associated with those proclivities to be abandoned by the path of seeing is the feeling aggregate.

original: 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes gang yin pa de ni 'du shes kyi phung po yin no //
translated: The perception that is associated with those is the perception aggregate.

original: @121b phra rgyas gang dag yin pa dang de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa sems las byung ba sems pa la sogs pa gang dag yin pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa de dag thams cad kyi ldan pa ma yin pa thob pa dang skye ba dang rga ba dang gnas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid gang dag yin pa de ni 'du byed kyi phung po yin no //
