original: yongs su ma shes pa ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su ma shes pa ni de'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not abandoned and not thoroughly known means that they are not abandoned because their obtainment is not severed and they are not thoroughly known because their antidote is not generated.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gis kun nas 'khri bar byed pas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gis kun nas 'khri bar byed pas na kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa ste /
translated: The term “conducive” means that they are conducive to the fetters of attachment to sense objects because they bind.

original: khrus dang mthun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khrus dang mthun pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like what is conducive to bathing.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang / mthun pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang / mthun pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: They are conducive to the fetters of attachment to sense objects because they are conducive to the fetters of attachment to sense objects.

original: yang na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid kun nas dkris pa yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa ste /
analyzed: yang na 'dod pa'i 'dod chags nyid kun nas dkris pa yin pas 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa ste /
translated: Or else, since attachment to the sense realm is a fetter, it is the fetter of attachment to the sense realm.

original: de dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa dag go //
analyzed: de dang mthun pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa dag go //
translated: Those that are similar to it are similar to the fetter of attachment to the sense realm.

original: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin no ;
analyzed: de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa yul rnams yin no ;
translated: And those are the objects such as form.

original: ; snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ; snang bar gyur pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul gyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is manifest means that which has become the nature of an object.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul snang bar gyur pa de la yang phyin ci log gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni yul snang bar gyur pa de la yang phyin ci log gi mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And there, incorrect mental activity means that even with respect to that manifest object, there is the condition of an immediately preceding condition that is erroneous.

original: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs dag yin te zhes bya ba la rgyu'i stobs ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs dag yin te zhes bya ba la rgyu'i stobs ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags skyed par byed pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin no //
translated: The power of cause is the non-abandonment and non-complete-understanding of the proclivity of passion that generates passion.

original: yul gyi stobs ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi stobs ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The power of object is the object that is suitable for the envelopment of passion.

original: sbyor ba'i stobs ni de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs ni de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: The power of application is the incorrect mental attention to that.🔽It should be understood that the other afflictions arise in the same way.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang de bzhin du skye bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan yang de bzhin du skye bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khong khro ba'i phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin /
translated: The power of cause is the non-abandonment and non-complete-understanding of the proclivity of hostility.

original: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin /
analyzed: khong khro ba'i kun nas dkris pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin /
translated: The power of object is the appearance of things that are suitable for the envelopment of hostility.🔽The power of application is the incorrect mental attention to that.

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ste tshul ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes bya ba ste tshul ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is the method.

original: sbyor ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of fetters:

original: de dag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba dang ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o //🔽gti mug ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig @128a * //
analyzed: de dag nyid dang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang srid pa'i sbyor ba dang lta ba'i sbyor ba dang ma rig pa'i sbyor ba'o // gti mug ma gtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig @128a * //
translated: The fetters of desire, existence, view, and ignorance.🔽Except for delusion means

original: pa'i zag pa ni logs shig tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i zag pa ni logs shig tu bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the contaminant of ignorance is explained separately.🔽Those that are associated with the entanglements means

original: kun nas dkris byas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas dkris byas zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba rnams dang bcas pa'o //
translated: that they are associated with nonembarrassment and so on.

original: rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ste /
translated: There are forty one substances.

original: phra rgyas sum cu gcig dang zhes bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: phra rgyas sum cu gcig dang zhes bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis te /
translated: Thirty one negative tendencies means

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba lnga dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gnyis kho na dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gsum dang the tshom bzhi dang 'dod chags lnga dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba lnga dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba gnyis dang 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang gnyis kho na dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba gsum dang the tshom bzhi dang 'dod chags lnga dang /
translated: that there are twelve views: five views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, two views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, two views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, three views to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path, four doubts, five attachments, five hatreds, five ignorances, five conceited attitudes, and five tendencies to misconceive.

original: de bzhin du khong khro ba dang nga rgyal lnga dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu ste ;
analyzed: de bzhin du khong khro ba dang nga rgyal lnga dang / kun nas dkris pa bcu ste ;
translated: So too, there are five each of anger and pride, and ten entanglements.

original: de ltar na bzhi bcu rtsa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bzhi bcu rtsa gcig yin no //
translated: Thus there are forty-one.

original: phra rgyas kho na zhes bya ba la kho na zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun nas dkris pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra rgyas kho na zhes bya ba la kho na zhes bya ba smos pa ni kun nas dkris pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Only negative tendencies means only negative tendencies, because this eliminates entanglements.

original: phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis dang the tshom bzhi dang 'dod chags lnga dang nga rgyal lnga'o //🔽de na yang rmugs pa dang rgod pa kun nas dkris pa gnyis yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de kho na ste /
analyzed: phra rgyas nyi shu rtsa drug ces bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis dang the tshom bzhi dang 'dod chags lnga dang nga rgyal lnga'o // de na yang rmugs pa dang rgod pa kun nas dkris pa gnyis yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams de kho na ste /
translated: There are twenty-six negative tendencies means the twelve views, four doubts, five attachments, and five prides.🔽Are the two entanglements of lethargy and excitation also there?

original: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs rgod rgyags pa khams gsum na // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Lethargy, excitation, and arrogance exist in the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir de ma smos she na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa de gnyis so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir de ma smos she na zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa de gnyis so //
translated: Why are they not mentioned here?

original: rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji ltar rang dbang can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang dbang can ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ji ltar rang dbang can ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they not independent?

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / phrag dog la sogs pa de bzhin du ma rig pa tsam dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dang / phrag dog la sogs pa de bzhin du ma rig pa tsam dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are concomitant with attachment and so on, and because they are not concomitant with ignorance alone, like envy and so on.

original: 'di gnyis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: These two are concomitant with attachment and so on,

original: ji ltar phrag dog dang ser sna dang 'gyod pa dang khro ba dang 'chab pa rnams ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar phrag dog dang ser sna dang 'gyod pa dang khro ba dang 'chab pa rnams ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not independent, like envy, avarice, regret, anger, and concealment, which are concomitant with ignorance alone.

original: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa na spyod pa gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa na spyod pa gnyi ga yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both of these, that is, both those operating in the form and formless realms, are not independent.

original: kha nang du bltas te 'jug ces bya ba ni yul gtsor byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: kha nang du bltas te 'jug ces bya ba ni yul gtsor byed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase it is directed internally means that it is not directed toward an object.

original: rgyu gang gis srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase it is the cause of the craving that is called 'attachment to existence' means that it is the cause of the craving that is called attachment to existence.

original: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der //🔽thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
analyzed: kha ni nang du bltas phyir der // thar pa'i 'du shes bzlog phyir bshad //
translated: The phrase because it is directed internally means that it is directed toward the three realms of existence.

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: The phrase it is taught in order to counteract the notion that there is liberation means that it is taught in order to counteract the notion that there is liberation in the three realms of existence.

original: des na srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase it is called the 'contaminant of existence' means that it is called the contaminant of existence because it is the cause of the craving that is called attachment to existence.

original: rdzas bco lnga zhes bya ba ni khams @128b gsum char na yang rnam pa lnga lnga yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas bco lnga zhes bya ba ni khams @128b gsum char na yang rnam pa lnga lnga yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase it is made up of fifteen substances means that it is made up of fifteen substances in each of the three realms.

original: zag pa zhes bya bar grub bo zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa gong du bshad pa'i zag pa gnyis las bkar ba yin te /
analyzed: zag pa zhes bya bar grub bo zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa gong du bshad pa'i zag pa gnyis las bkar ba yin te /
translated: The phrase it is established that ignorance is a separate contaminant means that ignorance is a separate contaminant in addition to the two contaminants that were explained previously.

original: de lta bas na khams gsum char ba yang ma rig pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba de grub bo //🔽chu bo sbyor ba 'ang de bzhin du //
analyzed: de lta bas na khams gsum char ba yang ma rig pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba de grub bo // chu bo sbyor ba 'ang de bzhin du //
translated: Therefore, the phrase it is established that ignorance is a separate contaminant in the three realms is a summary of the above explanation.🔽The floods and the yokes should be understood in the same way.

original: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dag kho na chu bo dang sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zag pa dag kho na chu bo dang sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The floods and the yokes are the same as the contaminants.

original: lta ba logs shig tu gzhag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: lta ba logs shig tu gzhag par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The view is only to be set aside separately.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: It will be explained.

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa kho na 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / 'dod pa'i sbyor ba yin la de bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa kho na srid pa'i chu bo dang srid pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa kho na 'dod pa'i chu bo dang / 'dod pa'i sbyor ba yin la de bzhin du srid pa'i zag pa kho na srid pa'i chu bo dang srid pa'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The flood and the bond of sensual pleasure are only the defilement of sensual pleasure. Likewise, the flood and the bond of existence are only the defilement of existence.

original: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba ni snga ma kho na bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sbyor ba ni snga ma kho na bzhin du khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The bond of ignorance should be understood just as before.

original: 'dir lta ba'i sbyor ba ni bzhi pa yin par bshad de de'i phyir lta ba rnams ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'dir lta ba'i sbyor ba ni bzhi pa yin par bshad de de'i phyir lta ba rnams ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Here, the bond of view is explained as the fourth, therefore, it is said, “except for the views.”🔽It is said that the bond of ignorance is separate from the other three bonds.

original: logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go zhes grag go zhes bya ba la grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te ;
analyzed: logs shig tu rnam par gzhag go zhes grag go zhes bya ba la grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin te ;
translated: The word “said” indicates that this is the opinion of another.

original: dgongs pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bo'i dbang gis lta ba'i sbyor ba logs shig tu bshad do zhes bya bar rung ngo //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'dul ba'i skye bo'i dbang gis lta ba'i sbyor ba logs shig tu bshad do zhes bya bar rung ngo //
translated: The intention is that the bond of view is explained separately because of the disciples.🔽The meaning of the term “bond” is the meaning of the term “flood.”

original: ci'i phyir zag pa dag gi nang du lta ba rnams logs shig tu ma bzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag pa dag gi nang du lta ba rnams logs shig tu ma bzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the views not posited separately among the contaminants?

original: zag par ma yin grogs med rnams //
analyzed: zag par ma yin grogs med rnams //
translated: They are not contaminants, they are not friends,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: lta ba grogs med pa rnams ni 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lta ba grogs med pa rnams ni 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The views are not friends because they are not compatible with equipoise.

original: 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jog pa'i rjes su mi mthun pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “they are not compatible with equipoise” is that they are not compatible with equipoise.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir lta ba 'di dag yan gar pa ni 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin gyi grogs dang bcas nas 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa de'i phyir 'di dag grogs dang bcas pa kho na zag pa rnams kyi nang du zag pa dag tu bshad
analyzed: gang gi phyir lta ba 'di dag yan gar pa ni 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa ma yin gyi grogs dang bcas nas 'jog pa'i rjes su mthun pa de'i phyir 'di dag grogs dang bcas pa kho na zag pa rnams kyi nang du zag pa dag tu bshad
translated: Since these views are not compatible with equipoise when they are alone, they are compatible with equipoise when they have friends. Therefore they are explained as contaminants among the contaminants only when they have friends.

original: de / bsres te bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de / bsres te bshad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “they are mixed and explained” is that they are explained as contaminants when they are mixed with their friends.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zag pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'jog par byed pas na zhes 'og nas 'chad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zag pa rnams kyi nges pa'i tshig ni 'jog par byed pas na zhes 'og nas 'chad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The verbal root of contaminant is explained below as “it causes equipoise.”

original: de'i phyir zag ba dag gi nang du 'jog pa'i don dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zag ba dag gi nang du 'jog pa'i don dgos so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the term “flood” is the same as the meaning of the term “pollution.”

original: de ltar na 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu dgu ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis kyis bton pas zag pa bzhin du rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i chu bo ni rdzas nyi shu dgu ste zhes bya ba ni lta ba bcu gnyis kyis bton pas zag pa bzhin du rdzas bzhi bcu rtsa gcig ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the flood of sensuality consists of twenty-nine real entities. Since it is distinguished by twelve views, it is not the same as the pollution of sensuality, which consists of forty-one real entities.

original: 'o na ci zhe na rdzas nyi shu dgu yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na rdzas nyi shu dgu yin no //

analyzed: ji lta zhe na 'dod chags dang khong khro ba dang nga rgyal zhes bya ba thams cad brjod do //

analyzed: lta ba'i chu bo ni rdzas sum cu rtsa drug go zhes bya ba ni khams gsum na lta ba bcu gnyis bcu gnyis yod pas so //

translated: Because it deceives the side of the householder and the side of the renunciate.🔽By fasting, etc.

original: zas mi za ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu dang mer 'jug pa dang / mi smra ba dang / dpa' bo byed pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zas mi za ba la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu dang mer 'jug pa dang / mi smra ba dang / dpa' bo byed pa la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes entering the water and fire, remaining silent, and acting like a hero.

original: zas mi za ba la sogs pa dang / yul yid du 'ong ba yongs su spangs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zas mi za ba la sogs pa dang / yul yid du 'ong ba yongs su spangs pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Fasting and abandoning pleasant objects are included in morality and ritual.

original: ma rig pa /
analyzed: ma rig pa /
translated: Ignorance

original: 'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa min phyir bsres //
translated: is not a grasping because it is mixed.

original: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gis srid pa nye bar len par mi byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa 'ba' zhig gis srid pa nye bar len par mi byed do //
translated: Ignorance alone does not grasp existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is unclear, having the characteristic of non-knowledge.

original: 'dres pa ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis nye bar len par byed pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dres pa ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis nye bar len par byed pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The mixed are those that are appropriated by the power of being related to other afflictions.

original: grag go zhes bya ba la grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: grag go zhes bya ba la grag ces bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyi gzhung lugs ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “they say” indicates the opinion of another.

original: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung lugs bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi gzhung lugs bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las ni zhes bya ba rgyas par smos so //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān’s own opinion is stated in the sūtra passage, “The appropriator is the six.”

original: lta ba'i sbyor ba yang de dang 'dra ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i sbyor ba yang de dang 'dra ba'i bar du gsungs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The same should be applied up to the application of view.

original: lta ba'i sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di'i lta ba rnams la lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang lta ba la 'dun pa dang lta ba la sred pa dang zhes bya ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i sbyor ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di'i lta ba rnams la lta ba la 'dod chags pa dang lta ba la 'dun pa dang lta ba la sred pa dang zhes bya ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: What is the application of view? It is the desire, aspiration, fondness, thirst, attachment, clinging, and craving for views, as before.

original: mdo gzhan dag las 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyang nye bar len par gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo gzhan dag las 'dun pa'i 'dod chags kyang nye bar len par gsungs te /
translated: In other sūtras, desirous attachment is also said to be appropriation.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is appropriation?

original: 'di la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so//
analyzed: 'di la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so//
translated: It is the desire that is longing for this.

original: 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin te /
translated: This is the master's doctrinal position.

original: 'di skad du 'dir 'dod chags kho na sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'dir 'dod chags kho na sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa yin gyi nyon mongs pa gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained in this way: only desire is the fetter and appropriation here, not the other afflictions.

original: de'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa'i 'dod chags pa gang yin pa de ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Whatever desire is for desire, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir de dag phra ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag phra ba dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Because they are subtle, etc.

original: phra mo dag rgyas par 'gyur bas na phra rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis grub po //
analyzed: phra mo dag rgyas par 'gyur bas na phra rgyas so zhes bya ba 'di ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis grub po //
translated: The term “proclivity” is established by the method of derivation, since they are subtle and increase.

original: rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu ba phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa phra ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are subtle in their activity means because they are subtle in their engagement.

original: ji ltar 'jug pa phra zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa phra zhe na /
translated: How are they subtle in their engagement?

original: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams shes par @130a * //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa rnams shes par @130a * //
translated: Those that are not physical are known as the four formless🔽absorptions.

original: dka' pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dka' pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is difficult to know the formless ones.

original: sbyor ba med par te bsgrim mi dgos par bzlog bzhin du yang ste bkag bzhin du yang gang zag la yang dang yang mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba med par te bsgrim mi dgos par bzlog bzhin du yang ste bkag bzhin du yang gang zag la yang dang yang mngon du 'gyur ba'i phyir phra rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “proclivities” because they manifest repeatedly in the person, even when one is not applying oneself, even when one is not exerting oneself, even when one is resisting them.

original: 'khor bar 'jog par byed pas na zag pa yin pa'am 'jog pa'i don du 'dzag pas na zag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul yin no //🔽srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pas na zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma ste /
analyzed: 'khor bar 'jog par byed pas na zag pa yin pa'am 'jog pa'i don du 'dzag pas na zag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi tshul yin no // srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma nas 'dzag pas na zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo nas mnar med pa'i bar du skye mched drug gi rma ste /
translated: The term “āsrava” is derived from the root “sru” which means “to flow” and “to be placed.”🔽They are called “āsravas” because they flow out from the six sense-spheres, from the peak of existence down to Avīci hell.

original: mig la sogs pa skye mched rma lta bu'i sgo nas 'dzag cing 'bo la 'gro bas na zag pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa skye mched rma lta bu'i sgo nas 'dzag cing 'bo la 'gro bas na zag pa rnams yin no //
translated: They are called “āsravas” because they flow out from the six sense-spheres, from the peak of existence down to Avīci hell.

original: 'khyer bar byed pas na chu bo dag yin no //
analyzed: 'khyer bar byed pas na chu bo dag yin no //
translated: They are called “floods” because they carry one away.

original: 'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba yin no //
translated: They are floods because they carry off, since they carry off and lead beings to other migratory states or to other places.

original: nye bar 'dzin pas na nye bar len pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nye bar 'dzin pas na nye bar len pa dag yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: They are yokes because they bind, since they bind to other migratory states or to other places.🔽They are clingings because they grasp, since they grasp or hold consciousness to renewed existence or to sense objects such as form.🔽This is the explanation of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: chu bo zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni 'khyer ba'i tshul yin te /
analyzed: chu bo zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni 'khyer ba'i tshul yin te /
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] says that this is better:🔽What is the meaning of the term?

original: 'gro ba gzhan nam yul gzhan du 'khyer bar byed cing 'khrid par byed pas na chu bo dag yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan nam yul gzhan du 'khyer bar byed cing 'khrid par byed pas na chu bo dag yin no //
translated: They are floods because they carry off, since they carry off and lead beings to other migratory states or to other places.

original: 'gro ba gzhan nam yul gzhan du sbyor bar byed cing 'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba dag yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan nam yul gzhan du sbyor bar byed cing 'byar bar byed pas na sbyor ba dag yin no //
translated: They are yokes because they bind, since they bind to other migratory states or to other places.

original: yang srid pa'am 'dod pa la sogs par rnam par shes pa nye bar 'dzin par byed cing len par byed pas na nye bar len pa dag yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa'am 'dod pa la sogs par rnam par shes pa nye bar 'dzin par byed cing len par byed pas na nye bar len pa dag yin no //
translated: They are clingings because they grasp, since they grasp or hold consciousness to renewed existence or to sense objects such as form.

original: 'di skad du ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi ltar na ches legs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: 'di skad du ches legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi ltar na ches legs pa yin no zhes 'chad do //
translated: This is the best explanation, since it is the best.

original: ji lta zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na smras pa /
translated: How is this so?

original: phra rgyas 'di dag gi rgyud de rnam par shes pa'i rgyud yul rnams la 'dzag par byed cing 'gro bar byed pas na zag pa rnams te /
analyzed: phra rgyas 'di dag gi rgyud de rnam par shes pa'i rgyud yul rnams la 'dzag par byed cing 'gro bar byed pas na zag pa rnams te /
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate the suffering of cyclic existence.🔽They are called floods because they have a great force, for they are like floods in that they carry one away.🔽They are called bonds because they bind one to suffering.🔽They are called appropriators because they appropriate the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: byed pas sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pas sgrub pa yin no //
translated: They are called yokes because they cause suffering to be taken up.🔽They are called floods because they have a great force, for they are like floods in that they carry one away.🔽They are called bonds because they bind one to suffering.

analyzed: mngon bar 'du bya ba ste de dag nyid med par zhes bya ba bstsal ba de dag nyid med par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are called appropriators because they appropriate the suffering of cyclic existence.🔽They are called yokes because they cause suffering to be taken up.🔽They are called floods because they have a great force, for they are like floods in that they carry one away.

analyzed: shugs chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir chu bo dag ces bya ba ni chu bo dang chos mthun pa nyid du ston par byed pas te /
translated: They are called bonds because they bind one to suffering.🔽They are called appropriators because they appropriate the suffering of cyclic existence.🔽They are called yokes because they cause suffering to be taken up.

original: chu bo dang 'dra bas ni chu bo dag ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu bo dang 'dra bas ni chu bo dag ces bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called floods because they have a great force, for they are like floods in that they carry one away.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: che thang du kun du mi 'byung ba rnams ni sbyor ba dag ces bya ba ni chu bo dang sbyor ba rnams tha dad du bya bar ston pa yin te /

analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs dang sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: phra rgyas las ma gtogs pa ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa gzhan dag kyang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are there not other entanglements such as shamelessness that are not negative tendencies?

original: ji ltar na phra rgyas dag nyid kun nas dkris pa yin no zhes de skad du brjod ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phra rgyas dag nyid kun nas dkris pa yin no zhes de skad du brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that negative tendencies are entanglements?

original: de las ma gtogs pa dag yod pa bden mod kyi tha dad pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod par ni 'dod de 'dir nyon mongs pa yang kun nas dkris pa yin te /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa dag yod pa bden mod kyi tha dad pa ma yin pa dag kyang yod par ni 'dod de 'dir nyon mongs pa yang kun nas dkris pa yin te /
translated: It is true that there are other entanglements that are not negative tendencies, but it is also accepted that there are entanglements that are not distinct from them. Here, affliction is also an entanglement.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las kyang 'dod chags pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa sdug bsngal gyi rkyen zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //

translated: Similarly, the entanglements of anger, jealousy, and stinginess are to be applied as appropriate.

original: nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams ni khams gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang lta ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams ni khams gsum pa yin no //
translated: The fetters of pride, ignorance, view, grasping, and doubt exist in the three realms.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni lta ba gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dag go //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni lta ba gsum mo zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dag go //
translated: The fetter of view is the three views, that is, the afflicted view of the self, the extreme views, and false views.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni gnyis so zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni gnyis so zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: The fetter of grasping is the two, that is, the grasping of false views and the grasping of morality and vows.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba yin la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ltar lta ba gsum ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba yin la /
translated: For that very reason, the three views are the fetter of view.

original: @131a * // lta ba gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @131a * // lta ba gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For that very reason, the two views are the fetter of grasping.

original: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dri ba yin te /
analyzed: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dri ba yin te /

translated: And because the fetter of view that focuses on and is concomitant with the nonpervasive states to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin does not exist.

original: ;'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba kun du 'gro ba ma yin pa log par lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ni yod mod kyi de ni zag pa med pa la dmigs pa'i phyir mchog tu 'dzin pa dang mtshungs par

translated: The view to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path is the view of annihilation, which is not a pervasive entangle ment of view.

original: ldan pa'i chos tshor ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //

translated: Therefore, it is not concomitant with the entanglements of view from the viewpoint of focal object.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir de tshor ba la sogs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa can yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir de tshor ba la sogs pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa can yang ma yin te /

original: de lta bas na mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang des ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas kyang des ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also not concomitant with them from the viewpoint of concomitance.

original: de dag lta ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag lta ba'i phra rgyas dag ni rgyas par 'gyur ro //

original: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji lta bu zhig ce na /

analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba de dag kha nas mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te /

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag la lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'am tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag la lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'am tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: The view of holding as paramount or the view of holding as purifying and superior is increased through concomitance with those phenomena such as feeling,

original: rang gi tshogs su byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi tshogs su byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they occur in one's own collection.

original: de la lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes ming du ma btags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes ming du ma btags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not designated by the name fetter of view.

original: lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes smos na ni lta ba lnga char bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba'i phra rgyas zhes smos na ni lta ba lnga char bsdu ba yin no //
translated: If it were called the fetter of the view of the transitory collection, it would subsume all five views.

original: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes smos na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dag gzung gi mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes smos na ni 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba dag gzung gi mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta pa dag ni ma yin no zhes bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If it were called the fetter of view, then only the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, and false view would be included, not the two views that grasp an extreme.

original: lta gnyis kun du sbyor gzhan no //🔽zhes bya ba ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dag go //
analyzed: lta gnyis kun du sbyor gzhan no // zhes bya ba ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dag go //
translated: The two views are a separate fetter.🔽The two views that grasp an extreme are a separate fetter.

original: lta ba gsum yang rdzas bco brgyad //
analyzed: lta ba gsum yang rdzas bco brgyad //
translated: Three views are eighteen substances.

original: ces bya ba ni yin zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni yin zhes bya ba'i tshig lhag ma yin te /
translated: The word “are” is omitted in the root text.

original: tshig gi don ni 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba rnams la ni rdzas kyi grangs bco brgyad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig gi don ni 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin pa dang log par lta ba rnams la ni rdzas kyi grangs bco brgyad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the words is that the afflicted view of the self, extreme view, and false view are eighteen in number.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang bco brgyad kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang bco brgyad kho na yin te zhes bya ba ni rdzas zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The two views that grasp an extreme are also eighteen in number.

original: ji lta zhe na 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis yod la /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na 'dod pa'i khams na 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis yod la /
translated: What are they? In the desire realm, there are two views: the afflicted view of the self and extreme view.

original: de dag kyang log par lta ba rnams sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin par 'dod do //🔽log par lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang @132a * //
analyzed: de dag kyang log par lta ba rnams sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin par 'dod do // log par lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang @132a * //
translated: They assert that those two views are objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering alone.

original: bar bya ba'i bar rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: bar bya ba'i bar rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Wrong view is of four types: objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, and objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: de ltar na 'dod pa'i khams na drug yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dod pa'i khams na drug yod do //
translated: Thus there are six in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta bar gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de dang 'dra bas bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta bar gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de dang 'dra bas bco brgyad yin no //
translated: Just as in the desire realm, there are eighteen in the form and formless realms.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang rdzas bco brgyad yin te /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba gnyis kyang rdzas bco brgyad yin te /
translated: The two views grasping at superiorities also number eighteen substances.

original: ji lta zhe na 'dod pa'i khams na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na 'dod pa'i khams na lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i bar rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: How so? In the desire realm, there are four types of the fetter of clinging to those views as supreme: to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin, to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation, and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The fetter of clinging to rules and ritual as supreme is twofold: to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na drug yod do //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa'i khams na drug yod do //
translated: Thus there are six in the desire realm.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta bar gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ji lta bar gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: As in the desire realm, so in the form and formless realms.

original: de ltar na rdzas bco brgyad yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas bco brgyad yin no //
translated: Thus there are eighteen substances.

original: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams so //
translated: The remaining views are not so, that is, they are not fetters.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la gzung ba ni lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Because there is a difference between the apprehended object and the apprehending subject. The apprehended object is the fetter of view.

original: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: Grasping is the fetter of holding as paramount.

original: rgyu de'i phyir te gcig tu mi dge ba'i phyir dang rang dbang can yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir te gcig tu mi dge ba'i phyir dang rang dbang can yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of that cause, because they are exclusively nonvirtuous and because they are characterized by independence.

original: de dag la bshad ces bya ba ni phrag dog dang / ser sna gnyis ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa de dag gi nang nas phyung nas bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la bshad ces bya ba ni phrag dog dang / ser sna gnyis ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa kun nas dkris pa de dag gi nang nas phyung nas bshad pa'o //
translated: They are explained as being among those entanglements such as shamelessness, because they are extracted from among those entanglements.

original: gang la gcig tu mi dge ba dang rang dbang can 'di gnyis yod pa zhes bya ba ni gang la gcig tu mi dge ba nyid dang / rang dbang can nyid ces bya ba 'di gnyi ga yod pa de lta bu kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

translated: There is no other entanglement that is both exclusively nonvirtuous and independent.

original: de lta bu'i kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dag kyang gcig tu mi dge ba yin mod kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i kun nas dkris pa gzhan ni med do zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dag kyang gcig tu mi dge ba yin mod kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni ma yin no //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are nonvirtuous alone, but they are not independent because they are associated with attachment and so on.

original: 'gyod pa yang ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni yin mod kyi gcig tu mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang ma rig pa tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can ni yin mod kyi gcig tu mi dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Regret is independent because it is associated with mere ignorance, but it is not nonvirtuous alone.

original: de ni dge ba yang yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also virtuous.

original: rmongs pa dang rgod pa dang / gnyid dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: rmongs pa dang rgod pa dang / gnyid dag ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang dbang can yang ma yin la /
translated: Delusion, excitation and sleep are not independent because they are associated with attachment and so on.

original: gcig tu mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are also not nonvirtuous alone.

original: de @132b dag ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de @132b dag ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yang yin no //

original: gang gi bcu yin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag gi ltar na kun nas dkris pa bcu yin pa de'i ltar na khro ba dang 'chab pa dag kyang gcig tu mi dge ba dang rang dbang can zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi ga
analyzed: gang gi bcu yin pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag gi ltar na kun nas dkris pa bcu yin pa de'i ltar na khro ba dang 'chab pa dag kyang gcig tu mi dge ba dang rang dbang can zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyi ga
translated: Since anger and concealment are both nonvirtuous and autonomous,

original: yin pas de'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yin pas de'i phyir 'di lan ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: this is not an answer.

original: 'o na de'i lan gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i lan gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the answer?

original: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni yang dang yang du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir logs shig kun du sbyor ba nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon 'dus bzang na re phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni yang dang yang du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir logs shig kun du sbyor ba nyid du bshad do //
translated: Master Samghabhadra says: Since envy and avarice frequently occur, they are explained separately as fetters.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams la kun du sbyor ba sum cu rtsa drug yod kyang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa rnams la kun du sbyor ba sum cu rtsa drug yod kyang /
translated: Therefore, though beings born in the desire realm have thirty six fetters,
