analyzed: koo shi ka lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba can yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Kausika, gods and humans are bound by the fetters of envy and avarice.

original: nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis ni bdo na lhag par 'ching ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis ni bdo na lhag par 'ching ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: These two defilements, when they are strong, are the cause of the most serious fetters.

original: yang na phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni dbang chung bar grags pa dang / longs spyod chung ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad ston pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyis nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bshad do //
analyzed: yang na phrag dog dang ser sna dag ni dbang chung bar grags pa dang / longs spyod chung ba nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / thams cad ston pa'i phyir dang / phyogs gnyis nyon mongs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir logs shig tu bshad do //
translated: Or else, envy and avarice are explained separately because they are the cause of having few satisfactions and few possessions, because they are the only two defilements that are specific to the realm of desire, because they are the only two that are not among the ten fetters, because they are the only two that are not floods, or outflows, or bonds, or graspings, or clingings, or because they are the only two that are not mentioned among the principal defilements in the Sūtra, or else because they are the only two that are not mentioned in the list of the ten defilements.

original: bde 'gror skyes pa 'di shin tu brnyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la rgyu ni phrag dog dang ser sna dag yin te /
analyzed: bde 'gror skyes pa 'di shin tu brnyas par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de la rgyu ni phrag dog dang ser sna dag yin te /
translated: Envy and avarice are the cause of the most serious contempt in a good destiny.

original: 'di ltar dbang chung bar grags pa dang longs spyod chung ba ni btson la sogs pa dang 'dra bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang chung bar grags pa dang longs spyod chung ba ni btson la sogs pa dang 'dra bas so //
translated: For, in this destiny, those who have few possessions and are of low social rank are like prisoners.

original: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Defilements are of two types:

original: kun du gdung ba dang ldan pa dang / kun du dga' ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: kun du gdung ba dang ldan pa dang / kun du dga' ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: those that are associated with the sensation of dissatisfaction, and those that are associated with the sensation of satisfaction.

original: de dag thams cad kyang 'di gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang 'di gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: All the defilements are included in these two categories.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs kyang longs spyod kyi rten can 'di gnyis kyis shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs kyang longs spyod kyi rten can 'di gnyis kyis shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: The householder side is very much afflicted by these two, which are based on wealth.

original: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyang chos kyi rten can 'di gnyis kyis shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyang chos kyi rten can 'di gnyis kyis shin tu nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The monastic side is very much afflicted by these two, which are based on the Dharma.

original: yang na lha dang lha ma yin gyi phyogs bdud rtsi dang bud med kyi phyir shin tu nyon mongs par byed do //
analyzed: yang na lha dang lha ma yin gyi phyogs bdud rtsi dang bud med kyi phyir shin tu nyon mongs par byed do //
translated: Or else, the god and asura sides are very much afflicted for the sake of nectar and women.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Therefore the Bhagavån said:

original: koo shi ka lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: koo shi ka lha dang mi rnams ni phrag dog dang ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: Kauśika, gods and humans are fettered by the fetters of envy and avarice.

original: de bas na kun nas dkris pa bcu dag las 'di gnyis kho na kun du sbyor bar bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na kun nas dkris pa bcu dag las 'di gnyis kho na kun du sbyor bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, from among the ten entanglements, just these two are said to be fetters.

original: tha ma'i cha ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la zhes bya ba la /🔽'dod pa'i khams ni khams @133a * //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha ni 'dod pa'i khams yin la zhes bya ba la / 'dod pa'i khams ni khams @133a * //
translated: The desire realm is the lowest part.

original: gsum ril la ltos na gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
analyzed: gsum ril la ltos na gcig tu mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin pa'i phyir tha ma ste /
translated: The desire realm is the lowest part, because, in comparison with the three realms, it is the only one that is not a state of composure.

original: dman pa yin no //
analyzed: dman pa yin no //
translated: They are inferior.

original: gnyis kyis 'dod pas mi 'da' la //
analyzed: gnyis kyis 'dod pas mi 'da' la //
translated: One does not transcend the desire realm through two.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag ma spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag ma spangs na 'dod pa'i khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not transcend the desire realm if one does not abandon them.

original: sgo ba dang rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /🔽sgo ba dang chos mthun pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag yin te /
analyzed: sgo ba dang rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la / sgo ba dang chos mthun pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang gnod sems dag yin te /
translated: Because they are similar to a gatekeeper and an attendant.

original: de gnyis kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi btson ra nas 'byung du mi ster bas sgo ba lta bu yin no //🔽rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te ;
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi btson ra nas 'byung du mi ster bas sgo ba lta bu yin no // rjes su 'brang ba dang chos mthun pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa yin te ;
translated: They are similar to a gatekeeper because one is not released from the prison of the desire realm if one does not abandon the two, desire and malice.

original: dper na sgo ba bag med par gyur te btson ra nas btson shor kyang sgo ba'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis phyir zlog par byed pa ltar gsum po 'di dag gis de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na sgo ba bag med par gyur te btson ra nas btson shor kyang sgo ba'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyis phyir zlog par byed pa ltar gsum po 'di dag gis de dang 'dra'o //
translated: They are similar to an attendant because the view of the transitory collection and so on are like an attendant who, for example, prevents a prisoner from escaping even if the gatekeeper is negligent and the prisoner has escaped from prison.

original: sems can gyi tha ma zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams na re 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis ni sems can gyi tha ma so so'i skye bo nyid las mi 'da'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tha ma zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams na re 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba rnams kyis ni sems can gyi tha ma so so'i skye bo nyid las mi 'da'o //
translated: The worst of sentient beings are ordinary beings who do not transcend the state of an ordinary being due to the fetters of afflicted view of the self, clinging to rules and ritual as supreme and doubt.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams kyi tha ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams kyi tha ma 'dod pa'i khams kyi mtshan nyid las mi 'da'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The worst of realms is the desire realm, since one does not transcend the characteristics of the desire realm due to the fetters of sensual desire and malice.

original: sems can gyi nang na tha ma so so'i skye bo dag yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi nang na tha ma so so'i skye bo dag yin la /
translated: Ordinary beings are the worst of sentient beings.

original: khams kyi nang na tha ma yang 'dod pa'i khams yin te /
analyzed: khams kyi nang na tha ma yang 'dod pa'i khams yin te /
translated: The desire realm is the worst of realms.

original: de'i phyir de dag tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore they are called factors associated with inferior states.

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum yongs su gtugs te spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum yongs su gtugs te spang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in order to completely eliminate the three fetters” means in order to completely abandon the fetters of the view of the aggregates as real, the fetter of holding a view as paramount, and the fetter of doubt.

original: nyon mongs pa drug spangs pa yin na zhes bya ba ni lta ba lnga dang / the tshom mo //🔽'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma bshad de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drug spangs pa yin na zhes bya ba ni lta ba lnga dang / the tshom mo // 'dod chags la sogs pa ni ma bshad de /
translated: The phrase “having abandoned the six afflictions” refers to the five views and doubt.

original: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //🔽lta ba gsum bor la zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dang bcas pa'i phyir ro // lta ba gsum bor la zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are not mentioned because they are not abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽The phrase “having abandoned the three views” refers to the extreme view, the view of annihilation, and the view that holds a view as paramount.

original: gsum kho na gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang @133b gsum kho na gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum kho na gsungs zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom dang @133b gsum kho na gsungs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “only three are mentioned” refers to the view of the aggregates as real, the view that holds a view as paramount, and doubt.

original: sus gsungs she na /
analyzed: sus gsungs she na /
translated: By whom were they mentioned?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis te /
translated: The Bhagavan said:

original: 'di ltar mdo las /🔽btsun pa ji tsam gyis na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las / btsun pa ji tsam gyis na /
translated: Thus, a sutra states:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa lags /
translated: “Venerable, to what extent is one a stream enterer?”

original: ming chen 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ming chen 'di ltar 'phags pa nyan thos ni 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: “Mahakacyapa, a noble, a sravaka, correctly knows just as it is that this is the truth of suffering of the aryas.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //🔽'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa'o //
translated: This is the truth of the origin of suffering.🔽This is the truth of the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes bya bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so //
translated: This is the truth of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering of the aryas.

original: 'di ni kun du sbyor ba gsum po 'di lta ste 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom yang yongs su spangs shing yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kun du sbyor ba gsum po 'di lta ste 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom yang yongs su spangs shing yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: He completely abandons and completely knows the three fetters: the view of the transitory collection, the holding of an extreme view and wrong views.

original: des kun du sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: des kun du sbyor ba gsum po de dag spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa yin /
translated: Because he abandons those three fetters, he is a stream enterer.

original: rnam par mi ltung ba'i chos can yin /
analyzed: rnam par mi ltung ba'i chos can yin /
translated: He is one who will not fall back.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba yin ;
translated: He is one who is going to perfect enlightenment.

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin te /
translated: He is one who will be reborn at the most seven times.

original: lha dang mi dag gi nang du lan bdun du 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dag gi nang du lan bdun du 'khor zhing song nas sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: Having transmigrated and gone among gods and men seven times, he will make an end of suffering.

original: 'di thams cad brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di thams cad brjod par bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: All of this should be explained.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'dir mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The afflictions are of three types, etc. Here, the afflictions are considered to be those that are to be eliminated by the path of vision.

original: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba de dag ni rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba de dag ni rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: The afflicted views of the self and the extremes are of one type,

original: sdug bsngal mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong ba tsam gyis spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be eliminated by the vision of the truth of suffering alone.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices is of two types,🔽because it is to be eliminated by the vision of the truths of suffering and origination.

original: the tshom dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: the tshom dang log par lta ba dang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Doubt, false view, and the esteeming of views and morality and asceticism are the four doors of entry.

original: de la rnam pa gcig pa rnams kyi sgo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gcig pa rnams kyi sgo ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin te /
translated: Among them, the door of entry of those having one mode is the afflicted view of the self.

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba smos pas mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang snos pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba smos pas mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang snos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, by mentioning the afflicted view of the self, the extreme views are also mentioned.

original: rnam pa bzhi pa rnams kyi sgo ni the tshom yin te de smos pas log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams kyang smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi pa rnams kyi sgo ni the tshom yin te de smos pas log par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnams kyang smos pa yin no //
translated: The door of entry of those having four modes is doubt. By mentioning that, false views and the esteeming of views and morality and asceticism are also mentioned.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni dngos su smos pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni dngos su smos pa kho nar zad do //
translated: The esteeming of morality and asceticism is mentioned only explicitly.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de dag la dmigs pa @134a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang de dag la dmigs pa @134a * //
translated: Those that are desire and so on that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are also included because they are objects of those.

original: yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa kho na yin no zhes brjod par nus so //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir bsdus pa kho na yin no zhes brjod par nus so //
translated: This is what can be said.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug ces bya ba ni bdag la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas rab tu bcug ces bya ba ni bdag la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The extreme view is instigated by the view of the perishable constituents, because one grasps the self as eternal or as subject to annihilation.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas rab tu bcug ces bya ba ni gang gis 'dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas rab tu bcug ces bya ba ni gang gis 'dag par yid ches pa de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The overesteeming of mere morality and ritual is instigated by the overesteeming of morality and ritual, because one grasps that by which one is purified as being supreme.

original: log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis rab tu bcug ste zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba log par lta ba ni mnyan pa dang bsams pa'i sgo nas log par nges pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni the tshom gyis rab tu bcug ste zhes bya ba ni the tshom za ba log par lta ba ni mnyan pa dang bsams pa'i sgo nas log par nges pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Wrong view is instigated by doubt, because wrong view arises from listening to and reflecting on the teachings with doubt.

original: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus pas grub pa'i phyir mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa'i ngo bo yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsa ba bsdus pas grub pa'i phyir mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa'i ngo bo yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since the root is included, it should be understood that the extreme view, etc., also have the nature of being explained.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon 'di nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon 'di nyid do //
translated: Others say that the root is not included, because the root is not the same as the branches.

original: lam nor ba zhes bya ba ni ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: lam nor ba zhes bya ba ni ji lta zhe na /
translated: The path is mistaken, because it is not the path to the cessation of suffering.

original: lam gzhan la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: lam gzhan la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: because they are based on other paths.

original: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes smos pa'i phyir shugs kyis na gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa yang yod do zhes bshad pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa zhes smos pa'i phyir shugs kyis na gzhan gyi cha dang mthun pa yang yod do zhes bshad pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since the term “fetter that is a lower fetter” is mentioned, it is implicitly stated that there are also “fetters that are higher fetters.” Therefore, the root text states,

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid //🔽ces bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun lnga nyid // ces bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: There are five that are higher fetters.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i spros pa yin no //🔽de dag kun du sbyor sogs kyi //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i spros pa yin no // de dag kun du sbyor sogs kyi //
translated: This is an elaboration of the fetters.🔽They are explained as five types

original: dbye bas rnam pa lngar bshad do //
analyzed: dbye bas rnam pa lngar bshad do //
translated: by dividing them into fetters and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa 'dis na kun du sbyor ba bstan pa'i 'og tu 'ching ba bstan pa'i skabs la 'babs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i 'brel pa 'dis na kun du sbyor ba bstan pa'i 'og tu 'ching ba bstan pa'i skabs la 'babs te /
translated: This verse indicates that the subject matter of the next section, which deals with the bonds, follows immediately after the explanation of the fetters.

original: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa dang khams kyi sgo nas thams cad do //
analyzed: 'ching ba 'dod chags thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam pa dang khams kyi sgo nas thams cad do //
translated: The root text states, “Attachment is all the bonds.” This means that attachment is all the bonds in terms of both its aspect and realm.

original: zhe sdang ci zhe na thams cad de rnam pa kho na'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhe sdang ci zhe na thams cad de rnam pa kho na'i sgo nas so //
translated: What about aversion? It is all the bonds in terms of its aspect alone.

original: gti mug ni rnam pa dang khams kyi sgo nas thams cad do //
analyzed: gti mug ni rnam pa dang khams kyi sgo nas thams cad do //
translated: Delusion is all the bonds in terms of both its aspect and realm.

original: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni ci rigs par rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba'i tshor ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “through the object and concomitance” means that attachment increases in relation to the feeling of pleasure that exists in one’s own and others’ mental continuums, as is appropriate.

original: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid kyi sgo nas sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la ni zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Aversion increases in relation to the feeling of pain through the object and concomitance.

original: de bdag nyid kyi sgo nas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi sgo nas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Delusion increases in relation to the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain through its very nature.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la de kho na bzhin rgyas par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa la de kho na bzhin rgyas par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t it the case that attachment and aversion also increase in relation to the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain?

original: ci'i phyir gti mug kho na brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gti mug kho na brjod ce na /
translated: Why is only delusion mentioned?

original: de'i @134b phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i @134b phyir 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond to this, the root text states, “Attachment and aversion are not like that.”

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang de la rgyas par ni 'gyur mod kyi gti mug ji lta ba de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag kyang de la rgyas par ni 'gyur mod kyi gti mug ji lta ba de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Attachment and aversion do increase in that realm, but not like delusion.

original: gti mug ni mi gsal bas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba mi gsal ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir shin tu rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gti mug ni mi gsal bas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba mi gsal ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir shin tu rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Delusion increases greatly because it is unclear and it is compatible with the unclear feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.🔽Or, they are ascertained by the object that exists in one’s mindstream.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mthus de ltar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la sogs pa nyams su myong ba'i mthus de ltar nges pa yin te /
translated: They are ascertained in that way through the power of experiencing pleasure, etc., that exist in one’s mindstream.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i tshor ba bde ba la ni 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la /
translated: Attachment increases in relation to the feeling of pleasure that exists in one’s mindstream through association.

original: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang ngo //
translated: Aversion increases in relation to the feeling of pain that exists in one’s mindstream.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug go /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni gti mug go /🔽// / bam po bzhi bcu rtsa gsum pa /
translated: Delusion increases in relation to the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain that exists in one’s mindstream.

original: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bde ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar zhe sdang ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dag ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bde ba la 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar zhe sdang ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Just as pleasure increases attachment, it does not increase hostility.

original: yang ci bde ba la yang zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci bde ba la yang zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But does hostility increase in relation to pleasure?

original: dgra bo'i bde ba la dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bo'i bde ba la dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It increases in relation to the pleasure of an enemy.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar 'dod chags ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal la zhe sdang rgyas par 'gyur ba ltar 'dod chags ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Just as suffering increases hostility, it does not increase attachment.

original: yang ci sdug bsngal la yang 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci sdug bsngal la yang 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But does attachment increase in relation to suffering?

original: dgra bo'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bo'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It increases in relation to the suffering of an enemy.

original: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: yang na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig tu na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i bde ba la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Or else, it is certain that attachment increases in relation to pleasure that exists in one's own mindstream and hostility increases in relation to suffering that exists in one's own mindstream.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i dgra bo'i bde ba la ni ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur gyi gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i dgra bo'i bde ba la ni ma yin no // de bzhin du rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Attachment increases through the power of concomitance, not through the power of objective field, since it does not increase with regard to the pleasure of an enemy existing in another stream.🔽In the same way, anger increases through the power of objective field, since it has suffering for its object,

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas khong khro ba rgyas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas khong khro ba rgyas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: or through the power of concomitance,

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dgra bo'i sdug bsngal la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa dgra bo'i sdug bsngal la ni ma yin no /
translated: but not with regard to the suffering of an enemy existing in another stream.

original: de ltar na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i dmigs pa'i sgo nas nges pa yin te /
translated: Thus, attachment and anger are determined through the power of objective field, since they increase with regard to the object existing in one's own stream.

original: tshor ba bde ba la ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gi sgo nas 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la /🔽sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang @135a * //
analyzed: tshor ba bde ba la ni dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag gi sgo nas 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur la / sdug bsngal la ni zhe sdang @135a * //
translated: Attachment increases through the power of objective field and concomitance, since it has pleasant feeling for its object and is associated with it.

original: rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Anger increases through the power of objective field, since it has suffering for its object.

original: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that they defile the mind, because they render the mind defiled.

original: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
analyzed: nyon mongs las gzhan nyon mongs can //
translated: Afflicted mental factors are different from the afflictions.

original: sems byung zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ngag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;🔽/ nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i ngo bo'am /
analyzed: sems byung zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa ngag las gzhan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ; / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa kho na yin zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i ngo bo'am /
translated: Mental factors are called afflicted because they are different from the afflictions.🔽They are called branch afflictions because they are the nature of afflictions or they are close to the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa nye bar 'dug pa yod pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nye bar 'dug pa yod pas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: They are also called branch afflictions because they are close to the afflictions.

original: de dag kyang sems las byung ba kho na yin gyi sems dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang sems las byung ba kho na yin gyi sems dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are mental factors alone, not concomitant with the mind.🔽They are those that occur in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsung rab kyi cha gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang dag yin pa yin gyis /🔽sems pa la sogs pa kho na ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang dag yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gsung rab kyi cha gzhi phran tshegs las 'byung ba gang dag yin pa yin gyis /🔽sems pa la sogs pa kho na ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin te /
translated: They are those that occur in the Kṣudraka Collection of the scriptures, not just intention and so on.

original: 'di lta ste mi dga' ba dang / glal byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod mi zin pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / yid la mi byed pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi dga' ba dang / glal byed pa dang / sems zhum pa nyid dang rmya ba dang / zas kyi drod mi zin pa nyid dang / tha dad pa nyid kyi 'du shes dang / yid la mi byed pa dang / lus kyi gnas ngan len dang /
translated: They are: displeasure, yawning, mental lassitude, depression, inability to digest food, the perception of difference, lack of mental engagement, physical dysfunction,

original: ru gdug dang / 'phya smod dang / gnam pa nyid dang / mi gnam pa nyid dang / rang bzhin du mi 'dug pa nyid dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: ru gdug dang / 'phya smod dang / gnam pa nyid dang / mi gnam pa nyid dang / rang bzhin du mi 'dug pa nyid dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / nye ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: cruelty, contempt, envy, non-envy, lack of natural composure, thoughts of desire, thoughts of harm, thoughts of attachment,

original: yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / brnyas pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rigs snyems pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / mi 'chi ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang / brnyas pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / rigs snyems pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / mya ngan dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang /
translated: thoughts of objects, thoughts of immortality, thoughts of contempt, thoughts of pride in one's family, sorrow, suffering, mental unease,

original: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba dag yin no /
analyzed: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba dag yin no /
translated: and agitation.

original: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of abashment have already been explained.

original: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
analyzed: ma gus ngo tsha med khrel med //
translated: Disrespect is shamelessness and lack of abashment.

original: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One does not fear evil.

original: chos dang zang zing dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'gal ba can sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang zang zing dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ser sna ni chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'gal ba can sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Greed is the grasping of the mind that is contrary to the giving of Dharma, material goods, and knowledge.

original: bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro shig snyam pa'i rnam pa ni ser sna yin no //🔽ser sna nyid ser sna yin pa'am /
analyzed: bdag las gzhan du ma 'gro shig snyam pa'i rnam pa ni ser sna yin no // ser sna nyid ser sna yin pa'am /
translated: The form of greed is the thought, “Do not go to others from me!”🔽Greed is itself greed,

original: ser sna can gyi ngo bo ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: ser sna can gyi ngo bo ni ser sna'o //
translated: or the nature of a greedy person is greed.

original: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni @135b bshad zin te zhes bya ba ni ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang rmugs pa ni @135b bshad zin te zhes bya ba ni ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Regret and lethargy have already been explained.

original: 'dir ni 'gyod pa de la dmigs pa'i chos yin zhes pa dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'gyod pa de la dmigs pa'i chos yin zhes pa dang / rmugs pa ni lus dang sems las su mi rung pa nyid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, regret is the dharma that focuses on that regret, and lethargy is unserviceability of body and mind.

original: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod na ni snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin mi nus pa zhes bya bas khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: gnyid ni sems mngon par sdud pa'o zhes bya ba de tsam zhig brjod na ni snyoms par 'jug pa la yang thal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir lus yang dag par 'dzin mi nus pa zhes bya bas khyad par du byed de /
translated: Sleep is the complete withdrawal of the mind. If one were to say that much, it would follow that meditative attainment would also be sleep. Therefore, it is distinguished by the words, “the inability to properly hold the body.”

original: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa can kho na yin no //
translated: It is only an afflicted state.🔽Sleep and regret are only afflicted entanglements.

original: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyid ni nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dang 'gyod pa ni nyon mongs pa can kho na kun nas dkris pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyid ni nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kun nas dkris pa yin gyi /
translated: Sleep is an entanglement only when it is afflicted.

original: dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris pa ma yin te /
translated: When it is virtuous or neutral, it is not an entanglement.

original: gnyid ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: gnyid ni rnam pa gsum du 'dod do //
translated: Sleep is asserted to be of three types.

original: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gyod pa yang nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kun nas dkris pa yin gyi dge ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Regret is an entanglement only when it is afflicted.

original: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang mi dge ba yin par 'dod do //
translated: It is asserted to be virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod sems ni kun nas mnar sems kyi khyad par sems can la zhe sdang ba yin
analyzed: khro ba ni gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa la kun nas mnar sems pa gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod sems ni kun nas mnar sems kyi khyad par sems can la zhe sdang ba yin
translated: Malice is a special form of hostility that is hatred toward sentient beings.

original: te / sems can 'di rnams bsad dam bcings sam brlag gam 'dis phongs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ni gnod sems yin no //
analyzed: te / sems can 'di rnams bsad dam bcings sam brlag gam 'dis phongs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa'i rnam par zhugs pa ni gnod sems yin no //
translated: It is the state of mind that engages in the thought, “How good it would be if these sentient beings were killed, bound, destroyed, or ruined.”

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can la snyogs pa dang / rdeg pa dang / skrag par byed pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i las la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni sems can la snyogs pa dang / rdeg pa dang / skrag par byed pa dang / bsdigs pa la sogs pa'i las la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Violence is the state of mind that engages in the action of tormenting sentient beings, such as beating, terrifying, threatening, and so on.

original: khro ba ni de gnyis las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa yin te /
analyzed: khro ba ni de gnyis las gzhan pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa dag la kun nas mnar sems pa yin te /
translated: Anger is the state of mind that is hostile toward sentient beings and non-sentient things, except for malice and violence.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dge slong bslab pa 'dod pa'i sems 'khrugs pa'am tsher ma la sogs pa la 'khrugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong bslab pa 'dod pa'i sems 'khrugs pa'am tsher ma la sogs pa la 'khrugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The monk who is disturbed in mind, or who is disturbed by a thorn, etc.,

original: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni //🔽gzhan dag na re rgyal po la sogs pas shes pas gang zag 'chab pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'chab pa ni srid pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du shes pa dang mi shes pa rnams kyi yin no zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni // gzhan dag na re rgyal po la sogs pas shes pas gang zag 'chab pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi 'chab pa ni srid pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: and who does not confess his transgression, is in possession of concealment.

original: bdag la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'i phyir ro //🔽mi shes pa rnams @136a * //
analyzed: bdag la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti med par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pa'i phyir ro // mi shes pa rnams @136a * //
translated: Others say: Concealment is the cause of existence for those who are conscious of their transgression, because they think: “It would not be right for me to be without gain and honor.”

original: kyi ni mi rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: kyi ni mi rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin te /
translated: It is the cause of non-knowledge for those who are not conscious of their transgression,

original: las bdag gir bya ba nyid du ma dad pa ni kha na ma tho ba de 'chab cing gtsang mar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la 'chags par mi byed do //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba nyid du ma dad pa ni kha na ma tho ba de 'chab cing gtsang mar bya ba'i phyir gzhan la 'chags par mi byed do //
translated: because they do not confess their transgression to another in order to purify themselves.

original: de lta bas na 'chab pa ni gnyi ga'i rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'chab pa ni gnyi ga'i rgyu mthun pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus concealment is the cause of both existence and non-knowledge.

original: ji ltar na khrel med pa ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin zhe na /🔽'di ltar khrel med /🔽kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
analyzed: ji ltar na khrel med pa ma rig pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin zhe na / 'di ltar khrel med / kha na ma tho 'jigs mi lta //
translated: How is shamelessness a homogeneous cause of ignorance?

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said,

original: the tshom las 'gyod ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kho na ste /
analyzed: the tshom las 'gyod ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de kho na ste /
translated: Shamelessness is the cause of nonembarrassment.🔽Nonembarrassment is the cause of the other two.🔽Regret is from doubt.

original: kun nas dkris pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the context is the discussion of the entanglements.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs dri ma drug / ces bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, there are six defilements of the defilements.

original: dper na lus la dri ma dag 'byung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dag las kyang sgyu la sogs pa'i dri ma lta bu 'di rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dper na lus la dri ma dag 'byung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa dag las kyang sgyu la sogs pa'i dri ma lta bu 'di rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as the body has such things as dirt, so too the defilements have these defilements such as deceit.

original: gtam rlung bskur ba ni gzhan du sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtam rlung bskur ba ni gzhan du sgyur ba'o //
translated: Slander is the spreading of talk about others’ faults.🔽Concealment is the hiding of one’s own faults.

original: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: rgyags pa ni sngar bshad zin te /
translated: Arrogance was already explained.

original: rgyags pa ni /🔽rang gi chos la chags pa yi //
analyzed: rgyags pa ni / rang gi chos la chags pa yi //
translated: Arrogance is

original: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: sems ni yongs su gtugs pa'o //
translated: the complete inflation of the mind

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: due to attachment to one’s own qualities.

original: gang zhig gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa gang zhig mthong ba ni gang mthong ba'o //🔽de mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba ni bden pa gang zhig mthong ba ni gang mthong ba'o // de mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: That associated with that which is to be abandoned by seeing that is the truth that is seen.🔽That which is to be abandoned by seeing that is to be abandoned by seeing that truth.

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni gang mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: That associated with that which is to be abandoned by seeing that is associated with that which is to be abandoned by seeing that.

original: de ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: That is to be abandoned by seeing that.

original: gang dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is shamelessness and so on.

original: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni bsgom spang bya //
translated: The others are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The others are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa phrag dog la sogs pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni ngo tsha med pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa phrag dog la sogs pa ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba kho na yin gyi /
translated: The others are envy and so on, which are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation alone.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga po dag ni rang dbang yin te /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lnga po dag ni rang dbang yin te /
translated: The five secondary mental afflictions are independent.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not under the control of others, such as attachment.🔽Lethargy, excitation and sleep are nonvirtuous and indeterminate. Since this is the section on entanglements, they are not described as virtuous.🔽The remaining are indeterminate.🔽The remaining are indeterminate.🔽The remaining are indeterminate.

analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang gnyid rnams ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir grub pas dge ba yang yin no zhes mi brjod do //
translated: The remaining are indeterminate.🔽The remaining are indeterminate.

original: de yan chad ni lung du ma bstan zhes bya ba la ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni /🔽'dod pa'i khams kyi gong na ji snyed sred pa ste /
