original: tshangs pa chen po 'byung ba chen po 'di dag ma lus bar gang du'ang 'gag par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang ma shes nas gtam rlung bskur te /🔽bdag ni tshangs pa'o //🔽tshangs pa chen po'o //🔽dbang phyug go //🔽byed pa po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po 'byung ba chen po 'di dag ma lus bar gang du'ang 'gag par 'gyur zhes dris pa dang ma shes nas gtam rlung bskur te / bdag ni tshangs pa'o // tshangs pa chen po'o // dbang phyug go // byed pa po'o //
translated: The great Brahma asked, Where do these great elements cease without remainder? He did not know and sent the message.

original: sprul pa po'o //🔽'byin pa po'o //🔽'byin byed do //
analyzed: sprul pa po'o // 'byin pa po'o // 'byin byed do //
translated: I am Brahma, the great Brahma, the all-seeing, the powerful, the lord, the maker, the fashioner, the creator, the cause, the transformer, the father of all this world, having power over all this world.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur ba yin no zhes sgyus 'drid par brtsams so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phar gyur ba yin no zhes sgyus 'drid par brtsams so //
translated: He began to deceive by his magic.

original: de'i 'og tu tshangs pa chen po des tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi lag nas bzung ste phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu tshangs pa chen po des tshe dang ldan pa rta thul gyi lag nas bzung ste phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: Then the great Brahma took hold of the venerable Asvajit's arm and went off to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang 'di skad ces /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas kyang 'di skad ces /
translated: Having gone off to one side, he said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs bzhin du bdag la 'dri bar sems sam zhes smras so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs bzhin du bdag la 'dri bar sems sam zhes smras so //
translated: Do you think that I should ask you while the Tathagata is present?

original: de lta bas na de'i 'di ni sgyu yin par snang ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i 'di ni sgyu yin par snang ste /
translated: Therefore, this is his magic.

original: rang gi 'khor gyis brnyas pa'i ngo tsha bas bdag nyid kyis mi shes pa sbed pa na des de skad du smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi 'khor gyis brnyas pa'i ngo tsha bas bdag nyid kyis mi shes pa sbed pa na des de skad du smras pa yin no //
translated: He speaks thus because he is ashamed to be ridiculed by his retinue, and because he conceals his own ignorance.

original: g-yo ni bshad zin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni g-yo ni /
analyzed: g-yo ni bshad zin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni g-yo ni /
translated: Though deceit has already been explained, he says,

original: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
analyzed: de las 'gyod gnyid mi dge rnams //
translated: Regret, sleep, and the unwholesome states

original: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dag na med //
translated: are absent in the first meditative absorption.

original: ces bya ba der ni bshad mod kyi zhar la 'ongs pas yang smos so //
analyzed: ces bya ba der ni bshad mod kyi zhar la 'ongs pas yang smos so //
translated: Though this has already been explained, he mentions it again as an aside.🔽Five are abandoned,

original: lnga bor te zhes bya ba ni g-yo dang sgyu dang rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang rgyags pa rnams so //
analyzed: lnga bor te zhes bya ba ni g-yo dang sgyu dang rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang rgyags pa rnams so //
translated: namely, deceit, pretense, arrogance, violence, and spite.

original: de dag ni thams cad yid kyi sa pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang nga rgyal dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad yid kyi sa pa dag yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyid dang nga rgyal dag go //
translated: Sleep and pride are on all mental levels.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs rang dbang yang //
translated: The secondary afflictions are independent.

original: zhes bya ba ni phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phrag dog dang ser sna la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are envy, avarice, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag gi nang du bshad pa gang dag yin pa'o zhes pa ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang bag med pa dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po dag gi nang du bshad pa gang dag yin pa'o zhes pa ni ma dad pa dang le lo dang bag med pa dag kho na yin no //
translated: Those that are explained as being in the group of the great grounds of affliction are the three: lack of faith, laziness, and heedlessness.

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin te /
translated: The others are not.

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dag ni 'di nyid du sngar smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa dag ni 'di nyid du sngar smos zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Dullness and agitation are mentioned earlier in this verse.

original: gti mug ni nyon mongs pa zhes smos pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gti mug ni nyon mongs pa zhes smos pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Delusion is included by the term “affliction.”

original: bde ba dag dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang po dag dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni dga' ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: bde ba dag dang zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang po dag dang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dga' ba dang skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags ni dga' ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin la /
translated: “The faculties of pleasure” means the faculties that have the nature of the feeling of pleasure.🔽“Because they engage their objects with joy and with aversion” means that attachment engages its object with joy,

original: zhe sdang ni skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te @137a * //🔽go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir te @137a * //🔽go rims bzhin no //
translated: and aversion engages its object with aversion.🔽This is because they engage their objects in order.

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Because it belongs to the level of the six consciousnesses. Attachment is associated with the faculty of pleasure because it belongs to the level of the five consciousnesses.

original: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Aversion is associated with the faculty of pain.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Attachment is associated with the faculty of mental pleasure because it belongs to the level of mental consciousness.

original: zhe sdang ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no //🔽bsod nams kyi las can rnams dang sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi dang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi las can rnams kyi log par lta ba ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan no // bsod nams kyi las can rnams dang sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi dang go rims bzhin no zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi las can rnams kyi log par lta ba ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: Aversion is associated with the faculty of mental displeasure.🔽In the case of those who have meritorious karma and those who have sinful karma, respectively.

original: bsod nams byed pa'i 'bad pa don med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa'i 'bad pa don med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of those who have meritorious karma, wrong view is associated with mental displeasure because they see the effort to create merit as pointless.

original: sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las can rnams kyi log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: The wrong view of those who have sinful karma is concomitant with mental satisfaction.

original: rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa 'bras bu med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i sdig pa 'bras bu med par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they see the sin they have committed as having no result.

original: lta ba bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba bzhi dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The four views are the view of the transitory collection, the view grasping an extreme, the view holding a view to be paramount, and the view holding ethics and spiritual disciplines to be paramount.

original: ji ltar chad par lta ba yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar chad par lta ba yid bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is the view of annihilation concomitant with mental satisfaction?

original: de mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one desires it.

original: btang snyoms kun du gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms kun du gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i gnas skabs na gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be associated with equanimity because it is associated with the other mental states.

original: sa gang na dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa gang na dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How many faculties are there in each realm?

original: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
analyzed: skye ba'i bsam gtan dag na ni //
translated: In the realms of birth and meditative attainment,

original: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod //🔽ces bya ba lta bu khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: yid bde bde dang btang snyoms dang // btang snyoms yid bde bde ba dang // btang snyoms btang snyoms tshor ba yod // ces bya ba lta bu khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of pleasure, and the faculty of equanimity exist in the first meditative absorption.

original: sa gong ma de na yang mig dang rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi po rnams ni /
analyzed: sa gong ma de na yang mig dang rna ba dang lus dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i sa pa rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi po rnams ni /
translated: The faculty of mental pleasure exists in the third and fourth meditative absorptions.🔽The faculty of equanimity exists in all stages.🔽The faculty of mental pleasure and the faculty of equanimity exist in the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po khon na yod de bsam gtan dang po na ni bde ba'i dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po khon na yod de bsam gtan dang po na ni bde ba'i dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs gsum pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs pa dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhi pa yod do //
translated: The faculty of pleasure exists in the first three meditative stages.

original: de yan chad kyi sa pa kho na na yod de /
analyzed: de yan chad kyi sa pa kho na na yod de /
translated: The faculty of pain exists in the realm of desire.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa na ni yid bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag yod do //
translated: The faculty of neutral feeling exists in all three realms.

original: @137b gsum pa na ni bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag yod do //
analyzed: @137b gsum pa na ni bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po dag yod do //
translated: The third has the faculties of pleasure and equanimity.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang gzugs med pa dag na ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po kho na yod do //
translated: The fourth absorption and the formless realm have only the faculty of equanimity.

original: de la phra rgyas thams cad kyang ji ltar 'os 'os su tshor ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la phra rgyas thams cad kyang ji ltar 'os 'os su tshor ba'i dbang po dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin te /
translated: All negative tendencies are concomitant with the faculty of feeling as appropriate.

original: de ni zhi gnas kyis rgyud brlan pa'i phyir dga' ba dang skyo ba rnam par gzhag pa ni med do //🔽'gyod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni zhi gnas kyis rgyud brlan pa'i phyir dga' ba dang skyo ba rnam par gzhag pa ni med do // 'gyod pa la sogs pa 'di dag ni skyo ba'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: In the fourth absorption and the formless realm, there is no establishment of joy and sorrow because the mindstream is moistened by serenity.

original: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan la /
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan la /
translated: Regret and so on are not concomitant with mental satisfaction because they engage the mind with a sense of sorrow.

original: yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yang mtshungs par mi ldan no //
analyzed: yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang yang mtshungs par mi ldan no //
translated: They are also not concomitant with the faculty of pain because they are on the level of the mental faculty.

original: chags pa'i rgyud las byung bas zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i rgyu can nyid kyis te /
analyzed: chags pa'i rgyud las byung bas zhes bya ba ni chags pa'i rgyu can nyid kyis te /
translated: They arise from a continuum of attachment means they arise due to attachment.

original: chags pas kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chags pas kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because it is motivated by attachment.

original: de dag dang rgyags pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dag dang ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang rgyags pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dag dang ngo //
translated: Those and arrogance are pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni rgyags pa ni yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa na ni bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no zhes bya ba ni rgyags pa ni yid kyi sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the third absorption, it is concomitant with pleasure, because arrogance is on the level of the mental faculty.

original: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma rig pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang la yang mtshungs par ldan pa dgag pa med pa ltar btang snyoms kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ma rig pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang la yang mtshungs par ldan pa dgag pa med pa ltar btang snyoms kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Like ignorance, just as ignorance is not definitely concomitant with any affliction or branch of affliction, equanimity is also like that.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa dag ni mi dge ba'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are on the level of nonvirtue,

original: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mi dge la ni khrel med dang // ngo tsha med pa'o zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: because it is said, “Shamelessness and lack of conscience are nonvirtue.”

original: rmugs pa dang rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang rgod pa ni nyon mongs pa'i sa mang po pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Drowsiness and excitation are on the level of the afflictions,🔽because it is said, “Drowsiness and excitation are the afflictions.”

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag srid pas de'i phyir de dag ni dbang po lnga char dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa srid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug la ni mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dag srid pas de'i phyir de dag ni dbang po lnga char dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa srid do //
translated: Since nonvirtue and the afflicted are possible for the sixfold collection of consciousness, it is possible that they are concomitant with all five faculties.🔽Are lethargy, excitation, and doubt accepted as belonging to the three realms?

original: ci rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang the tshom khams gsum pa dag gzung ngam zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams ni khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kho na bkar te 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: ci rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang the tshom khams gsum pa dag gzung ngam zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams ni khams gsum pa yin pa'i phyir de dag kho na bkar te 'dri bar byed do //
translated: These are asked about separately because they belong to the three realms.

original: mi dge ba'i phung po 'di ni ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge slong dag sgrib pa lnga ni mi dge ba'i phung po yin no zhes smra ba de dag ni yang dag par smra ba smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i phung po 'di ni ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni dge slong dag sgrib pa lnga ni mi dge ba'i phung po yin no zhes smra ba de dag ni yang dag par smra ba smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, those who say that these five obscurations are the aggregates of nonvirtue speak correctly.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge slong dag 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni mi dge ba'i phung po ma 'dres pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Monks, this is the complete and unmixed heap of nonvirtue.

original: 'di lta ste sgrib pa lnga'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gcig tu mi dge bar @138a * //🔽gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sgrib pa lnga'o zhes bya ba rgyas par gcig tu mi dge bar @138a * // gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five hindrances are:

original: 'dod na sgrib rnams yod kyi khams gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba dang mdo'i tshig gcig pa nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod na sgrib rnams yod kyi khams gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ni 'grel ba dang mdo'i tshig gcig pa nyid du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The hindrances exist in the desire realm, not in other realms.

original: sgrib rnams zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag gi sgrib pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrib rnams zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag gi sgrib pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The hindrances are the hindrances to the absorptions and meditative attainments.🔽Because they have the same opposition, sustenance, and function.

original: mi mthun dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /🔽ngo bo'i rkyen med kyang ngo bo gtsor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa can nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste / ngo bo'i rkyen med kyang ngo bo gtsor bstan pa yin no //
translated: The same opposition means that they are opposed to the absorptions and meditative attainments.🔽The same sustenance means that they are sustained by the same sustenance as the absorptions and meditative attainments.🔽The same function means that they have the same function as the absorptions and meditative attainments.🔽The same opposition, sustenance, and function means that they have the same opposition, sustenance, and function.

original: yang na mi mthun pa dang zas dang bya ba gcig pas na mi mthun pa dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na mi mthun pa dang zas dang bya ba gcig pas na mi mthun pa dang / zas dang bya ba gcig pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the same opposition, sustenance, and function means that they have the same opposition, sustenance, and function.

original: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang gnyen po dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Disagreeable and antidote.

original: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par mi mthun pa ni gnyen po yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir tshig le'ur byas pa dang mthun par mi mthun pa ni gnyen po yin par 'dod de /
translated: Here, in accordance with the metrical arrangement, the disagreeable is considered to be the antidote.

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'gal ba'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the side that is adverse to the defilements is disagreeable.

original: chos mngon pa las ni nag po'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa yin la dkar po'i phyogs ni gnyen po yin no zhes bya bar grags so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las ni nag po'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa yin la dkar po'i phyogs ni gnyen po yin no zhes bya bar grags so //
translated: But in the Abhidharma, it is well known that the dark side is disagreeable and the bright side is the antidote.

original: kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'os par mang du zos pa'i lus shig shig por 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha zas kyi drod mi zin pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'os par mang du zos pa'i lus shig shig por 'gyur ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The indigestion of food is the condition of the body that is shaken by eating too much at the wrong time.

original: zas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o /
analyzed: zas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o /
translated: The antidote is the proper amount of food.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis ni shes rab kyi phung po la ji zhe na /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis ni shes rab kyi phung po la ji zhe na /
translated: What is the harm in torpor and sleep to the aggregate of wisdom?

original: gnod par byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The harm is that it injures.

original: rtog pa 'di la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni go rims gang gi tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po zhes phung po rnams rnam par 'jog pa'i go rims de nyid kyis de dag gi mi mthun par gyur ba'i sgrib pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa 'di la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni go rims gang gi tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po zhes phung po rnams rnam par 'jog pa'i go rims de nyid kyis de dag gi mi mthun par gyur ba'i sgrib pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang /
translated: In that order, the obscurations that are antithetical to them are stated in the verse as desire,🔽malice,🔽excitation and regret,

original: gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / the tshom zhes 'don par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnod sems dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / the tshom zhes 'don par 'gyur te /
translated: and doubt.

original: shes rab kyi phung po bas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po gong nas 'byung ba'i phyir rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa lngar smos par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po bas ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po gong nas 'byung ba'i phyir rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa lngar smos par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang yin te /
translated: Since the aggregate of meditative stabilization is stated before the aggregate of wisdom, it would follow that the obscurations of excitation and regret would be stated before the obscurations of sleep and lethargy.🔽But that is not the case.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not a valid reason.

original: 'di la ni gtan tshigs gang yin snyam nas smras pa de'i phyir grangs bzhin du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa 'di gnyis kyis ting nge @138b 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po la gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni gtan tshigs gang yin snyam nas smras pa de'i phyir grangs bzhin du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa 'di gnyis kyis ting nge @138b 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po la gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The two obscurations of lethargy-sleep and excitation-worry harm the aggregates of meditative stabilization and wisdom, respectively.

original: ji ltar zhe na smras pa ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis 'jigs te ngo bo 'dra ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na smras pa ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa ni rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis 'jigs te ngo bo 'dra ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How so? One who is striving for meditative stabilization fears lethargy-sleep because they are similar in nature.

original: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: One who is striving to discern phenomena fears excitation-worry because they are similar in nature.

original: the tshom ni de la langs na yang chos la nges par rtog pa'i tshe bar chad byed do //
analyzed: the tshom ni de la langs na yang chos la nges par rtog pa'i tshe bar chad byed do //
translated: Doubt interrupts the discernment of phenomena even when one has risen from meditative attainment.🔽Others recite the verse as follows:🔽Lethargy, sleep, excitation,🔽worry, and doubt.

original: gzhan dag ni tshig 'di skad du rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom zhes bya bar 'don cing 'di skad du yang 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni tshig 'di skad du rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom zhes bya bar 'don cing 'di skad du yang 'chad de /
translated: They explain it as follows:

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar du gcod par byed pa yin la /
translated: Lethargy and sleep are obstacles to serenity.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni lhag mthong gi bar du gcod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa ni lhag mthong gi bar du gcod par byed pa yin /
translated: Excitement and regret are obstacles to insight.

original: the tshom ni langs pa la chos nges par rtog pa'i tshe bar chad byed pa yin pas rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni langs pa la chos nges par rtog pa'i tshe bar chad byed pa yin pas rgod pa dang 'gyod pas 'jigs so zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Doubt is an obstacle to the time of the ascertainment of the teaching when one is engaged in the application of the teaching.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du brjod do zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon dag go //🔽rgyu bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'byams pas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du brjod do zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi slob dpon dag go // rgyu bar gyur pas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'byams pas so //
translated: Other masters give other explanations, but the former masters explain in this way.

original: mtshan mar gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /🔽bud med kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: mtshan mar gzung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni / bud med kyi gzugs zhes bya ba'am /
translated: “In the case of one who is distracted,” means in the case of one who is distracted in order to beg for alms.🔽“In the case of one who is distracted by signs,” means🔽in the case of one who is distracted by the signs of a woman,

original: bud med kyi sgra zhes bya bar gzung ba'i phyir ro //🔽gnas par gyur ba nang du yang dag 'jog pa 'greng ba'am /
analyzed: bud med kyi sgra zhes bya bar gzung ba'i phyir ro // gnas par gyur ba nang du yang dag 'jog pa 'greng ba'am /
translated: or by the signs of the voice of a woman.

original: 'dug pa'am / 'chag pa'am de sngon du 'gro bas te /
analyzed: 'dug pa'am / 'chag pa'am de sngon du 'gro bas te /
translated: “In the case of one who is distracted by abiding,” means in the case of one who is distracted by standing, sitting, or walking, or by the preliminary stage of concentration.

original: yul sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: yul sdug pa dang mi sdug pa la mtshan mar 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'am /
translated: They are preceded by the apprehension of signs of agreeable and disagreeable objects,

original: yul sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sngon du 'gro ba dag go //
analyzed: yul sdug pa dang mi sdug pa sngon du 'gro ba dag go //
translated: or they are preceded by agreeable and disagreeable objects.

original: go rims bzhin du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag la bar chad byed la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag la bar chad byed la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Dullness and drowsiness, excitedness and regret, and uncertainty obstruct serenity and insight, respectively.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar chad byed do /
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid ni zhi gnas kyi bar chad byed do /
translated: Dullness and drowsiness obstruct serenity.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag nye ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dag nye ba'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because dullness and drowsiness are by nature states of mental contraction.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom dag ni lhag mthong gi bar chad byed do //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom dag ni lhag mthong gi bar chad byed do //
translated: Excitedness and regret and uncertainty obstruct insight.

original: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa bzlas dbye ba gcig pa lta bu'i ngo bor byas pa the tshom dang / lhan cig yang zlas dbye ba byas te /
analyzed: rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa bzlas dbye ba gcig pa lta bu'i ngo bor byas pa the tshom dang / lhan cig yang zlas dbye ba byas te /
translated: Excitedness and regret are treated as a single category, and uncertainty is treated as a separate category.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag dang the tshom dag ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dang the tshom ni rgod pa dang 'gyod pa dag dang the tshom dag ces bya ba yin no //
translated: Excitement, regret, and doubt are the three: excitement, regret, and doubt.

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba log par lta ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis tha dad pa @139a * //🔽gnyis su gyur pa rnams gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa dang mthun pa'i lam gyis dmigs pa yongs su shes pa de'i tshe ni sngar sdug bsngal la chos shes
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams kun du 'gro ba log par lta ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid kyis tha dad pa @139a * // gnyis su gyur pa rnams gang gi tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i gnas skabs na sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa dang mthun pa'i lam gyis dmigs pa yongs su shes pa de'i tshe ni sngar sdug bsngal la chos shes
translated: The two that are different due to being objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin that are pervasive negative tendencies of different realms such as wrong view and so on become two.🔽When they focus on the realms of form and formlessness, they are objects to be abandoned by the path that is compatible with subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: pa dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas ci rigs par spangs zin pa nyid kyi phyir spang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: pa dang / kun 'byung ba la chos shes pas ci rigs par spangs zin pa nyid kyi phyir spang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, they are not objects to be abandoned because they were previously abandoned by Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, respectively.

original: de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir chos shes pas gzhom par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir chos shes pas gzhom par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Because they are objects to be abandoned by Dharma knowledge, they are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing that is compatible with Dharma knowledge.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i phyogs🔽dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i ngo bo nyid sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'am /
translated: Also, the afflicted view of holding a view as paramount and so on that focus on contaminated states abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path are not abandoned when the aspect of the truths of suffering and origin that are their focal objects are fully understood as the same in terms of the realms.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas khams ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa de'i tshe na de dag spong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas khams ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa de'i tshe na de dag spong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That is, they are not abandoned by the path of seeing that is the aspect of the truths of suffering and origin that is the aspect of Dharma knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin or the aspect of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin.

original: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not abandoned at that time because they are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of cessation and path.🔽How are they abandoned?

original: ji ltar de dag spang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni de dag spong bar mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar de dag spang zhe na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni de dag spong bar mi rung ngo snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is stated because it is thought that they are not abandoned by fully understanding their focal objects.

original: rang gi sa pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su kun du 'gro ba bsal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang gi sa pa la dmigs pa rnams zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su kun du 'gro ba bsal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The term “those that focus on their own level” is specified because it excludes those that are pervasive negative tendencies focusing on different realms.

original: / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pas zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su kun du 'gro ba de dag yod pas na de la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: / de la dmigs pa yang dag par zad pas zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la dmigs pa skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su kun du 'gro ba de dag yod pas na de la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “because the object is completely destroyed” means that since the object of these is the universal mental factor of the realm of homogeneity, they are called “having that as their object.”

original: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su 'gro ba rnams so //
analyzed: skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su 'gro ba rnams so //
translated: The universal mental factors of the realm of homogeneity are those that occur in the realm of homogeneity.

original: de dag zad cing spangs pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su 'gro ba de dag kun du spangs par 'gyur ro //🔽dmigs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa spangs pas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas
analyzed: de dag zad cing spangs pas skal ba mi mnyam pa'i khams su 'gro ba de dag kun du spangs par 'gyur ro // dmigs pa spangs pas zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dmigs pa 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba log par lta ba la sogs pa spangs pas lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas
translated: When the object of these is destroyed and abandoned, the universal mental factors of the realm of homogeneity are completely abandoned.

original: pa la dmigs pa de dag spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa la dmigs pa de dag spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “because the object is abandoned” means that when the object of such things as the overesteeming of mere morality and asceticism, which is the view of the reality of the perishable aggregates, is abandoned, then the overesteeming of mere morality and asceticism, which are contaminated mental factors that have that as their object, are abandoned.

original: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyen po skyes pas zad par 'gyur //
translated: The phrase “because the antidote is generated” means that when the antidote to the overesteeming of mere morality and asceticism is generated, the overesteeming of mere morality and asceticism is abandoned.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni gnyen po skyes pa kho nas zad par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni gnyen po skyes pa kho nas zad par 'gyur gyi dmigs pa yongs su shes pas ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This passage shows that those objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are exhausted by the mere arising of their antidote, but not by thorough knowledge of their focal object.🔽It will be explained below.

original: 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The explanation will be:

original: sa dang sa na @139b nyes rnams dgu //
analyzed: sa dang sa na @139b nyes rnams dgu //
translated: On each level, there are nine faults

original: de bzhin du ni yon tan rnams //🔽zhes bya ba 'di nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni yon tan rnams // zhes bya ba 'di nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: and likewise, there are nine virtues.🔽The path of complete attainment is the antidote of thorough abandonment.

original: spong ba gnyen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dgra bo'i dgra bo'i phyogs ni gnyen po yin pas spong ba gnyen po'o //
analyzed: spong ba gnyen po ni bar chad med pa'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i dgra bo'i dgra bo'i phyogs ni gnyen po yin pas spong ba gnyen po'o //
translated: The path of complete attainment is the antidote of thorough abandonment because it is the side of the enemy of the enemy of the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam yang gnyen po yin mod kyi spong ba'i ched du ni ma yin pas de'i phyir de skad du khyad par smos so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam yang gnyen po yin mod kyi spong ba'i ched du ni ma yin pas de'i phyir de skad du khyad par smos so //
translated: Although the path of liberation is also an antidote, it is not for the sake of abandonment. Therefore it is specified in this way.

original: yang na 'dis spong bar byed pas spang ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'dis spong bar byed pas spang ba yin la /
translated: Or, it is abandonment because it abandons.

original: 'di ni spong ba yang yin gnyen po yang yin pas spong ba gnyen po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni spong ba yang yin gnyen po yang yin pas spong ba gnyen po ste /
translated: It is abandonment and it is an antidote, therefore it is the antidote of abandonment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is thus:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the perseverance for subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of suffering.

original: gzhi gnyen po ni de yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam de yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa de /
analyzed: gzhi gnyen po ni de yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam de yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa de /
translated: The basis antidote is any path that is subsequent to that.

original: de ni de'i thob pa kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir spangs pa'i gzhi gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: de ni de'i thob pa kun du 'dzin pa'i phyir spangs pa'i gzhi gnyen po yin te /
translated: That is the basis antidote for the abandonment because it maintains the obtainment of that.

original: 'dis kun du 'dzin pas na gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dis kun du 'dzin pas na gzhi'o //
translated: It is a basis because it maintains.

original: de nyid gnyen po yin pas na gzhi gnyen po ste 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gong ma sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyen po yin pas na gzhi gnyen po ste 'di lta ste sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i gong ma sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'o //
translated: It is the basis antidote because it is the antidote for that. It is thus: the subsequent knowledge with regard to the truth of suffering that is subsequent to the perseverance for the knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de'i phyir rgyu gang gis de spangs pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gang gis de spangs pa'i thob pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “By what cause is the obtainment of that abandonment maintained?”

original: lam gang gis de'i thob pa kun du 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lam gang gis de'i thob pa kun du 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the path by which the obtainment of that is maintained.

original: khyad par gyi lam dang bar chad med pa'i lam gyis kyang de'i thob pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang ba'i thob pa de'i kun du 'dzin pas de yang gzhi gnyen po yin no //🔽thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi nyon mongs pa'i thob pa sring bar byed pa ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam dang bar chad med pa'i lam gyis kyang de'i thob pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang ba'i thob pa de'i kun du 'dzin pas de yang gzhi gnyen po yin no // thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi nyon mongs pa'i thob pa sring bar byed pa ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Also, the uninterrupted path is the basis of the obtainment of abandonment because it uninterruptedly obtains the obtainment of that.🔽The antidote that is a distant object is an antidote that is a distant object.

original: de nyid gnyen po yin pas na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid gnyen po yin pas na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote that is a distant object is an antidote that is a distant object.

original: yang na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ni thag bsring bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na thag bsring ba'i ngo bo ni thag bsring bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, a distant object is that which becomes distant.

original: de'i gnyen po ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po'o //
translated: The antidote to that is an antidote that is a distant object.

original: rnam par grol ba yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam sdug bsngal la chos shes pa gang yin pa de yan chad kyi lam sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de🔽ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba yan chad kyi lam gang yin pa ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam sdug bsngal la chos shes pa gang yin pa de yan chad kyi lam sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de ni thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: This teaches that the path that is subsequent to the liberated path that is the Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering is the subsequent perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re rnam par grol ba'i lam yang yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang po de yang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po zhes bya ste /🔽des kyang nyon mongs @140a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rnam par grol ba'i lam yang yin zhes bya ba ni rnam par grol ba'i lam dang po de yang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po zhes bya ste / des kyang nyon mongs @140a * //
translated: Others say: The first liberated path is also called the antidote that is a remote object.

original: pa'i thob pa de thag sring bar byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: pa'i thob pa de thag sring bar byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it also removes the obtainment of affliction.

original: de lta na rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gzhi gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po zhes bya ba ming gnyis thob bo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gzhi gnyen po dang thag bsring ba'i ngo bo gnyen po zhes bya ba ming gnyis thob bo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus the liberated path obtains the two names: the antidote that is a basis and the antidote that is a remote object.

original: khams de la skyon du mthong nas rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis khams de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sun 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams de la skyon du mthong nas rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis khams de mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sun 'byin pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Seeing the fault in that element, one rejects it means that one rejects that element in terms of impermanence, etc.

original: de lta na spong ba'i gnyen po la sogs pa sdug bsngal kun 'byung la dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na spong ba'i gnyen po la sogs pa sdug bsngal kun 'byung la dmigs pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par sun 'byin pa gnyen po yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the antidote of abandonment, etc., which focuses on the origin of suffering, would also be the antidote of rejection.

original: yang 'di dag gi go rims 'di ni chos legs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni slob dpon yin te /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi go rims 'di ni chos legs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni slob dpon yin te /
translated: The master says, In that case, the order of these is excellent,

original: them skas kyi tshul la brten pa'i phyir dang mtshan nyid ma 'chol ba'i phyir go rims ches legs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: them skas kyi tshul la brten pa'i phyir dang mtshan nyid ma 'chol ba'i phyir go rims ches legs pa yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: indicating that the order is excellent because it is based on the method of a staircase and because the characteristics are not confused.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa sbyor ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i lam kho na yin par gzung gi bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pa sbyor ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i lam kho na yin par gzung gi bar chad med pa'i lam la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The path of preparation that focuses on suffering and origin is the path of heat and so on, but it is not the uninterrupted path and so on.

original: de ni spong ba gnyen po'i ched du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni spong ba gnyen po'i ched du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is posited as the antidote that abandons.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad do zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa gzhan yang yin no ;
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad do zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba gang yin pa gzhan yang yin no ;
translated: All uninterrupted paths are the uninterrupted path that arises later.

original: ; rnam par grol ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni thams cad do zhes bya ba nyid du yang skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ; rnam par grol ba'i lam mo zhes bya ba ni thams cad do zhes bya ba nyid du yang skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The liberated path is all.

original: khyad par gyi lam ni 'dir 'di gsum las ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ni 'dir 'di gsum las ma gtogs pa gang yin pa de yin par yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The special path is that which is not included in these three.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa las ni nyon mongs pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshogs las dga' bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa las ni nyon mongs pa rnam par dbye bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni rang gi tshogs las dga' bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One cannot separate from affliction through association, because one cannot delight in one's own collection.

original: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni rnam par phye zin pa yang dngos po de la dmigs nas mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na dmigs pa las rnam par dbye bar yang nus grang na /
analyzed: re zhig ma 'ongs pa ni rnam par phye zin pa yang dngos po de la dmigs nas mi skye'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na dmigs pa las rnam par dbye bar yang nus grang na /
translated: For the time being, the future is not distinguished, but it is not the case that it arises without taking that thing as an object.

original: dngos po gang zhig la dmigs nas skyes pa'i 'das pa go ji ltar nus te /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig la dmigs nas skyes pa'i 'das pa go ji ltar nus te /
translated: But how can the past that has arisen taking a certain thing as its object be distinguished from that thing?

original: dmigs par byas pa'i dngos po dmigs pa ma yin par byas par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: dmigs par byas pa'i dngos po dmigs pa ma yin par byas par ni mi nus so //
translated: For it is not possible that the thing that is taken as an object is not taken as an object.🔽That is not so, because of the statement:

original: de yang ma nges te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
analyzed: de yang ma nges te zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yongs su shes pa dang / de la dmigs pa yang dag par //
translated: “The past is distinguished by the complete knowledge of the object and the complete abandonment of the object.”
